[I]0-i would have taken it in friendly fashion , but [he]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow drew it back , threatened a blow , and held it out again . Then [I]0-i understood [him]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow to claim the apple [I]0-i had flung away , whereupon [I]0-i made a grimace of dislike and a gesture of rejection . [He]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow answered with a howl of rage that seemed to say , " Do [you]0-i dare tell [me]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow [my]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow apple was not fit to eat ? "[618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow] " One bad apple may grow on the best tree , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . Whether [he]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow perceived [my]0-i meaning [I]0-i can not tell , but [he]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow made a stride nearer , and [I]0-i stood on [my]0-i guard . [He]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow delayed [his]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow assault , however , until [a second giant]620-a second giant , much like [him]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow , who had been stealing up behind [me]0-i , was close enough , when [he]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow rushed upon [me]0-i . [I]0-i met [him]618-a clownish , bad - looking fellow with a good blow in the face , but [the other]2867-the other struck [me]0-i on the back of the head , and between [them]622-they [I]0-i was soon overpowered . [They]622-they dragged [me]0-i into the wood above [the valley]623-the valley , where [[their]622-they tribe]624-their tribe lived — in [wretched huts]625-wretched huts , built of fallen branches and a few stones . Into one of these [they]622-they pushed [me]0-i , there threw [me]0-i on the ground , and kicked [me]0-i . [A woman]344-a woman was present , who looked on with indifference . [I]0-i may here mention that during [my]0-i captivity [I]0-i hardly learned to distinguish [the women]627-the women from [the men]161-the men , [they]627-the women differed so little . Often [I]0-i wondered whether [I]0-i had not come upon [a sort of fungoid people]629-a sort of fungoid people , with just enough mind to give [them]629-a sort of fungoid people motion and the expressions of anger and greed . [Their]629-a sort of fungoid people food , which consisted of tubers , bulbs , and fruits , was to [me]0-i inexpressibly disagreeable , but nothing offended [them]629-a sort of fungoid people so much as to show dislike to it . [I]0-i was cuffed by [the women]627-the women and kicked by [the men]161-the men because [I]0-i would not swallow it . [I]0-i lay on the floor that night hardly able to move , but [I]0-i slept a good deal , and woke a little refreshed . In the morning [they]161-the men dragged [me]0-i to [the valley]623-the valley , and tying [my]0-i feet , with a long rope , to a tree , put a flat stone with a saw - like edge in [my]0-i left hand . [I]0-i shifted it to the right ; [they]161-the men kicked [me]0-i , and put it again in the left ; gave [me]0-i to understand that [I]0-i was to scrape the bark off every branch that had no fruit on it ; kicked [me]0-i once more , and left [me]0-i . [I]0-i set about the dreary work in the hope that by satisfying [them]161-the men [I]0-i should be left very much to [myself]0-i — to make [my]0-i observations and choose [my]0-i time for escape . Happily one of the dwarf - trees grew close by [me]0-i , and every other minute [I]0-i plucked and ate a small fruit , which wonderfully refreshed and strengthened [me]0-i . [I]0-i HAD been at work but a few moments , when [I]0-i heard small voices near [me]0-i , and presently [the Little Ones]633-the little ones , as [I]0-i soon found [they]633-the little ones called [themselves]633-the little ones , came creeping out from among the tiny trees that like brushwood filled the spaces between the big ones . In a minute there were scores and scores about [me]0-i . [I]0-i made signs that [the giants]634-the giants had but just left [me]0-i , and were not far off ; but [they]634-the giants laughed , and told [me]0-i the wind was quite clean . " [They]634-the giants are too blind to see [us]2963-us , "[634-the giants] [they]634-the giants said , and laughed like a multitude of sheep - bells . [One of [the bigger girls]637-the bigger girls]636-one of the bigger girls got down on [her]636-one of the bigger girls knees to untie the clumsy knot . [They]634-the giants then made [me]0-i sit down , and fed [me]0-i with delicious little fruits ; after which [the smaller of [them]634-the giants]638-the smaller of them began to play with [me]0-i in the wildest fashion , so that it was impossible for [me]0-i to resume [my]0-i work . When [the first]639-the first grew tired , [others]2785-others took [their]2785-others places , and this went on until the sun was setting , and heavy steps were heard approaching . [The little people]641-the little people started from [me]0-i , and [I]0-i made haste to put the rope round [my]0-i ankles . " [We]641-the little people must have a care , "[642-the girl who had freed me] said [the girl who had freed [me]0-i]642-the girl who had freed me ; " a crush of one of [their]641-the little people horrid stumpy feet might kill [a very little one]2964-a very little one ! "[642-the girl who had freed me] [She]642-the girl who had freed me whistled like a bird . Now [I]0-i might at once have made [my]0-i escape ; but at length [I]0-i had [friends]647-friends , and could not think of leaving [them]647-friends . [They]647-friends were so charming , so full of winsome ways , that [I]0-i must see more of [them]647-friends ! [I]0-i must know [them]647-friends better ! " To - morrow , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i with delight , " [I]0-i shall see [them]647-friends again ! "[0-i] But from the moment there was silence in [the huts]648-the huts until [I]0-i fell asleep , [I]0-i heard [them]647-friends whispering all about [me]0-i , and knew that [I]0-i was lovingly watched by [a multitude]649-a multitude . After that , [I]0-i think [they]647-friends hardly ever left [me]0-i quite alone . [I]0-i did not come to know [the giants]634-the giants at all , and [I]0-i believe there was scarcely anything in [them]634-the giants to know . [They]634-the giants never became in the least friendly , but [they]634-the giants were much too stupid to invent cruelties . Often [I]0-i avoided a bad kick by catching the foot and giving [its owner]651-its owner a fall , upon which [he]651-its owner never , on that occasion , renewed [his]651-its owner attempt . But [the little people]641-the little people were constantly doing and saying things that pleased , often things that surprised [me]0-i . Every day [I]0-i grew more loath to leave [them]647-friends . While [I]0-i was at work , [they]647-friends would keep coming and going , amusing and delighting [me]0-i , and taking all the misery , and much of the weariness out of [my]0-i monotonous toil . Very soon [I]0-i loved [them]647-friends more than [I]0-i can tell . [They]647-friends did not know much , but [they]647-friends were very wise , and seemed capable of learning anything . [I]0-i had no bed save the bare ground , but almost as often as [I]0-i woke , it was in a nest of [children]599-children — one or other of [them]599-children in [my]0-i arms , though which [I]0-i seldom could tell until the light came , for [they]647-friends ordered the succession among [themselves]647-friends . When one crept into [my]0-i bosom , unconsciously [I]0-i clasped [him]654-him there , and [the rest]655-the rest lay close around [me]0-i , the smaller nearer . It is hardly necessary to say that [I]0-i did not suffer much from the nightly cold ! The first thing [they]647-friends did in the morning , and the last before sunset , was to bring [the good giant]656-the good giant plenty to eat . Before long [I]0-i began to perceive in [two or three of [the smaller children]683-the smaller children]682-two or three of the smaller children some traces of greed and selfishness , and noted that [the bigger girls]637-the bigger girls cast on these a not infrequent glance of anxiety . [None of [them]637-the bigger girls]685-none of them put a hand to [my]0-i work : [they]637-the bigger girls would do nothing for [the giants]634-the giants ! But [they]637-the bigger girls never relaxed [their]637-the bigger girls loving ministrations to [me]0-i . [They]637-the bigger girls would sing to [me]0-i , one after another , for hours ; climb the tree to reach [my]0-i mouth and pop fruit into it with [their]637-the bigger girls dainty little fingers ; and [they]637-the bigger girls kept constant watch against the approach of [a giant]2958-a giant . Sometimes [they]637-the bigger girls would sit and tell [me]0-i stories — mostly very childish , and often seeming to mean hardly anything . Now and then [they]637-the bigger girls would call a general assembly to amuse [me]0-i . On one such occasion [a moody little fellow]688-a moody little fellow sang [me]0-i a strange crooning song , with a refrain so pathetic that , although unintelligible to [me]0-i , it caused the tears to run down [my]0-i face . This phenomenon made [those who saw it]689-those who saw it regard [me]0-i with much perplexity . Then first [I]0-i bethought [myself]0-i that [I]0-i had not once , in [that world]309-that world , looked on water , falling or lying or running . Plenty there had been in some long vanished age — that was plain enough — but [the Little Ones]633-the little ones had never seen any before [they]633-the little ones saw [my]0-i tears ! [They]633-the little ones had , nevertheless , it seemed , some dim , instinctive perception of [their]633-the little ones origin ; for [a very small child]692-a very small child went up to [the singer]693-the singer , shook [his]692-a very small child clenched pud in [his]692-a very small child face , and said something like this : " ' Ou skeeze [ze]3003-ze juice out of [ze good giant]3004-ze good giant 's seeberries ! "[692-a very small child] " How is it , "[0-i] [I]0-i said one day to [Lona]44-lona , as [she]44-lona sat with [the baby]673-the baby in [her]44-lona arms at the foot of [[my]0-i tree]695-my tree , " that [I]44-lona never see [any children among the giants]3006-any children among the giants ? "[44-lona] [She]44-lona stared a little , as if looking in vain for some sense in the question , then replied , " [They]633-the little ones are [giants]3007-giants ; there are [no little ones]3008-no little ones . "[44-lona] " Have [they]633-the little ones never [any children]3009-any children ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " No ; there are never any in the wood for [them]633-the little ones . [They]633-the little ones do not love [them]633-the little ones . If [they]633-the little ones saw [ours]3010-we , [they]633-the little ones would stamp [them]633-the little ones . "[44-lona] " Is there always the same number of [the giants]634-the giants then ? [I]696-i thought , before [I]696-i had time to know better , that [they]634-the giants were [[your]696-i fathers]3012-your fathers and [mothers]3013-mothers . "[696-i] [She]696-i burst into the merriest laughter , and said , " No , [good giant]2959-good giant ; [we]3010-we are [[their]634-the giants firsters]3015-their firsters . "[696-i] But as [she]696-i said it , the merriment died out of [her]696-i , and [she]696-i looked scared . [I]0-i stopped working , and gazed at [her]696-i , bewildered . " How can that be ? "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed . " [I]696-i do not say ; [I]696-i do not understand , "[696-i] [she]696-i answered . " But [we]3010-we were here and [they]634-the giants not . [They]634-the giants go from [us]3010-we . [I]696-i am sorry , but [we]3010-we can not help it . [They]634-the giants could have helped it . "[696-i] " How long have [you]696-i been here ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , more and more puzzled — in the hope of some side - light on the matter . " Always , [I]696-i think , "[696-i] [she]696-i replied . " [I]696-i think [somebody]249-somebody made [us]3010-we always . "[696-i] [I]0-i turned to [[my]0-i scraping]697-my scraping . [She]696-i saw [I]0-i did not understand . " [The giants]634-the giants were not made always , "[696-i] [she]696-i resumed . " If [a Little One]3018-a little one does n't care , [he]3018-a little one grows greedy , and then lazy , and then big , and then stupid , and then bad . [The dull creatures]3019-the dull creatures do n't know that [they]3019-the dull creatures come from [us]3010-we . [Very few of [them]3019-the dull creatures]3020-very few of them believe [we]3010-we are anywhere . [They]3019-the dull creatures say Nonsense!—Look at [little Blunty]46-blunty : [he]3018-a little one is eating one of [their]3019-the dull creatures apples ! [He]3018-a little one will be the next ! Oh ! oh ! [he]3018-a little one will soon be big and bad and ugly , and not know it ! "[696-i] [The child]698-the child stood by [himself]698-the child a little way off , eating an apple nearly as big as [his]698-the child head . [I]0-i had often thought [he]698-the child did not look so good as the rest ; now [he]698-the child looked disgusting . " [I]0-i will take the horrid thing from [him]698-the child ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " It is no use , "[699-i] [she]699-i answered sadly . " [We]3010-we have done all [we]3010-we can , and it is too late ! [We]3010-we were afraid [he]698-the child was growing , for [he]698-the child would not believe anything told [him]698-the child ; but when [he]698-the child refused to share [his]698-the child berries , and said [he]698-the child had gathered them for [himself]698-the child , then [we]3010-we knew it ! [He]698-the child is a glutton , and there is no hope of him.—It makes [me]699-i sick to see [him]698-the child eat ! "[699-i] " Could not some of [the boys]3021-the boys watch [him]698-the child , and not let [him]698-the child touch the poisonous things ? "[699-i] " [He]698-the child may have them if [he]698-the child will : it is all one — to eat the apples , and to be [a boy that would eat them if [he]698-the child could]3022-a boy that would eat them if he could . No ; [he]698-the child must go to [the giants]634-the giants ! [He]698-the child belongs to [them]634-the giants . [You]3024-you can see how much bigger [he]698-the child is than when first [you]3024-you came ! [He]698-the child is bigger since yesterday . "[699-i] " [He]698-the child is as like that hideous green lump in [his]698-the child hand as [boy]2977-boy could look ! "[699-i] " It suits what [he]698-the child is making [himself]698-the child . "[699-i] " [His]698-the child head and it might change places ! "[699-i] " Perhaps [they]634-the giants do ! "[699-i] " Does [he]698-the child want to be [a giant]2958-a giant ? "[699-i] " [He]698-the child hates [the giants]634-the giants , but [he]698-the child is making [himself]698-the child one all the same : [he]698-the child likes [their]634-the giants apples ! Oh baby , [baby]3028-baby , [he]698-the child was just such a darling as [you]3028-baby when [we]3029-we found [him]698-the child ! "[699-i] " [He]698-the child will be very miserable when [he]698-the child finds [himself]698-the child [a giant]2958-a giant ! "[699-i] " Oh , no ; [he]698-the child will like it well enough ! That is the worst of it . "[699-i] " Will [he]698-the child hate [the Little Ones]47-the little ones ? "[699-i] " [He]698-the child will be like [the rest]655-the rest ; [he]698-the child will not remember [us]3029-we — most likely will not believe there are [Little Ones]47-the little ones . [He]698-the child will not care ; [he]698-the child will eat [his]698-the child apples . "[699-i] " Do tell [me]699-i how it will come about . [I]699-i understand [[your]3028-baby world]2679-your world so little ! [I]699-i come from a world where everything is different . "[699-i] " [I]699-i do not know about world . What is it ? What more but a word in [your]3028-baby beautiful big mouth?—That makes it something ! "[699-i] " Never mind about the word ; tell [me]699-i what next will happen to [Blunty]46-blunty . "[699-i] " [He]698-the child will wake one morning and find [himself]698-the child [a giant]2958-a giant — not like [you]3028-baby , [good giant]2959-good giant , but like [any other bad giant]3035-any other bad giant . [You]3028-baby will hardly know [him]698-the child , but [I]699-i will tell [you]3028-baby which . [The giants]634-the giants have lost [themselves]634-the giants , [Peony]48-peony says , and that is why [they]634-the giants never smile . [I]699-i wonder whether [they]634-the giants are not glad because [they]634-the giants are bad , or bad because [they]634-the giants are not glad . But [they]634-the giants ca n't be glad when [they]634-the giants have [no babies]3040-no babies ! [I]699-i wonder what bad means , [good giant]2959-good giant ! "[699-i] " [I]699-i wish [I]699-i knew no more about it than [you]700-you ! "[699-i] [I]0-i returned . " But [I]0-i try to be good , and mean to keep on trying . "[0-i] " So do [I]699-i — and that is how [I]699-i know [you]700-you are good . "[699-i] A long pause followed . " Then [you]700-you do not know where [the babies]2984-the babies come from into the wood ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said , making one attempt more . "[700-you] " Then how is it [you]700-you never find one before it is quite grown ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " It is a pity the little sillies ca n't speak till [they]2984-the babies 've forgotten everything [they]2984-the babies had to tell ! "[0-i] [I]0-i remarked . " [Little Tolma]49-little tolma , [the last before this baby]3044-the last before this baby , looked as if [she]49-little tolma had something to tell , when [I]0-i found [her]49-little tolma under a beech - tree , sucking [her]49-little tolma thumb , but [she]49-little tolma had n't . [She]49-little tolma only looked up at [me]0-i — oh , so sweetly ! [She]49-little tolma will never go bad and grow big ! When [they]2984-the babies begin to grow big [they]2984-the babies care for nothing but bigness ; and when [they]2984-the babies can not grow any bigger , [they]2984-the babies try to grow fatter . [The bad giants]2993-the bad giants are very proud of being fat . "[0-i] " So [they]2984-the babies are in [[my]0-i world]3046-my world , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " only [they]2984-the babies do not say fat there , [they]2984-the babies say rich . "[0-i] " In [one of [[their]2984-the babies houses]3048-their houses]3047-one of their houses , "[44-lona] continued [Lona]44-lona , " sits [the biggest and fattest of [them]2984-the babies]3049-the biggest and fattest of them — so proud that [nobody]149-nobody can see [him]3049-the biggest and fattest of them ; and [the giants]634-the giants go to [[his]3049-the biggest and fattest of them house]3052-his house at certain times , and call out to [him]3049-the biggest and fattest of them , and tell [him]3049-the biggest and fattest of them how fat [he]3049-the biggest and fattest of them is , and beg [him]3049-the biggest and fattest of them to make [them]634-the giants strong to eat more and grow fat like [him]3049-the biggest and fattest of them . "[44-lona] The rumour at length reached [my]0-i ears that [Blunty]46-blunty had vanished . [I]0-i saw a few grave faces among [the bigger ones]701-the bigger ones , but [he]46-blunty did not seem to be much missed . The next morning [Lona]44-lona came to [me]0-i and whispered , " Look ! look there — by that quince - tree : that is the giant that was Blunty!—Would [you]0-i have known [him]46-blunty ? "[44-lona] " Never , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " — But now [you]44-lona tell [me]0-i , [I]0-i could fancy it might be [Blunty]46-blunty staring through a fog ! [He]46-blunty does look stupid ! "[0-i] " [He]46-blunty is for ever eating those apples now ! "[44-lona] [she]44-lona said . " That is what comes of Little Ones that wo n't be little ! "[44-lona] " [They]3053-they call it growing - up in [[my]0-i world]3046-my world ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i . " If only [she]44-lona would teach [me]0-i to grow the other way , and become a Little One!—Shall [I]0-i ever be able to laugh like [them]3053-they ? "[0-i] [I]0-i had had the chance , and had flung it from [me]0-i ! [Blunty]46-blunty and [I]0-i were alike ! [He]46-blunty did not know [his]46-blunty loss , and [I]0-i had to be taught [mine]0-i ! FOR a time [I]0-i had no desire save to spend [my]0-i life with [the Little Ones]47-the little ones . But soon other thoughts and feelings began to influence [me]0-i . First awoke the vague sense that [I]0-i ought to be doing something ; that [I]0-i was not meant for the fattening of boors ! Then it came to [me]0-i that [I]0-i was in [a marvellous world]702-a marvellous world , of which it was assuredly [my]0-i business to discover the ways and laws ; and that , if [I]0-i would do anything in return for [the children]2965-the children 's goodness , [I]0-i must learn more about [them]2965-the children than [they]2965-the children could tell [me]0-i , and to that end must be free . Surely , [I]0-i thought , no suppression of [their]2965-the children growth can be essential to [their]2965-the children loveliness and truth and purity ! Not in [any world]570-any world could the possibility exist of such a discord between constitution and its natural outcome ! Life and law can not be so at variance that perfection must be gained by thwarting development ! But the growth of [the Little Ones]47-the little ones was arrested ! something interfered with it : what was it ? [Lona]44-lona seemed [the eldest of [them]47-the little ones , yet not more than fifteen , and had been long in charge of a multitude , in semblance and mostly in [behaviour merest children]706-behaviour merest children , who regarded [her]44-lona as [[their]47-the little ones mother]660-their mother]705-the eldest of them , yet not more than fifteen , and had been long in charge of a multitude , in semblance and mostly in behaviour merest children , who regarded her as their mother ! Were [they]47-the little ones growing at all ? [I]0-i doubted it . Of time [they]47-the little ones had scarcely the idea ; of [their]47-the little ones own age [they]47-the little ones knew nothing ! [Lona]44-lona [herself]44-lona thought [she]44-lona had lived always ! Full of wisdom and empty of knowledge , [she]44-lona was at once [their]47-the little ones Love and [their]47-the little ones Law ! But what seemed to [me]0-i [her]44-lona ignorance might in truth be [my]0-i own lack of insight ! [Her]44-lona one anxiety plainly was , that [her]44-lona Little Ones should not grow , and change into [bad giants]708-bad giants ! [[Their]47-the little ones " good giant]3055-their " good giant "[709-his] was bound to do [his]709-his best for [them]47-the little ones : without more knowledge of [their]47-the little ones nature , and some knowledge of [their]47-the little ones history , [he]709-his could do nothing , and must therefore leave [them]47-the little ones ! [They]47-the little ones would only be as [they]47-the little ones were before ; [they]47-the little ones had in no way become dependent on [me]0-i ; [they]47-the little ones were still [[my]0-i protectors]710-my protectors , [I]0-i was not [theirs]47-the little ones ; [my]0-i presence but brought [them]47-the little ones more in danger of [[their]47-the little ones idiotic neighbours]711-their idiotic neighbours ! [I]0-i longed to teach [them]47-the little ones many things : [I]0-i must first understand more of those [I]0-i would teach ! Knowledge no doubt made [bad people]712-bad people worse , but it must make [good people]482-good people better ! [I]0-i was convinced [they]47-the little ones would learn mathematics ; and might [they]47-the little ones not be taught to write down the dainty melodies [they]47-the little ones murmured and forgot ? The conclusion was , that [I]0-i must rise and continue [my]0-i travels , in the hope of coming upon some elucidation of the fortunes and destiny of [the bewitching little creatures]714-the bewitching little creatures . [My]0-i design , however , would not so soon have passed into action , but for what now occurred . To prepare [them]47-the little ones for [my]0-i temporary absence , [I]0-i was one day telling [them]47-the little ones while at work that [I]0-i would long ago have left [the bad giants]2993-the bad giants , but that [I]0-i loved [the Little Ones]47-the little ones so much — when , as by one accord , [they]47-the little ones came rushing and crowding upon [me]0-i ; [they]47-the little ones scrambled over [each other]2772-each other and up the tree and dropped on [my]0-i head , until [I]0-i was nearly smothered . With [three very little ones]717-three very little ones in [my]0-i arms , one on each shoulder clinging to [my]0-i neck , one standing straight up on [my]0-i head , four or five holding [me]0-i fast by the legs , others grappling [my]0-i body and arms , and [a multitude climbing and descending upon these]718-a multitude climbing and descending upon these , [I]0-i was helpless as [one overwhelmed by lava]719-one overwhelmed by lava . Absorbed in the merry struggle , not one of [them]47-the little ones saw [my]0-i tyrant coming until [he]720-he was almost upon [me]0-i . With just one cry of " Take care , [good giant]2959-good giant ! "[47-the little ones] [they]47-the little ones ran from [me]0-i like mice , [they]47-the little ones dropped from [me]0-i like hedgehogs , [they]47-the little ones flew from [me]0-i up the tree like squirrels , and the same moment , sharp round the stem came [the bad giant]721-the bad giant , and dealt [me]0-i such a blow on the head with a stick that [I]0-i fell to the ground . [The children]2965-the children told [me]0-i afterward that [they]2965-the children sent [him]721-the bad giant " such a many bumps of big apples and stones "[2965-the children] that [he]721-the bad giant was frightened , and ran blundering [home]2676-home . When [I]0-i came to [myself]0-i it was night . Above [me]0-i were a few pale stars that expected the moon . [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was alone . [My]0-i head ached badly , and [I]0-i was terribly athirst . [I]0-i turned wearily on [my]0-i side . The moment [my]0-i ear touched the ground , [I]0-i heard the gushing and gurgling of water , and the soft noises made [me]0-i groan with longing . At once [I]0-i was amid [a multitude of silent children]724-a multitude of silent children , and delicious little fruits began to visit [my]0-i lips . [They]724-a multitude of silent children came and came until [my]0-i thirst was gone . Then [I]0-i was aware of sounds [I]0-i had never heard there before ; the air was full of little sobs . [I]0-i tried to sit up . A pile of small bodies instantly heaped itself at [my]0-i back . Then [I]0-i struggled to [my]0-i feet , with much pushing and pulling from [the Little Ones , who were wonderfully strong for [their]725-the little ones , who were wonderfully strong for their size size]725-the little ones , who were wonderfully strong for their size . " [You]0-i must go away , [good giant]2959-good giant , "[725-the little ones , who were wonderfully strong for their size] [they]725-the little ones , who were wonderfully strong for their size said . " [I]726-one of the bigger boys listened at [his]2993-the bad giants door , "[726-one of the bigger boys] said [one of [the bigger boys]727-the bigger boys]726-one of the bigger boys , " and heard [the bad giant]721-the bad giant say to [[his]2993-the bad giants wife]358-his wife that [he]2993-the bad giants had found [you]0-i idle , talking to a lot of moles and squirrels , and when [he]2993-the bad giants beat [you]0-i , [they]725-the little ones , who were wonderfully strong for their size tried to kill [him]2993-the bad giants . [He]2993-the bad giants said [you]0-i were [a wizard]3061-a wizard , and [they]725-the little ones , who were wonderfully strong for their size must knock [you]0-i , or [they]725-the little ones , who were wonderfully strong for their size would have no peace . "[726-one of the bigger boys] " [I]0-i will go at once , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " and come back as soon as [I]0-i have found out what is wanted to make [you]728-they bigger and stronger . "[0-i] " [We]728-they do n't want to be bigger , "[728-they] [they]728-they answered , looking very serious . " [We]728-they wo n't grow bad giants!—We are strong now ; [you]0-i do n't know how much strong ! "[728-they] It was no use holding [them]728-they out a prospect that had not any attraction for [them]728-they ! [I]0-i said nothing more , but rose and moved slowly up [the slope of [the valley]623-the valley]729-the slope of the valley . At once [they]728-they formed [themselves]728-they into a long procession ; [some]2784-some led the way , [some]2784-some walked with [me]0-i helping [me]0-i , and [the rest]655-the rest followed . [They]728-they kept feeding [me]0-i as [we]734-we went . " [You]0-i are broken , "[728-they] [they]728-they said , " and much red juice has run out of [you]0-i : put some in . "[728-they] When [we]734-we reached [the edge of [the valley]623-the valley]735-the edge of the valley , there was the moon just lifting [her]737-she forehead over the rim of the horizon . " [She]737-she has come to take care of [you]0-i , and show [you]0-i the way , "[44-lona] said [Lona]44-lona . When [I]0-i asked if it was [a city]610-a city , [they]728-they said [they]728-they did not know . Neither could [they]728-they tell how far off , or in what direction it was , or what was [the giant - girl]742-the giant - girl 's name ; all [they]728-they knew was , that [she]737-she hated [the Little Ones]633-the little ones , and would like to kill [them]633-the little ones , only [she]737-she could not find [them]633-the little ones . [I]0-i asked how [they]728-they knew that ; [Lona]44-lona answered that [she]44-lona had always known it . If [the giant - girl]742-the giant - girl came to look for [them]633-the little ones , [they]633-the little ones must hide hard , [she]737-she said . When [I]0-i told [them]728-they [I]0-i should go and ask [her]737-she why [she]737-she hated [them]728-they , [they]728-they cried out , " No , no ! "[728-they] [I]0-i asked [them]728-they where [I]0-i was to go then . " [We]728-they have never gone so far from [our]728-they trees before , "[728-they] [they]728-they said . " Now mind [you]0-i watch how [you]0-i go , that [you]0-i may see inside [your]0-i eyes how to come back to [us]728-they . "[728-they] " And beware of [the giant - woman that lives in [the desert]3065-the desert]3064-the giant - woman that lives in the desert , "[636-one of the bigger girls] said [one of [the bigger girls]637-the bigger girls]636-one of the bigger girls as [they]728-they were turning , " [I]636-one of the bigger girls suppose [you]0-i have heard of [her]3064-the giant - woman that lives in the desert ! "[636-one of the bigger girls] " No , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " Then take care not to go near [her]3064-the giant - woman that lives in the desert . [She]3064-the giant - woman that lives in the desert is called [the Cat - woman]3066-the cat - woman . [She]3064-the giant - woman that lives in the desert is awfully ugly — and scratches . "[0-i] As soon as [the bigger ones]701-the bigger ones stopped , [the smaller]753-the smaller had begun to run back . [The others]754-the others now looked at [me]0-i gravely for a moment , and then walked slowly away . Last to leave [me]0-i , [Lona]44-lona held up [the baby]673-the baby to be kissed , gazed in [my]0-i eyes , whispered , " [The Cat - woman]3066-the cat - woman will not hurt [you]0-i , "[44-lona] and went without another word . [I]0-i stood a while , gazing after [them]728-they through the moonlight , then turned and , with a heavy heart , began [my]0-i solitary journey . Soon the laughter of [the Little Ones]633-the little ones overtook [me]0-i , like sheep - bells innumerable , rippling the air , and echoing in the rocks about [me]0-i . [I]0-i turned again , and again gazed after [them]728-they : [they]728-they went gamboling along , with never a care in [their]728-they sweet souls . But [Lona]44-lona walked apart with [[her]44-lona baby]757-her baby . Pondering as [I]0-i went , [I]0-i recalled many traits of [[my]0-i little friends]619-my little friends . Once when [I]0-i suggested that [they]728-they should leave [the country of [the bad giants]2993-the bad giants]759-the country of the bad giants , and go with [me]0-i to find another , [they]728-they answered , " But that would be to not ourselves!"—so[728-they] strong in [them]728-they was the love of place that [[their]728-they country]761-their country seemed essential to [their]728-they very being ! Without ambition or fear , discomfort or greed , [they]728-they had no motive to desire any change ; [they]728-they knew of nothing amiss ; and , except [[their]728-they babies]762-their babies , [they]728-they had never had a chance of helping [any one]2700-any one but myself:—How were [they]728-they to grow ? But again , Why should [they]728-they grow ? In seeking to improve [their]728-they conditions , might [I]0-i not do [them]728-they harm , and only harm ? To enlarge [their]728-they minds after the notions of [[my]0-i world]3046-my world — might it not be to distort and weaken [them]728-they ? [Their]728-they fear of growth as a possible start for gianthood might be instinctive ! The part of [philanthropist]765-philanthropist is indeed a dangerous one ; and [the man who would do [his]766-the man who would do his neighbour neighbour]766-the man who would do his neighbour good must first study how not to do [him]766-the man who would do his neighbour evil , and must begin by pulling the beam out of [his]766-the man who would do his neighbour own eye . [I]0-i TRAVELLED on attended by the moon . As usual [she]767-her was full — [I]0-i had never seen [her]767-her other — and to - night as [she]767-her sank [I]0-i thought [I]0-i perceived something like a smile on [her]767-her countenance . When [her]767-her under edge was a little below the horizon , there appeared in the middle of [her]767-her disc , as if it had been painted upon it , [a cottage]768-a cottage , through the open door and window of which [she]767-her shone ; and with the sight came the conviction that [I]0-i was expected [there]204-there . Almost immediately the moon was gone , and [the cottage]340-the cottage had vanished ; the night was rapidly growing dark , and [my]0-i way being across a close succession of [small ravines]771-small ravines , [I]0-i resolved to remain where [I]0-i was and expect the morning . [I]0-i stretched [myself]0-i , therefore , in [a sandy hollow]772-a sandy hollow , made [my]0-i supper off the fruits [the children]2965-the children had given [me]0-i at parting , and was soon asleep . [I]0-i woke suddenly , saw above [me]0-i constellations unknown to [[my]0-i former world]305-my former world , and had lain for a while gazing at them , when [I]0-i became aware of a figure seated on the ground a little way from and above [me]0-i . [I]0-i was startled , as [one]2690-one is on discovering all at once that [one]2690-one is not alone . The figure was between [me]0-i and the sky , so that [I]0-i saw its outline well . From where [I]0-i lay low in [the hollow]597-the hollow , it seemed larger than human . [It]778-it moved its head , and then first [I]0-i saw that its back was toward [me]0-i . " Will [you]0-i not come with [me]344-a woman ? "[344-a woman] said a sweet , mellow voice , unmistakably [a woman]344-a woman 's . Where would [you]344-a woman have [me]0-i go ? [I]0-i like sleeping in the open air . "[0-i] " There is no hurt in the air , "[344-a woman] [she]344-a woman returned ; " but the creatures that roam the night in these parts are not such as [a man]109-a man would willingly have about [him]109-a man while [he]109-a man sleeps . "[344-a woman] " [I]0-i have not been disturbed , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " No ; [I]0-i have been sitting by [you]344-a woman ever since [you]344-a woman lay down . "[0-i] " That is very kind of [you]0-i ! How came [you]0-i to know [I]344-a woman was here ? Why do [you]0-i show [me]344-a woman such favour ? "[782-me] " [I]0-i suppose , [madam]3076-madam , [you]3076-madam live in [the cottage]340-the cottage [I]0-i saw in [the heart of the moon]3078-the heart of the moon ? "[0-i] " [I]784-her do . "[784-her] [Her]784-her voice entered into [me]0-i , and made [me]0-i feel strangely still . " [I]0-i will go with [you]784-her , [madam]3076-madam , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , rising . [She]784-her rose at once , and without a glance behind [her]784-her led the way . [I]0-i could see [her]784-her just well enough to follow . [She]784-her was taller than [myself]0-i , but not so tall as [I]0-i had thought [her]784-her . That [she]784-her never turned [her]784-her face to [me]0-i made [me]0-i curious — nowise apprehensive , [her]784-her voice rang so true . But how was [I]0-i to fit [her]784-her with a name who could not see [her]784-her ? [I]0-i strove to get alongside of [her]784-her , but failed : when [I]0-i quickened [my]0-i pace [she]784-her quickened [hers]784-her , and kept easily ahead of [me]0-i . "[0-i] " There is [a city in [that grassy land]3096-that grassy land]3095-a city in that grassy land , "[787-she] [she]787-she replied , " where [a woman]344-a woman is [princess]3098-princess . [The city]3099-the city is called [Bulika]6-bulika . But certainly [the princess]3100-the princess is not [a girl]3101-a girl ! [She]3100-the princess is older than [this world]226-this world , and came to [it]226-this world from [yours]3103-yours — with a terrible history , which is not over yet . [She]3100-the princess is [an evil person]3104-an evil person , and prevails much with [the Prince of the Power of the Air]3105-the prince of the power of the air . [The people of [Bulika]6-bulika]3106-the people of bulika were formerly [simple folk , tilling the ground and pasturing sheep]3107-simple folk , tilling the ground and pasturing sheep . [She]787-she came among [them]3106-the people of bulika , and [they]3106-the people of bulika received [her]787-she hospitably . [She]787-she taught [them]3106-the people of bulika to dig for diamonds and opals and sell [them]3106-the people of bulika to [strangers]3108-strangers , and made [them]3106-the people of bulika give up tillage and pasturage and build [a city]610-a city . One day [they]3106-the people of bulika found a huge snake and killed it ; which so enraged [her]787-she that [she]787-she declared [herself]787-she [[their]3106-the people of bulika princess]3110-their princess , and became terrible to [them]3106-the people of bulika . The name of [the country]454-the country at that time was [The Land of Waters]3112-the land of waters ; for the dry channels , of which [you]3113-you have crossed so many , were then overflowing with live torrents ; and [the valley]623-the valley , where now [the Bags]50-the stupid bags and [the Lovers]3115-the lovers have [their]3115-the lovers fruit - trees , was [a lake that received a great part of [them]3106-the people of bulika]3116-a lake that received a great part of them . But [the wicked princess]3117-the wicked princess gathered up in [her]3117-the wicked princess lap what [she]3117-the wicked princess could of the water over [the whole country]3118-the whole country , closed it in an egg , and carried it away . [Her]3117-the wicked princess lap , however , would not hold more than half of it ; and the instant [she]3117-the wicked princess was gone , what [she]3117-the wicked princess had not yet taken fled away underground , leaving [the country]454-the country as dry and dusty as [her]3117-the wicked princess own heart . Were it not for the waters under [it]454-the country , every living thing would long ago have perished from it . For where no water is , no rain falls ; and where no rain falls , [no springs]3120-no springs rise . Ever since then , [the princess]3100-the princess has lived in [Bulika]6-bulika , holding [the inhabitants]3122-the inhabitants in constant terror , and doing what [she]3100-the princess can to keep [them]3122-the inhabitants from multiplying . Yet [they]3122-the inhabitants boast and believe [themselves]3122-the inhabitants a prosperous , and certainly are [a self - satisfied people]3123-a self - satisfied people — good at bargaining and buying , good at selling and cheating ; holding well together for a common interest , and utterly treacherous where interests clash ; proud of [[their]3122-the inhabitants princess]3110-their princess and [her]3100-the princess power , and despising every one [they]3122-the inhabitants get the better of ; never doubting [themselves]3122-the inhabitants the most honourable of all [the nations]3125-the nations , and [each man]3126-each man counting [himself]3126-each man better than [any other]3127-any other . The depth of [their]3122-the inhabitants worthlessness and height of [their]3122-the inhabitants vainglory [no one]134-no one can understand who has not been there to see , who has not learned to know [the miserable misgoverned and self - deceived creatures]3129-the miserable misgoverned and self - deceived creatures . "[787-she] " [I]348-the woman thank [you]348-the woman , [madam]3076-madam . [I]348-the woman long heartily to serve [them]47-the little ones . Who and what are [they]47-the little ones ? and how do [they]47-the little ones come to be [there]204-there ? "[348-the woman] " In [Bulika]6-bulika [you]348-the woman may , perhaps , get some light on those matters . There is an ancient poem in [the library of [the palace]3135-the palace]3134-the library of the palace , [I]787-she am told , which of course [no one there]3136-no one there can read , but in which it is plainly written that after [the Lovers]3115-the lovers have gone through great troubles and learned [their]3115-the lovers own name , [they]3115-the lovers will fill [the land]3138-the land , and make [the giants]634-the giants [[their]3115-the lovers slaves]3140-their slaves . "[787-she] " By that time [they]47-the little ones will have grown a little , will [they]47-the little ones not ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " Yes , [they]47-the little ones will have grown ; yet [I]0-i think too [they]47-the little ones will not have grown . It is possible to grow and not to grow , to grow less and to grow bigger , both at once — yes , even to grow by means of not growing ! "[0-i] " [Your]348-the woman words are strange , [madam]3076-madam ! "[0-i] [I]0-i rejoined . " But [I]0-i have heard it said that some words , because they mean more , appear to mean less ! "[0-i] " That is true , and such words have to be understood . It were well for [the princess of [Bulika]6-bulika]3142-the princess of bulika if [she]3142-the princess of bulika heard what the very silence of [the land]3138-the land is shouting in [her]3142-the princess of bulika ears all day long ! But [she]3142-the princess of bulika is far too clever to understand anything . "[0-i] " Then [I]0-i suppose , when [the little Lovers]3144-the little lovers are grown , [[their]3144-the little lovers land]3145-their land will have water again ? "[0-i] " Not exactly so : when [they]47-the little ones are thirsty enough , [they]47-the little ones will have water , and when [they]47-the little ones have water , [they]47-the little ones will grow . To grow , [they]47-the little ones must have water . And , beneath , it is flowing still . "[0-i] " [I]0-i have heard that water twice , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " — once when [I]0-i lay down to wait for the moon — and when [I]0-i woke the sun was shining ! and once when [I]0-i fell , all but killed by [the bad giant]721-the bad giant . Both times came the voices of the water , and healed [me]0-i . "[0-i] [The woman]348-the woman never turned [her]348-the woman head , and kept always a little before [me]0-i , but [I]0-i could hear every word that left [her]348-the woman lips , and [her]348-the woman voice much reminded [me]0-i of [the woman]348-the woman 's in [the house of death]793-the house of death . Much of what [she]348-the woman said , [I]0-i did not understand , and therefore can not remember . But [I]0-i forgot that [I]0-i had ever been afraid of [her]348-the woman . [We]794-we went on and on , and crossed yet [a wide tract of sand]795-a wide tract of sand before reaching [the cottage]340-the cottage . [Its]340-the cottage foundation stood in deep sand , but [I]0-i could see that it was a rock . In character [the cottage]340-the cottage resembled [the sexton]357-the sexton 's , but had thicker walls . The door , which was heavy and strong , opened immediately into [a large bare room]799-a large bare room , which had [two little windows opposite each other , without glass]800-two little windows opposite each other , without glass . [[My]0-i hostess]780-my hostess walked in at the open door out of which the moon had looked , and going straight to the farthest corner took a long white cloth from the floor , and wound it about [her]348-the woman head and face . Then [she]780-my hostess closed the other door , in at which the moon had looked , trimmed a small horn lantern that stood on the hearth , and turned to receive [me]0-i . " [You]0-i are very welcome , [Mr. Vane]27-mr. vane ! "[780-my hostess] [she]780-my hostess said , calling [me]0-i by the name [I]0-i had forgotten . " [Your]0-i entertainment will be scanty , but , as the night is not far spent , and the day not at hand , it is better [you]0-i should be [indoors]3147-indoors . Here [you]0-i will be safe , and a little lack is not a great misery . "[780-my hostess] " [I]0-i thank [you]780-my hostess heartily , [madam]3076-madam , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied .
