"[0-i] " [My]780-my hostess name is [Mara]36-mara , "[780-my hostess] [she]780-my hostess answered . Then [I]0-i remembered [the sexton]357-the sexton and the little black cat . " [Some people]3149-some people , "[780-my hostess] [she]780-my hostess went on , " take [me]780-my hostess for [[Lot]51-lot 's wife]3150-lot 's wife , lamenting over Sodom ; and [some]2784-some think [I]780-my hostess am [Rachel]52-rachel , weeping for [[her]52-rachel children]3152-her children ; but [I]780-my hostess am neither of those . "[780-my hostess] " [I]0-i thank [you]780-my hostess again , [Mara]36-mara , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " — May [I]0-i lie here on [your]780-my hostess floor till the morning ? "[0-i] " At the top of [that stair]3153-that stair , "[780-my hostess] [she]780-my hostess answered , " [you]0-i will find a bed — on which [some]2784-some have slept better than [they]2784-some expected , and [some]2784-some have waked all the night and slept all the next day . It is not a very soft one , but it is better than the sand — and there are no hyenas sniffing about it ! "[780-my hostess] The stair , narrow and steep , led straight up from [the room]126-the room to [an unceiled and unpartitioned garret]804-an unceiled and unpartitioned garret , with one wide , low dormer window . Close under the sloping roof stood a narrow bed , the sight of which with [its]805-its white coverlet made [me]0-i shiver , so vividly it recalled the couches in [the chamber of death]806-the chamber of death . On the table was a dry loaf , and beside it a cup of cold water . To [me]0-i , [who had tasted nothing but fruit for months]807-who had tasted nothing but fruit for months , they were a feast . " [I]780-my hostess must leave [you]0-i in the dark , "[780-my hostess] [[my]0-i hostess]780-my hostess called from the bottom of the stair . " This lantern is all the light [I]780-my hostess have , and there are things to do tonight . "[780-my hostess] " It is of no consequence , thank [you]780-my hostess , [madam]3076-madam , "[0-i] [I]0-i returned . " To eat and drink , to lie down and sleep , are things that can be done in the dark . "[0-i] " Rest in peace , "[780-my hostess] [she]780-my hostess said . [I]0-i ate up the loaf , drank the water every drop , and laid [myself]0-i down . The bed was hard , the covering thin and scanty , and the night cold : [I]0-i dreamed that [I]0-i lay in [the chamber of death]806-the chamber of death , between [the warrior]810-the warrior and [the lady with the healing wound]811-the lady with the healing wound . [I]0-i woke in the middle of the night , thinking [I]0-i heard low noises of wild animals . " Creatures of [the desert]3065-the desert scenting after [me]0-i , [I]0-i suppose ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , and , knowing [I]0-i was safe , would have gone to sleep again . But that instant a rough purring rose to a howl under [my]0-i window , and [I]0-i sprang from [my]0-i bed to see what sort of beast uttered it . Before the door of [the cottage]340-the cottage , in the full radiance of the moon , [a tall woman]813-a tall woman stood , clothed in white , with [her]813-a tall woman back toward [me]0-i . [She]813-a tall woman was stooping over a large white animal like a panther , patting and stroking it with one hand , while with the other [she]813-a tall woman pointed to the moon half - way up [the heaven]814-the heaven , then drew a perpendicular line to the horizon . Instantly the creature darted off with amazing swiftness in the direction indicated . For a moment [my]0-i eyes followed it , then sought [the woman]348-the woman ; but [she]348-the woman was gone , and not yet had [I]0-i seen [her]348-the woman face ! Again [I]0-i looked after the animal but whether [I]0-i saw or only fancied a white speck in the distance , [I]0-i could not tell.—What did it mean ? What was the monster - cat sent off to do ? [I]0-i shuddered , and went back to [my]0-i bed . Then [I]0-i remembered that , when [I]0-i lay down in [the sandy hollow outside]816-the sandy hollow outside , the moon was setting ; yet here [she]813-a tall woman was , a few hours after , shining in all [her]813-a tall woman glory ! " Everything is uncertain here , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , " — even the motions of the heavenly bodies ! "[0-i] [I]0-i learned afterward that there were several moons in the service of [this world]226-this world , but the laws that ruled their times and different orbits [I]0-i failed to discover . Again [I]0-i fell asleep , and slept undisturbed . When [I]0-i went down in the morning , [I]0-i found bread and water waiting [me]0-i , the loaf so large that [I]0-i ate only half of it . [[My]0-i hostess]780-my hostess sat muffled beside [me]0-i while [I]0-i broke [my]0-i fast , and except to greet [me]0-i when [I]0-i entered , never opened [her]780-my hostess mouth until [I]0-i asked [her]780-my hostess to instruct [me]0-i how to arrive at [Bulika]6-bulika . [She]780-my hostess then told [me]0-i to go up [the bank of [the river - bed]554-the river - bed]819-the bank of the river - bed until it disappeared ; then verge to the right until [I]0-i came to [a forest]2846-a forest — in which [I]0-i might spend a night , but which [I]0-i must leave with [my]0-i face to the rising moon . Keeping in the same direction , [she]780-my hostess said , until [I]0-i reached [a running stream]822-a running stream , [I]0-i must cross that at right angles , and go straight on until [I]0-i saw [the city]3099-the city on the horizon . [I]0-i thanked [her]780-my hostess , and ventured the remark that , looking out of the window in the night , [I]0-i was astonished to see [[her]780-my hostess messenger]824-her messenger understand [her]780-my hostess so well , and go so straight and so fast in the direction [she]780-my hostess had indicated . " If [I]0-i had but that animal of yours to guide [me]0-i , — "[0-i] [I]0-i went on , hoping to learn something of [its]824-her messenger mission , but [she]780-my hostess interrupted [me]0-i , saying , " It was to [Bulika]6-bulika [she]780-my hostess went — the shortest way . "[780-my hostess] " How wonderfully intelligent [she]780-my hostess looked ! "[780-my hostess] " [Astarte]53-astarte knows [her]780-my hostess work well enough to be sent to do it , "[780-my hostess] [she]780-my hostess answered . " Have [you]0-i many [messengers]3158-messengers like [her]780-my hostess ? "[780-my hostess] " As many as [I]780-my hostess require . "[780-my hostess] " Are [they]3158-messengers hard to teach ? "[780-my hostess] " [They]3158-messengers need no teaching . [They]3158-messengers are [all of a certain breed]3159-all of a certain breed , but not one of [the breed]3160-the breed is like another . [Their]3158-messengers origin is so natural it would seem to [you]0-i incredible . "[780-my hostess] " May [I]780-my hostess not know it ? "[780-my hostess] " A new one came to [me]0-i last night — from [your]825-she head while [you]825-she slept . "[0-i] [I]0-i laughed . " All in [this world]226-this world seem to love mystery ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i . " Some chance word of [mine]0-i suggested an idea — and in this form [she]825-she embodies the small fact ! "[0-i] " Then the creature is [mine]0-i ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " Not at all ! "[825-she] [she]825-she answered . " That only can be [ours]3162-ours in whose existence [our]3162-ours will is a factor . "[825-she] " Ha ! [a metaphysician too]3163-a metaphysician too ! "[0-i] [I]0-i remarked inside , and was silent . " May [I]0-i take what is left of the loaf ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked presently . " [You]0-i will want no more to - day , "[825-she] [she]825-she replied . " To - morrow [I]0-i may ! "[0-i] [I]0-i rejoined . [She]825-she rose and went to the door , saying as [she]825-she went , " It has nothing to do with to - morrow,—but [you]0-i may take it if [you]0-i will . "[825-she] [She]825-she opened the door , and stood holding it . [I]0-i rose , taking up the bread — but lingered , much desiring to see [her]825-she face . " Must [I]0-i go , then ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [No one]134-no one sleeps in [[my]825-she house]2896-my house two nights together ! "[825-she] [she]825-she answered . " [I]0-i thank [you]825-she , then , for [your]825-she hospitality , and bid [you]825-she farewell ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and turned to go . " The time will come when [you]0-i must house with [me]825-she many days and many nights , "[825-she] [she]825-she murmured sadly through [her]825-she muffling . " Willingly , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " Nay , not willingly ! "[825-she] [she]825-she answered . [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i that [she]825-she was right — [I]0-i would not willingly be [[her]825-she guest]826-her guest a second time ! but immediately [my]0-i heart rebuked [me]0-i , and [I]0-i had scarce crossed the threshold when [I]0-i turned again . [She]825-she stood in the middle of [the room]126-the room ; [her]825-she white garments lay like foamy waves at [her]825-she feet , and among them the swathings of [her]825-she face : it was lovely as a night of stars . [Her]825-she great gray eyes looked up to heaven ; tears were flowing down [her]825-she pale cheeks . [She]825-she reminded [me]0-i not a little of [[the sexton]357-the sexton 's wife]829-the sexton 's wife , although [the one]484-the one looked as if [she]825-she had not wept for thousands of years , and [the other]2867-the other as if [she]825-she wept constantly behind the wrappings of [her]825-she beautiful head . Yet something in the very eyes that wept seemed to say , " Weeping may endure for a night , but joy cometh in the morning . "[0-i] [I]0-i had bowed [my]0-i head for a moment , about to kneel and beg [her]825-she forgiveness , when , looking up in the act , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i outside [a doorless house]832-a doorless house . [I]0-i went round and round [it]832-a doorless house , but could find no entrance . [I]0-i had stopped under one of the windows , on the point of calling aloud [my]0-i repentant confession , when a sudden wailing , howling scream invaded [my]0-i ears , and [my]0-i heart stood still . Something sprang from the window above [my]0-i head , and lighted beyond [me]0-i . [I]0-i turned , and saw a large gray cat , its hair on end , shooting toward [the river - bed]554-the river - bed . [I]0-i fell with [my]0-i face in the sand , and seemed to hear within [the house]112-the house the gentle sobbing of [one who suffered but did not repent]835-one who suffered but did not repent . [I]0-i ROSE to resume [my]0-i journey , and walked many [a desert mile]836-a desert mile . How [I]0-i longed for [a mountain]837-a mountain , or even a tall rock , from whose summit [I]0-i might see across [the dismal plain]838-the dismal plain or [the dried - up channels]839-the dried - up channels to some bordering hope ! Yet what could such foresight have availed [me]0-i ? That which is within [a man]109-a man , not that which lies beyond [his]109-a man vision , is the main factor in what is about to befall [him]109-a man : the operation upon [him]109-a man is the event . Foreseeing is not understanding , else surely the prophecy latent in [man]2682-man would come oftener to the surface ! The sun was half - way to the horizon when [I]0-i saw before [me]0-i a rugged rocky ascent ; but ere [I]0-i reached it [my]0-i desire to climb was over , and [I]0-i longed to lie down . By that time the sun was almost set , and the air had begun to grow dark . At [my]0-i feet lay a carpet of softest , greenest moss , couch for [a king]842-a king : [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i upon it , and weariness at once began to ebb , for , the moment [my]0-i head was down , the third time [I]0-i heard below [me]0-i [many waters]843-many waters , playing broken airs and ethereal harmonies with the stones of [their buried channels]844-their buried channels . Loveliest chaos of music - stuff the harp aquarian kept sending up to [my]0-i ears ! What might [not a Händel]845-not a händel have done with that ever - recurring gurgle and bell - like drip , to the mingling and mutually destructive melodies their common refrain ! As [I]0-i lay listening , [my]0-i eyes went wandering up and down [the rocky slope abrupt above [me]0-i]846-the rocky slope abrupt above me , reading on its face the record that down there , ages ago , rushed a cataract , filling the channels that had led [me]0-i to its foot . [My]0-i heart swelled at the thought of the splendid tumult , where the waves danced revelling in helpless fall , to mass [their]847-their music in one organ - roar below . But soon [the hidden brooks]848-the hidden brooks lulled [me]0-i to sleep , and [their]848-the hidden brooks lullabies mingled with [my]0-i dreams . [I]0-i woke before the sun , and eagerly climbed to see what lay beyond . Alas , nothing but [a desert of finest sand]849-a desert of finest sand ! Not a trace was left of [the river that had plunged adown [the rocks]851-the rocks]850-the river that had plunged adown the rocks ! The powdery drift had filled its course to the level of [the dreary expanse]852-the dreary expanse ! As [I]0-i looked back [I]0-i saw that [the river]853-the river had divided into two branches as it fell , that whose bank [I]0-i had now followed to [the foot of [the rocky scaur]855-the rocky scaur]854-the foot of the rocky scaur , and that which first [I]0-i crossed to [the Evil Wood]856-the evil wood . The wood [I]0-i descried between the two on the far horizon . Before [me]0-i and to the left , [the desert]3065-the desert stretched beyond [my]0-i vision , but far to the right [I]0-i could see a lift in the sky - line , giving hope of the forest to which [[my]0-i hostess]780-my hostess had directed [me]0-i . [I]0-i sat down , and sought in [my]0-i pocket the half - loaf [I]0-i had brought with [me]0-i — then first to understand what [[my]0-i hostess]780-my hostess had meant concerning it . Verily the bread was not for the morrow : it had shrunk and hardened to a stone ! [I]0-i threw it away , and set out again . About noon [I]0-i came to a few tamarisk and juniper trees , and then to a few stunted firs . As [I]0-i went on , closer thickets and larger firs met [me]0-i , and at length [I]0-i was in just such a forest of pines and other trees as that in which [the Little Ones]633-the little ones found [[their]633-the little ones babies]762-their babies , and believed [I]0-i had returned upon [a farther portion of the same]862-a farther portion of the same . But what mattered where while everywhere was the same as nowhere ! [I]0-i had not yet , by doing something in it , made anywhere into a place ! [I]0-i was not yet alive ; [I]0-i was only dreaming [I]0-i lived ! [I]0-i was but [a consciousness with an outlook]863-a consciousness with an outlook ! Truly [I]0-i had been nothing else in [the world]108-the world [I]0-i had left , but now [I]0-i knew the fact ! [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i that if in [this forest]865-this forest [I]0-i should catch the faint gleam of the mirror , [I]0-i would turn far aside lest it should entrap [me]0-i unawares , and give [me]0-i back to [my]0-i old existence : here [I]0-i might learn to be something by doing something ! [I]0-i could not endure the thought of going back , with so many beginnings and not an end achieved . [The Little Ones]633-the little ones would meet what fate was appointed [them]633-the little ones ; [the awful witch]867-the awful witch [I]0-i should never meet ; the dead would ripen and arise without [me]0-i ; [I]0-i should but wake to know that [I]0-i had dreamed , and that all [my]0-i going was nowhither ! [I]0-i would rather go on and on than come to such a close ! [I]0-i went deeper into [the wood]2922-the wood : [I]0-i was weary , and would rest in [it]2922-the wood . The trees were now large , and stood in regular , almost geometric , fashion , with roomy spaces between . There was little undergrowth , and [I]0-i could see a long way in every direction . [The forest]314-the forest was like [a great church]870-a great church , solemn and silent and empty , for [I]0-i met nothing on two feet or four that day . Now and then , it is true , some swift thing , and again some slow thing , would cross the space on which [my]0-i eye happened that moment to settle ; but it was always at some distance , and only enhanced the sense of wideness and vacancy . [I]0-i heard a few birds , and saw plenty of butterflies , some of marvellously gorgeous colouring and combinations of colour , some of a pure and dazzling whiteness . Coming to a spot where the pines stood farther apart and gave room for flowering shrubs , and hoping it a sign of some dwelling near , [I]0-i took the direction where yet more and more roses grew , for [I]0-i was hungry after the voice and face of [[my]0-i kind]2944-my kind — after any live soul , indeed , human or not , which [I]0-i might in some measure understand . What a hell of horror , [I]0-i thought , to wander alone , a bare existence never going out of itself , never widening [its]314-the forest life in another life , but , bound with the cords of its poor peculiarities , lying [an eternal prisoner in the dungeon of its own being]872-an eternal prisoner in the dungeon of its own being ! [I]0-i began to learn that it was impossible to live for [oneself]873-oneself even , save in the presence of [others]2785-others — then , alas , fearfully possible ! evil was only through good ! selfishness but [a parasite on the tree of life]875-a parasite on the tree of life ! In [[my]0-i own world]236-my own world [I]0-i had the habit of solitary song ; here not a crooning murmur ever parted [my]0-i lips ! There [I]0-i sang without thinking ; here [I]0-i thought without singing ! there [I]0-i had never had [a bosom - friend]877-a bosom - friend ; here the affection of [an idiot]287-an idiot would be divinely welcome ! " If only [I]0-i had a dog to love ! "[0-i] [I]0-i sighed — and regarded with wonder [my]0-i past self , which preferred the company of book or pen to that of [man]2682-man or [woman]377-woman ; which , if [the author of a tale [I]0-i was enjoying]881-the author of a tale i was enjoying appeared , would wish [him]881-the author of a tale i was enjoying away that [I]0-i might return to [his]881-the author of a tale i was enjoying story . [I]0-i had chosen the dead rather than the living , [the thing]882-the thing thought rather than the thing thinking ! " [Any man]3166-any man , "[0-i] [I]0-i said now , " is more than the greatest of books ! "[0-i] [I]0-i had not cared for [[my]0-i live brothers]883-my live brothers and [sisters]884-sisters , and now [I]0-i was left without even the dead to comfort [me]0-i ! The wood thinned yet more , and the pines grew yet larger , sending up huge stems , like columns eager to support the heavens . More trees of other kinds appeared ; [the forest]314-the forest was growing richer ! The roses wore now trees , and their flowers of astonishing splendour . Suddenly [I]0-i spied what seemed [a great house]886-a great house or [castle]887-castle ; but [its]888-it forms were so strangely indistinct , that [I]0-i could not be certain it was more than a chance combination of tree - shapes . As [I]0-i drew nearer , its lines yet held together , but neither they nor the body of it grew at all more definite ; and when at length [I]0-i stood in front of [it]888-it , [I]0-i remained as doubtful of its nature as before . House or castle habitable , [it]888-it certainly was not ; [it]888-it might be [a ruin overgrown with ivy and roses]889-a ruin overgrown with ivy and roses ! Yet of building hid in the foliage , not the poorest wall - remnant could [I]0-i discern . Again and again [I]0-i seemed to descry what must be building , but it always vanished before closer inspection . Could it be , [I]0-i pondered , that the ivy had embraced a huge edifice and consumed it , and its interlaced branches retained the shapes of the walls it had assimilated?—I could be sure of nothing concerning the appearance . Before [me]0-i was a rectangular vacancy — the ghost of a doorway without a door : [I]0-i stepped through [it]888-it , and found [myself]0-i in an open space like [a great hall]890-a great hall , [its]890-a great hall floor covered with grass and flowers , [its]890-a great hall walls and roof of ivy and vine , mingled with roses . There could be [no better place in which to pass the night]891-no better place in which to pass the night ! [I]0-i gathered a quantity of withered leaves , laid them in a corner , and threw [myself]0-i upon them . A red sunset filled [the hall]185-the hall , the night was warm , and [my]0-i couch restful ; [I]0-i lay gazing up at the live ceiling , with its tracery of branches and twigs , its clouds of foliage , and peeping patches of loftier roof . [My]0-i eyes went wading about as if tangled in it , until the sun was down , and the sky beginning to grow dark . Then the red roses turned black , and soon the yellow and white alone were visible . When they vanished , the stars came instead , hanging in the leaves like live topazes , throbbing and sparkling and flashing many colours : [I]0-i was canopied with a tree from [[Aladdin]54-aladdin 's cave]893-aladdin 's cave ! Then [I]0-i discovered that [it]890-a great hall was full of nests , whence tiny heads , nearly indistinguishable , kept popping out with a chirp or two , and disappearing again . For a while there were rustlings and stirrings and little prayers ; but as the darkness grew , the small heads became still , and at last [every feathered mother]894-every feathered mother had [her]894-every feathered mother brood quiet under [her]894-every feathered mother wings , the talk in the little beds was over , and [God]33-god 's bird - nursery at rest beneath the waves of sleep . Once more a few flutterings made [me]0-i look up : an owl went sailing across . [I]0-i had only a glimpse of [him]895-him , but several times felt the cool wafture of [his]895-him silent wings . The mother birds did not move again ; [they]896-they saw that [he]895-him was looking for [mice]897-mice , not [children]599-children . About midnight [I]0-i came wide awake , roused by a revelry , whose noises were yet not loud . Neither were [they]896-they distant ; [they]896-they were close to [me]0-i , but attenuate . [My]0-i eyes were so dazzled , however , that for a while [I]0-i could see nothing ; at last [they]896-they came to themselves . [I]0-i was lying on [my]0-i withered leaves in the corner of [a splendid hall]899-a splendid hall . Before [me]0-i was [a crowd of gorgeously dressed men]900-a crowd of gorgeously dressed men and [gracefully robed women]901-gracefully robed women , [none of whom]902-none of whom seemed to see [me]0-i . In dance after dance [they]896-they vaguely embodied the story of life , its meetings , its passions , its partings . [A student of [Shakspere]7-shakspere]903-a student of shakspere , [I]0-i had learned something of every dance alluded to in [his]7-shakspere plays , and hence partially understood several of those [I]0-i now saw — the minuet , [the pavin]904-the pavin , [the hey]905-the hey , [the coranto]906-the coranto , [the lavolta]907-the lavolta . [The dancers]908-the dancers were attired in fashion as ancient as [their]908-the dancers dances . A moon had risen while [I]0-i slept , and was shining through the countless - windowed roof ; but [her]909-her light was crossed by so many shadows that at first [I]0-i could distinguish almost nothing of the faces of [the multitude]910-the multitude ; [I]0-i could not fail , however , to perceive that there was something odd about [them]910-the multitude : [I]0-i sat up to see [them]910-the multitude better.—Heavens ! could [I]0-i call [them]910-the multitude faces ? [They]910-the multitude were skull fronts ! — hard , gleaming bone , bare jaws , truncated noses , lipless teeth which could no more take part in any smile ! Of these , some flashed set and white and murderous ; others were clouded with decay , broken and gapped , coloured of the earth in which [they]910-the multitude seemed so long to have lain ! Fearfuller yet , the eye - sockets were not empty ; in each was a lidless living eye ! In those wrecks of faces , glowed or flashed or sparkled eyes of every colour , shape , and expression . The beautiful , proud eye , dark and lustrous , condescending to whatever it rested upon , was the more terrible ; the lovely , languishing eye , the more repulsive ; while the dim , sad eyes , less at variance with [their]910-the multitude setting , were sad exceedingly , and drew the heart in spite of the horror out of which [they]910-the multitude gazed . [I]0-i rose and went among [the apparitions]911-the apparitions , eager to understand something of [their]911-the apparitions being and belongings . Were [they]911-the apparitions souls , or were [they]911-the apparitions and [their]911-the apparitions rhythmic motions but phantasms of what had been ? By look nor by gesture , not by slightest break in the measure , did [they]911-the apparitions show [themselves]911-the apparitions aware of [me]0-i ; [I]0-i was not present to [them]911-the apparitions : how much were [they]911-the apparitions in relation to [each other]2772-each other ? Surely [they]911-the apparitions saw [[their]911-the apparitions companions]913-their companions as [I]0-i saw [them]911-the apparitions ! Or was [each only dreaming itself]914-each only dreaming itself and the rest ? Did [they]911-the apparitions know each how [they]911-the apparitions appeared to [the others]754-the others — [a death with living eyes]916-a death with living eyes ? Had [they]911-the apparitions used [their]911-the apparitions faces , not for communication , not to utter thought and feeling , not to share existence with [[their]911-the apparitions neighbours]917-their neighbours , but to appear what [they]911-the apparitions wished to appear , and conceal what [they]911-the apparitions were ? and , having made [their]911-the apparitions faces masks , were [they]911-the apparitions therefore deprived of those masks , and condemned to go without faces until [they]911-the apparitions repented ? " How long must [they]911-the apparitions flaunt [their]911-the apparitions facelessness in faceless eyes ? "[0-i] [I]0-i wondered . " How long will the frightful punition endure ? Have [they]911-the apparitions at length begun to love and be wise ? Have [they]911-the apparitions yet yielded to the shame that has found [them]911-the apparitions ? "[0-i] [I]0-i heard not a word , saw not a movement of one naked mouth . Were [they]911-the apparitions because of lying bereft of speech ? With [their]911-the apparitions eyes [they]911-the apparitions spoke as if longing to be understood : was it truth or was it falsehood that spoke in [their]911-the apparitions eyes ? [They]911-the apparitions seemed to know [one another]2951-one another : did [they]911-the apparitions see one skull beautiful , and another plain ? Difference must be there , and [they]911-the apparitions had had long study of skulls ! [My]0-i body was to [theirs]911-the apparitions no obstacle : was [I]0-i a body , and were [they]911-the apparitions but forms ? or was [I]0-i but a form , and were [they]911-the apparitions bodies ? The moment one of [the dancers]908-the dancers came close against [me]0-i , that moment [he]920-he or [she]921-she was on the other side of [me]0-i , and [I]0-i could tell , without seeing , which , whether [man]2682-man or [woman]377-woman , had passed through [[my]0-i house]2896-my house . On many of the skulls the hair held its place , and however dressed , or in itself however beautiful , to [my]0-i eyes looked frightful on the bones of the forehead and temples . In such case , the outer ear often remained also , and at its tip , the jewel of the ear as [Sidney]55-sidney calls it , would hang , glimmering , gleaming , or sparkling , pearl or opal or diamond — under the night of brown or of raven locks , the sunrise of golden ripples , or the moonshine of pale , interclouded , fluffy cirri — lichenous all on the ivory - white or damp - yellow naked bone . [I]0-i looked down and saw the daintily domed instep ; [I]0-i looked up and saw the plump shoulders basing the spring of the round full neck — which withered at half - height to the fluted shaft of a gibbose cranium . The music became wilder , the dance faster and faster ; eyes flared and flashed , jewels twinkled and glittered , casting colour and fire on the pallid grins that glode through [the hall]185-the hall , weaving a ghastly rhythmic woof in intricate maze of multitudinous motion , when sudden came a pause , and every eye turned to the same spot:—in the doorway stood [a woman , perfect in form , in holding , and in hue]926-a woman , perfect in form , in holding , and in hue , regarding [the company]927-the company as from the pedestal of [a goddess]928-a goddess , while [the dancers]908-the dancers stood " like one forbid , "[908-the dancers] frozen to a new death by the vision of a life that killed . " Dead things , [I]926-a woman , perfect in form , in holding , and in hue live ! "[926-a woman , perfect in form , in holding , and in hue] said [her]926-a woman , perfect in form , in holding , and in hue scornful glance . Then , at once , like leaves in which an instant wind awakes , [they]908-the dancers turned each to another , and broke afresh into melodious consorted motion , a new expression in [their]908-the dancers eyes , late solitary , now filled with the interchange of a common triumph . " [Thou]3167-thou also , "[908-the dancers] [they]908-the dancers seemed to say , " wilt soon become weak as [we]3167-thou ! [thou]3167-thou wilt soon become like unto [us]3167-thou ! "[908-the dancers] [I]0-i turned [mine]0-i again to [the woman]348-the woman — and saw upon [her]348-the woman side a small dark shadow . [She]348-the woman had seen the change in the dead stare ; [she]348-the woman looked down ; [she]348-the woman understood the talking eyes ; [she]348-the woman pressed both [her]348-the woman lovely hands on the shadow , gave a smothered cry , and fled . The birds moved rustling in their nests , and a flash of joy lit up the eyes of [the dancers]908-the dancers , when suddenly a warm wind , growing in strength as it swept through [the place]2672-the place , blew out every light . But the low moon yet glimmered on the horizon with " sick assay "[0-i] to shine , and a turbid radiance yet gleamed from so many eyes , that [I]0-i saw well enough what followed . As if each shape had been but a snow - image , it began to fall to pieces , ruining in the warm wind . In papery flakes the flesh peeled from its bones , dropping like soiled snow from under [its]933-its garments ; these fell fluttering in rags and strips , and [the whole white skeleton]934-the whole white skeleton , emerging from garment and flesh together , stood bare and lank amid the decay that littered the floor . A faint rattling shiver went through [the naked company]935-the naked company ; pair after pair the lamping eyes went out ; and the darkness grew round [me]0-i with the loneliness . For a moment the leaves were still swept fluttering all one way ; then the wind ceased , and the owl floated silent through the silent night . Not for a moment had [I]0-i been afraid . It is true that whoever would cross the threshold of [any world]570-any world , must leave fear behind [him]937-him ; but , for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i could claim no part in its absence . No conscious courage was operant in [me]0-i ; simply , [I]0-i was not afraid . [I]0-i neither knew why [I]0-i was not afraid , nor wherefore [I]0-i might have been afraid . [I]0-i feared not even fear — which of all dangers is the most dangerous . [I]0-i went out into the wood , at once to resume [my]0-i journey . Another moon was rising , and [I]0-i turned [my]0-i face toward it . [I]0-i HAD not gone ten paces when [I]0-i caught sight of a strange - looking object , and went nearer to know what it might be . [I]0-i found [it]938-it a mouldering carriage of ancient form , ruinous but still upright on its heavy wheels . On each side of the pole , still in its place , lay the skeleton of a horse ; from [their]939-their two grim white heads ascended the shrivelled reins to the hand of [the skeleton - coachman]940-the skeleton - coachman seated on [his]940-the skeleton - coachman tattered hammer - cloth ; both doors had fallen away ; within sat two skeletons , each leaning back in [its]938-it corner . Even as [I]0-i looked , [they]939-their started awake , and with a cracking rattle of bones , each leaped from the door next [it]938-it . One fell and lay ; [the other]2867-the other stood a moment , [its]2867-the other structure shaking perilously ; then with difficulty , for its joints were stiff , crept , holding by the back of [the carriage]942-the carriage , to the opposite side , the thin leg - bones seeming hardly strong enough to carry its weight , where , kneeling by the other , it sought to raise [it]2867-the other , almost falling itself again in the endeavour . [The prostrate one]943-the prostrate one rose at length , as by a sudden effort , to the sitting posture . For a few moments it turned its yellowish skull to this side and that ; then , heedless of [[its]943-the prostrate one neighbour]944-its neighbour , got upon [its]943-the prostrate one feet by grasping the spokes of the hind wheel . Half erected thus , [it]943-the prostrate one stood with its back to the other , both hands holding one of its knee - joints . With little less difficulty and not a few contortions , [the kneeling one]945-the kneeling one rose next , and addressed [[its]945-the kneeling one companion]946-its companion . " Have [you]946-its companion hurt [yourself]946-its companion , [[my]949-my lord]3168-my lord ? "[949-my] it said , in a voice that sounded far - off , and ill - articulated as if blown aside by some spectral wind . " Yes , [I]2867-the other have , "[2867-the other] answered [the other]2867-the other , in like but rougher tone . " [You]946-its companion would do nothing to help [me]2867-the other , and this cursed knee is out ! "[2867-the other] " [I]2867-the other did [my]2867-the other best , [[my]2867-the other lord]3168-my lord . "[2867-the other] " No doubt , [[my]948-i lady]3170-my lady , for it was bad ! [I]948-i thought [I]948-i should never find [my]948-i feet again!—But , bless [my]948-i soul , [madam]3076-madam ! are [you]3076-madam out in [your]3076-madam bones ? "[948-i] [She]948-i cast a look at [herself]948-i . " [I]948-i have nothing else to be out in , "[948-i] [she]948-i returned ; " — and [you]946-its companion at least can not complain ! But what on earth does it mean ? Am [I]948-i dreaming ? "[948-i] " [You]946-its companion may be dreaming , [madam]3076-madam — [I]2867-the other can not tell ; but this knee of [mine]2867-the other forbids [me]2867-the other the grateful illusion.—Ha ! [I]2867-the other too , [I]2867-the other perceive , have nothing to walk in but bones!—Not so unbecoming to [a man]109-a man , however ! [I]2867-the other trust to goodness they are not [my]2867-the other bones ! [every one]2818-every one aches worse than another , and this loose knee worst of all ! The bed must have been damp — and [I]2867-the other too drunk to know it ! "[2867-the other] " Probably , [[my]2867-the other lord of [Cokayne]8-cokayne]3175-my lord of cokayne ! "[2867-the other] " What ! what!—You make [me]2867-the other think [I]2867-the other too am dreaming — aches and all ! How do [you]946-its companion know the title [[my]2867-the other roistering bullies]3176-my roistering bullies give [me]2867-the other ? [I]2867-the other do n't remember you!—Anyhow , [you]946-its companion have no right to take liberties ! [My]2867-the other name is — [I]2867-the other am [lord]3177-lord —— tut , tut ! What do [you]946-its companion call [me]2867-the other when [I'm]2867-the other — [I]2867-the other mean when [you]946-its companion are sober ? [I]2867-the other cannot — at the moment,—Why , what is [my]2867-the other name?—I must have been very drunk when [I]2867-the other went to bed ! [I]2867-the other often am ! "[2867-the other] " [You]946-its companion come so seldom to [mine]2867-the other , that [I]2867-the other do not know , [[my]2867-the other lord]3168-my lord ; but [I]2867-the other may take [your]946-its companion word for that ! "[2867-the other] " [I]949-my am glad to hear it : [my]949-my recollections of [you]946-its companion are the less distasteful!—Good morning , [[my]949-my lord]3168-my lord ! " [You]946-its companion are just as heartless as — as — [any other woman]3182-any other woman , madam!—Where in [this hell of a place]3183-this hell of a place shall [I]950-i find [my]950-i valet?—What was the cursed name [I]950-i used to call [the fool]3184-the fool ? "[951-the lady] " A sad truth , but capable of remedy : [the forest]314-the forest seems of some extent ! "[951-the lady] " [I]950-i doubt ! [I]950-i doubt ! [I]951-the lady can not surely be quite so naked as [your]3170-my lady ladyship!—I beg [your]3170-my lady pardon , [madam]3076-madam ! Locality is the question ! To be or not to be , is not the question ! "[951-the lady] " [We]3205-we are in [the other world]3206-the other world , [I]951-the lady presume ! "[0-i] " There are words too big for [you]0-i and [me]957-the speaker : all is one of them , and ever is another , "[957-the speaker] said a voice near [me]0-i which [I]0-i knew . " [The male]3216-the male was never [a gentleman]3217-a gentleman , "[953-her late husband] [he]953-her late husband went on , " and in the bony stage of retrogression , with [his]3216-the male skeleton through [his]3216-the male skin , and [his]3216-the male character outside [his]3216-the male manners , does not look like [one]2690-one . [The female]3219-the female is less vulgar , and has a little heart . But , the restraints of society removed , [you]0-i see [them]3219-the female now just as [they]3219-the female are and always were ! " In [their]3219-the female day [they]3219-the female were [the handsomest couple at [court]3222-court]3221-the handsomest couple at court ; and now , even in [their]3219-the female dry bones , [they]3219-the female seem to regard [their]3219-the female former repute as an inalienable possession ; to see [their]3219-the female faces , however , may yet do something for [them]3219-the female ! [They]3219-the female felt [themselves]3219-the female rich too while [they]3219-the female had pockets , but [they]3219-the female have already begun to feel rather pinched ! [[My]953-her late husband lord]3168-my lord used to regard [[my]953-her late husband lady]3170-my lady as a worthless encumbrance , for [he]3168-my lord was tired of [her]3170-my lady beauty and had spent [her]3170-my lady money ; now [he]3168-my lord needs [her]3170-my lady to cobble [his]3168-my lord joints for [him]3168-my lord ! These changes have roots of hope in [them]3225-them . Besides , [they]3219-the female can not now get far away from [each other]2772-each other , and [they]3219-the female see [none else of [their]3219-the female own kind]3227-none else of their own kind : [they]3219-the female must at last grow weary of [their]3219-the female mutual repugnance , and begin to love [one another]2951-one another ! for love , not hate , is deepest in what Love ` loved into being . ' "[953-her late husband] " [I]0-i saw [many more of [their]3219-the female kind]3229-many more of their kind an hour ago , in [the hall close by]3230-the hall close by ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " Of [their]3219-the female kind , but not of [their]3219-the female sort , "[959-he] [he]959-he answered . " For many years [these]3231-these will see none such as [you]0-i saw last night . Those are centuries in advance of these . [You]0-i saw that [those]3232-those could even dress [themselves]3232-those a little ! It is true [they]3219-the female can not yet retain [their]3219-the female clothes so long as [they]3219-the female would — only , at present , for a part of the night ; but [they]3219-the female are pretty steadily growing more capable , and will by and by develop faces ; for every grain of truthfulness adds a fibre to the show of [their]3219-the female humanity . Nothing but truth can appear ; and whatever is must seem . "[959-he] " Are [they]3219-the female upheld by this hope ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [They]3219-the female are upheld by hope , but [they]3219-the female do not in the least know [their]3219-the female hope ; to understand it , is yet immeasurably beyond [them]3219-the female , "[0-i] answered [Mr. Raven]24-mr. raven . [His]959-he unexpected appearance had caused [me]0-i no astonishment . [I]0-i was like [a child]106-a child , constantly wondering , and surprised at nothing . " Did [you]959-he come to find [me]0-i , [sir]2678-sir ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " Not at all , "[959-he] [he]959-he replied . " [I]959-he have no anxiety about [you]959-he . Such as [you]959-he always come back to [us]3234-us . "[959-he] " Tell [me]0-i , please , who am [I]0-i such as ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [I]959-he can not make [[my]959-he friend]3235-my friend the subject of conversation , "[959-he] [he]959-he answered , with a smile . " But when [that friend]3236-that friend is present ! "[0-i] [I]0-i urged . " [I]959-he decline the more strongly , "[959-he] [he]959-he rejoined . " But when [that friend]3236-that friend asks [you]959-he ! "[0-i] [I]0-i persisted . " Then most positively [I]959-he refuse , "[959-he] [he]959-he returned . " Why ? "[959-he] " Because [he]3236-that friend and [I]959-he would be talking of [two persons]3238-two persons as if [they]3238-two persons were [one and the same]3239-one and the same . [Your]0-i consciousness of [yourself]0-i and [my]959-he knowledge of [you]0-i are far apart ! "[959-he] The lapels of [his]959-he coat flew out , and the lappets lifted , and [I]0-i thought the metamorphosis of homo to corvus was about to take place before [my]0-i eyes . But the coat closed again in front of [him]959-he , and [he]959-he added , with seeming inconsequence , " In [this world]226-this world never trust [a person who has once deceived [you]0-i]3241-a person who has once deceived you . Above all , never do anything [such a one]216-such a one may ask [you]0-i to do . "[959-he] " [I]0-i will try to remember , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " — but [I]0-i may forget ! "[0-i] " Then some evil that is good for [you]0-i will follow . "[959-he] " And if [I]959-he remember ? "[959-he] " Some evil that is not good for [you]0-i , will not follow . "[961-the old man] [The old man]961-the old man seemed to sink to the ground , and immediately [I]0-i saw the raven several yards from [me]0-i , flying low and fast . [I]0-i WENT walking on , still facing the moon , who , not yet high , was staring straight into [the forest]314-the forest . [I]0-i did not know what ailed [her]963-her , but [she]963-her was dark and dented , like a battered disc of old copper , and looked dispirited and weary . Not a cloud was nigh to keep [her]963-her company , and the stars were too bright for [her]963-her . " Is this going to last for ever ? "[963-her] [she]963-her seemed to say . [She]963-her was going one way and [I]0-i was going the other , yet through the wood [we]964-we went a long way together . [We]964-we did not commune much , for [my]0-i eyes were on [the ground]534-the ground ; but [her]963-her disconsolate look was fixed on [me]0-i : [I]0-i felt without seeing it . A long time [we]964-we were together , [I]0-i and [the moon]966-the moon , walking side by side , [she]963-her the dull shine , and [I]0-i the live shadow . Something on the ground , under a spreading tree , caught [my]0-i eye with its whiteness , and [I]0-i turned toward it . Vague as it was in the shadow of the foliage , it suggested , as [I]0-i drew nearer , a human body . " Another skeleton ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , kneeling and laying [my]0-i hand upon it . A body it was , however , and no skeleton , though as nearly one as body could well be . It lay on its side , and was very cold — not cold like a stone , but cold like that which was once alive , and is alive no more . The closer [I]0-i looked at it , the oftener [I]0-i touched it , the less it seemed possible it should be other than dead . For one bewildered moment , [I]0-i fancied [it]967-it one of [the wild dancers]968-the wild dancers , a ghostly Cinderella , perhaps , that had lost [her]963-her way [home]2676-home , and perished in the strange night of [an out - of - door world]970-an out - of - door world ! It was quite naked , and so worn that , even in the shadow , [I]0-i could , peering close , have counted without touching them , every rib in its side . All its bones , indeed , were as visible as if tight - covered with only a thin elastic leather . Its beautiful yet terrible teeth , unseemly disclosed by the retracted lips , gleamed ghastly through the dark . Its hair was longer than itself , thick and very fine to the touch , and black as night . It was the body of a tall , probably graceful woman.—How had [she]963-her come [there]204-there ? Not of [herself]963-her , and already in such wasted condition , surely ! [Her]963-her strength must have failed [her]963-her ; [she]963-her had fallen , and lain there until [she]963-her died of hunger ! But how , even so , could [she]963-her be thus emaciated ? And how came [she]963-her to be naked ? Where were [the savages]972-the savages to strip and leave [her]963-her ? or what wild beasts would have taken [her]963-her garments ? That [her]963-her body should have been left was not wonderful ! [I]0-i rose to [my]0-i feet , stood , and considered . [I]0-i must not , could not let [her]963-her lie exposed and forsaken ! Natural reverence forbade it . Even the garment of [a woman]344-a woman claims respect ; [her]963-her body it were impossible to leave uncovered ! Irreverent eyes might look on it ! Brutal claws might toss it about ! Years would pass ere the friendly rains washed it into the soil!—But the ground was hard , almost solid with interlacing roots , and [I]0-i had but [my]0-i bare hands ! At first it seemed plain that [she]963-her had not long been dead : there was not a sign of decay about [her]963-her ! But then what had the slow wasting of life left of [her]963-her to decay ? Could [she]963-her be still alive ? Might [she]963-her not ? What if [she]963-her were ! Things went very strangely in [this strange world]974-this strange world ! Even then there would be little chance of bringing [her]963-her back , but [I]0-i must know [she]963-her was dead before [I]0-i buried [her]963-her ! As [I]0-i left [the forest - hall]975-the forest - hall , [I]0-i had spied in the doorway a bunch of ripe grapes , and brought it with [me]0-i , eating as [I]0-i came : a few were yet left on the stalk , and [their]976-their juice might possibly revive [her]963-her ! Anyhow it was all [I]0-i had with which to attempt [her]963-her rescue ! The mouth was happily a little open ; but the head was in such an awkward position that , to move the body , [I]0-i passed [my]0-i arm under the shoulder on which it lay , when [I]0-i found the pine - needles beneath it warm : [she]963-her could not have been any time dead , and might still be alive , though [I]0-i could discern no motion of the heart , or any indication that [she]963-her breathed ! One of [her]963-her hands was clenched hard , apparently inclosing something small . [I]0-i squeezed a grape into [her]963-her mouth , but no swallowing followed . To do for [her]963-her all [I]0-i could , [I]0-i spread a thick layer of pine - needles and dry leaves , laid one of [my]0-i garments over it , warm from [my]0-i body , lifted [her]963-her upon it , and covered [her]963-her with [my]0-i clothes and a great heap of leaves : [I]0-i would save the little warmth left in [her]963-her , hoping an increase to it when the sun came back . Then [I]0-i tried another grape , but could perceive no slightest movement of mouth or throat . " Doubt , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , " may be a poor encouragement to do anything , but it is a bad reason for doing nothing . "[0-i] So tight was the skin upon [her]963-her bones that [I]0-i dared not use friction . [I]0-i crept into the heap of leaves , got as close to [her]963-her as [I]0-i could , and took [her]963-her in [my]0-i arms . [I]0-i had not much heat left in [me]0-i , but what [I]0-i had [I]0-i would share with [her]963-her ! Thus [I]0-i spent what remained of the night , sleepless , and longing for the sun . [Her]963-her cold seemed to radiate into [me]0-i , but no heat to pass from [me]0-i to [her]963-her . Had [I]0-i fled from the beautiful sleepers , [I]0-i thought , each on [her]963-her " dim , straight "[0-i] silver couch , to lie alone with such [a bedfellow]977-a bedfellow ! [I]0-i had refused a lovely privilege : [I]0-i was given over to an awful duty ! Beneath the sad , slow - setting moon , [I]0-i lay with the dead , and watched for the dawn . The darkness had given way , and the eastern horizon was growing dimly clearer , when [I]0-i caught sight of a motion rather than of anything that moved — not far from [me]0-i , and close to the ground . It was the low undulating of a large snake , which passed [me]0-i in an unswerving line . [Presently]57-presently appeared , making as it seemed for the same point , what [I]0-i took for a roebuck - doe and [her]963-her calf . Again a while , and two creatures like bear - cubs came , with three or four smaller ones behind [them]978-they . The light was now growing so rapidly that when , a few minutes after , a troop of horses went trotting past , [I]0-i could see that , although the largest of them were no bigger than the smallest Shetland pony , [they]978-they must yet be full - grown , so perfect were [they]978-they in form , and so much had [they]978-they all the ways and action of great horses . [They]978-they were of many breeds . Some seemed models of cart - horses , others of [chargers]979-chargers , [hunters]980-hunters , [racers]981-racers . Dwarf cattle and small elephants followed . " Why are [the children]2965-the children not [here]2675-here ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i . " The moment [I]0-i am free of [this poor woman]3245-this poor woman , [I]0-i must go back and fetch [them]2965-the children ! "[0-i] Where were the creatures going ? What drew [them]978-they ? Was this an exodus , or a morning habit ? [I]0-i must wait for the sun ! Till [he]982-he came [I]0-i must not leave [the woman]348-the woman ! [I]0-i laid [my]0-i hand on the body , and could not help thinking it felt a trifle warmer . It might have gained a little of the heat [I]0-i had lost ! it could hardly have generated any ! What reason for hope there was had not grown less ! The forehead of the day began to glow , and soon the sun came peering up , as if to see for the first time what all this stir of [a new world]984-a new world was about . At sight of [his]982-he great innocent splendour , [I]0-i rose full of life , strong against death . Removing the handkerchief [I]0-i had put to protect the mouth and eyes from the pine - needles , [I]0-i looked anxiously to see whether [I]0-i had found a priceless jewel , or but its empty case . The body lay motionless as when [I]0-i found it . Then first , in the morning light , [I]0-i saw how drawn and hollow was the face , how sharp were the bones under the skin , how every tooth shaped itself through the lips . The human garment was indeed worn to its threads , but [the bird of heaven]985-the bird of heaven might yet be nestling within , might yet awake to motion and song ! But the sun was shining on [her]348-the woman face ! [I]0-i re - arranged the handkerchief , laid a few leaves lightly over it , and set out to follow [the creatures]986-the creatures . [Their]986-the creatures main track was well beaten , and must have long been used — likewise many of the tracks that , joining it from both sides , merged in , and broadened it . The trees retreated as [I]0-i went , and the grass grew thicker . Presently [the forest]314-the forest was gone , and a wide expanse of loveliest green stretched away to the horizon . Through [it]314-the forest , along the edge of [the forest]314-the forest , flowed a small river , and to this [the track]989-the track led . At sight of the water a new though undefined hope sprang up in [me]0-i . [The stream]990-the stream looked everywhere deep , and was full to the brim , but nowhere more than a few yards wide . A bluish mist rose from [it]990-the stream , vanishing as it rose . On the opposite side , in the plentiful grass , many small animals were feeding . Apparently [they]986-the creatures slept in [the forest]314-the forest , and in the morning sought [the plain]550-the plain , swimming [the river]853-the river to reach [it]550-the plain . [I]0-i knelt and would have drunk , but the water was hot , and had a strange metallic taste . [I]0-i leapt to [my]0-i feet : here was the warmth [I]0-i sought — the first necessity of life ! [I]0-i sped back to [my]0-i helpless charge . Without well considering [my]0-i solitude , [no one]134-no one will understand what seemed to lie for [me]0-i in the redemption of [this woman]995-this woman from death . " Prove what [she]995-this woman may , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought with [myself]0-i , " [I]0-i shall at least be lonely no more ! "[0-i] [I]0-i had found [myself]0-i such poor company that now first [I]0-i seemed to know what hope was . This blessed water would expel the cold death , and drown [my]0-i desolation ! [I]0-i bore [her]995-this woman to [the stream]990-the stream . Tall as [she]995-this woman was , [I]0-i found [her]995-this woman marvellously light , [her]995-this woman bones were so delicate , and so little covered them . [I]0-i grew yet more hopeful when [I]0-i found [her]995-this woman so far from stiff that [I]0-i could carry [her]995-this woman on one arm , like [a sleeping child]997-a sleeping child , leaning against [my]0-i shoulder . [I]0-i went softly , dreading even the wind of [my]0-i motion , and glad there was no other . The water was too hot to lay [her]995-this woman at once in it : the shock might scare from [her]995-this woman the yet fluttering life ! [I]0-i laid [her]995-this woman on [the bank]998-the bank , and dipping one of [my]0-i garments , began to bathe the pitiful form . So wasted was it that , save from the plentifulness and blackness of the hair , it was impossible even to conjecture whether [she]995-this woman was young or old . [Her]995-this woman eyelids were just not shut , which made [her]995-this woman look dead the more : there was a crack in the clouds of [her]995-this woman night , at which no sun shone through ! The longer [I]0-i went on bathing the poor bones , the less grew [my]0-i hope that they would ever again be clothed with strength , that ever those eyelids would lift , and a soul look out ; still [I]0-i kept bathing continuously , allowing no part time to grow cold while [I]0-i bathed another ; and gradually the body became so much warmer , that at last [I]0-i ventured to submerge it : [I]0-i got into [the stream]990-the stream and drew it in , holding the face above the water , and letting the swift , steady current flow all about the rest . [I]0-i noted , but was able to conclude nothing from the fact , that , for all the heat , the shut hand never relaxed its hold . After about ten minutes , [I]0-i lifted it out and laid it again on [the bank]998-the bank , dried it , and covered it as well as [I]0-i could , then ran to [the forest]314-the forest for leaves . The grass and soil were dry and warm ; and when [I]0-i returned [I]0-i thought it had scarcely lost any of the heat the water had given [it]1002-it . [I]0-i spread the leaves upon it , and ran for more — then for a third and a fourth freight . [I]0-i could now leave [it]1002-it and go to explore , in the hope of discovering some shelter . [I]0-i ran up [the stream]990-the stream toward [some rocky hills]1004-some rocky hills [I]0-i saw in that direction , which were not far off . When [I]0-i reached [them]1004-some rocky hills , [I]0-i found [the river]853-the river issuing full grown from a rock at [the bottom of one of [them]1004-some rocky hills]1006-the bottom of one of them . To [my]0-i fancy it seemed to have run down a stair inside , an eager cataract , at every landing wild to get out , but only at the foot finding a door of escape . It did not fill the opening whence it rushed , and [I]0-i crept through into a little cave , where [I]0-i learned that , instead of hurrying tumultuously down a stair , it rose quietly from the ground at the back like the base of a large column , and ran along one side , nearly filling [a deep , rather narrow channel]1007-a deep , rather narrow channel . [I]0-i considered [the place]2672-the place , and saw that , if [I]0-i could find a few fallen boughs long enough to lie across [the channel]1009-the channel , and large enough to bear a little weight without bending much , [I]0-i might , with smaller branches and plenty of leaves , make upon them a comfortable couch , which [the stream under]1010-the stream under would keep constantly warm . Then [I]0-i ran back to see how [my]0-i charge fared . [She]1011-her was lying as [I]0-i had left [her]1011-her . The heat had not brought [her]1011-her to life , but neither had it developed anything to check farther hope . [I]0-i got a few boulders out of [the channel]1009-the channel , and arranged them at [her]1011-her feet and on both sides of [her]1011-her . Running again to [the wood]2922-the wood , [I]0-i had not to search long ere [I]0-i found some small boughs fit for [my]0-i purpose — mostly of beech , their dry yellow leaves yet clinging to them . With these [I]0-i had soon laid the floor of a bridge - bed over the torrent . [I]0-i crossed the boughs with smaller branches , interlaced these with twigs , and buried all deep in leaves and dry moss . When thus at length , after not a few journeys to [the forest]314-the forest , [I]0-i had completed a warm , dry , soft couch , [I]0-i took the body once more , and set out with [it]1015-it for [the cave]1016-the cave . It was so light that now and then as [I]0-i went [I]0-i almost feared lest , when [I]0-i laid it down , [I]0-i should find it a skeleton after all ; and when at last [I]0-i did lay it gently on the pathless bridge , it was a greater relief to part with that fancy than with the weight . Once more [I]0-i covered the body with a thick layer of leaves ; and trying again to feed [her]1011-her with a grape , found to [my]0-i joy that [I]0-i could open the mouth a little farther . The grape , indeed , lay in it unheeded , but [I]0-i hoped some of the juice might find its way down . After an hour or two on the couch , [she]1011-her was no longer cold . The warmth of [the brook]1017-the brook had interpenetrated [her]1011-her frame — truly it was but a frame!—and [she]1011-her was warm to the touch;—not , probably , with the warmth of life , but with a warmth which rendered it more possible , if [she]1011-her were alive , that [she]1011-her might live . [I]0-i had read of [one in a trance]1018-one in a trance lying motionless for weeks ! In [that cave]1019-that cave , day after day , night after night , seven long days and nights , [I]0-i sat or lay , now waking now sleeping , but always watching . Every morning [I]0-i went out and bathed in [the hot stream]1020-the hot stream , and every morning felt thereupon as if [I]0-i had eaten and drunk — which experience gave [me]0-i courage to lay [her]1011-her in it also every day . Once as [I]0-i did so , a shadow of discoloration on [her]1011-her left side gave [me]0-i a terrible shock , but the next morning it had vanished , and [I]0-i continued the treatment — every morning , after [her]1011-her bath , putting a fresh grape in [her]1011-her mouth . [I]0-i too ate of the grapes and other berries [I]0-i found in [the forest]314-the forest ; but [I]0-i believed that , with [my]0-i daily bath in [that river]1022-that river , [I]0-i could have done very well without eating at all . Every time [I]0-i slept , [I]0-i dreamed of finding [a wounded angel]1023-a wounded angel , who , unable to fly , remained with [me]0-i until at last [she]1023-a wounded angel loved [me]0-i and would not leave [me]0-i ; and every time [I]0-i woke , it was to see , instead of [an angel - visage with lustrous eyes]1024-an angel - visage with lustrous eyes , the white , motionless , wasted face upon the couch . But [Adam]58-adam [himself]58-adam , when first [he]58-adam saw [her]1011-her asleep , could not have looked more anxiously for [Eve]59-eve 's awaking than [I]0-i watched for [this woman]995-this woman 's . [Adam]58-adam knew nothing of [himself]58-adam , perhaps nothing of [his]58-adam need of another self ; [I]0-i , [an alien from [[my]0-i fellows]1027-my fellows]1026-an alien from my fellows , had learned to love what [I]0-i had lost ! Were this one wasted shred of womanhood to disappear , [I]0-i should have nothing in [me]0-i but a consuming hunger after life ! [I]0-i forgot even the Little Ones : things were not amiss with [them]1028-them ! here lay what might wake and be [a woman]344-a woman ! might actually open eyes , and look out of them upon [me]0-i ! Now first [I]0-i knew what solitude meant — now that [I]0-i gazed on [one who neither saw nor heard , neither moved nor spoke]1030-one who neither saw nor heard , neither moved nor spoke . [I]0-i saw now that [a man]109-a man alone is but [a being that may become a man]1032-a being that may become a man — that [he]109-a man is but a need , and therefore a possibility . To be enough for [himself]109-a man , [a being]1033-a being must be an eternal , self - existent worm ! So superbly constituted , so simply complicate is [man]2682-man ; [he]2682-man rises from and stands upon such [a pedestal of lower physical organisms and spiritual structures]1035-a pedestal of lower physical organisms and spiritual structures , that no atmosphere will comfort or nourish [his]2682-man life , less divine than that offered by [other souls]1036-other souls ; nowhere but in other lives can [he]2682-man breathe . Only by the reflex of other lives can [he]2682-man ripen [his]2682-man specialty , develop the idea of [himself]2682-man , the individuality that distinguishes [him]2682-man from every other . Were [all men]1037-all men alike , each would still have an individuality , secured by [his]2682-man personal consciousness , but there would be small reason why there should be more than two or three such ; while , for the development of the differences which make a large and lofty unity possible , and which alone can make millions into a church , an endless and measureless influence and reaction are indispensable . [A man to be perfect]1038-a man to be perfect — complete , that is , in having reached the spiritual condition of persistent and universal growth , which is the mode wherein [he]2682-man inherits the infinitude of [[his]2682-man Father]433-his father — must have the education of a world of [fellow - men]1040-fellow - men . Save for the hope of the dawn of life in the form beside [me]0-i , [I]0-i should have fled for fellowship to the beasts that grazed and did not speak . Better to go about with [them]1041-them — infinitely better — than to live alone ! But with the faintest prospect of [a woman]344-a woman to [[my]0-i friend]3235-my friend , [I]0-i , poorest of creatures , was yet [a possible man]1044-a possible man ! [I]0-i WOKE one morning from a profound sleep , with one of [my]0-i hands very painful . The back of it was much swollen , and in the centre of the swelling was a triangular wound , like the bite of a leech . As the day went on , the swelling subsided , and by the evening the hurt was all but healed . [I]0-i searched [the cave]1016-the cave , turning over every stone of any size , but discovered nothing [I]0-i could imagine capable of injuring [me]0-i . Slowly the days passed , and still the body never moved , never opened [its]1046-its eyes . [It]1046-its could not be dead , for assuredly it manifested no sign of decay , and the air about it was quite pure . Moreover , [I]0-i could imagine that the sharpest angles of the bones had begun to disappear , that the form was everywhere a little rounder , and that the skin had less of the parchment - look : if such change was indeed there , life must be there ! the tide which had ebbed so far toward the infinite , must have begun again to flow ! Oh joy to [me]0-i , if the rising ripples of life 's ocean were indeed burying under lovely shape the bones it had all but forsaken ! Twenty times a day [I]0-i looked for evidence of progress , and twenty times a day [I]0-i doubted — sometimes even despaired ; but the moment [I]0-i recalled the mental picture of [her]344-a woman as [I]0-i found [her]344-a woman , hope revived . Several weeks had passed thus , when one night , after lying a long time awake , [I]0-i rose , thinking to go out and breathe the cooler air ; for , although from the running of [the stream]990-the stream it was always fresh in [the cave]1016-the cave , the heat was not seldom a little oppressive . The moon outside was full , the air within shadowy clear , and naturally [I]0-i cast a lingering look on [my]0-i treasure ere [I]0-i went . " Bliss eternal ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried aloud , " do [I]0-i see [her]344-a woman eyes ? "[0-i] Great orbs , dark as if cut from the sphere of a starless night , and luminous by excess of darkness , seemed to shine amid the glimmering whiteness of [her]344-a woman face . [I]0-i stole nearer , [my]0-i heart beating so that [I]0-i feared the noise of it startling [her]344-a woman . [I]0-i bent over [her]344-a woman . Alas , [her]344-a woman eyelids were close shut ! Hope and Imagination had wrought mutual illusion ! [my]0-i heart 's desire would never be ! [I]0-i turned away , threw [myself]0-i on the floor of [the cave]1016-the cave , and wept . Then [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i that [her]344-a woman eyes had been a little open , and that now the awful chink out of which nothingness had peered , was gone : it might be that [she]344-a woman had opened them for a moment , and was again asleep!—it might be [she]344-a woman was awake and holding them close ! In either case , life , less or more , must have shut them ! [I]0-i was comforted , and fell fast asleep . That night [I]0-i was again bitten , and awoke with a burning thirst . In the morning [I]0-i searched yet more thoroughly , but again in vain . The wound was of the same character , and , as before , was nearly well by the evening . [I]0-i concluded that [some large creature of the leech kind]1050-some large creature of the leech kind came occasionally from [the hot stream]1020-the hot stream . " But , if blood be its object , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , " so long as [I]0-i am there , [I]0-i need hardly fear for [my]0-i treasure ! "[0-i] That same morning , when , having peeled a grape as usual and taken away the seeds , [I]0-i put it in [her]344-a woman mouth , [her]344-a woman lips made a slight movement of reception , and [I]0-i knew [she]344-a woman lived ! [My]0-i hope was now so much stronger that [I]0-i began to think of some attire for [her]344-a woman : [she]344-a woman must be able to rise the moment [she]344-a woman wished ! [I]0-i betook [myself]0-i therefore to [the forest]314-the forest , to investigate what material it might afford , and had hardly begun to look when fibrous skeletons , like those of the leaves of the prickly pear , suggested themselves as fit for the purpose . [I]0-i gathered a stock of them , laid them to dry in the sun , pulled apart the reticulated layers , and of these had soon begun to fashion two loose garments , one to hang from [her]344-a woman waist , the other from [her]344-a woman shoulders . With the stiletto - point of an aloe - leaf and various filaments , [I]0-i sewed together three thicknesses of the tissue . During the week that followed , there was no farther sign except that [she]344-a woman more evidently took the grapes . But indeed all the signs became surer : plainly [she]344-a woman was growing plumper , and [her]344-a woman skin fairer . Still [she]344-a woman did not open [her]344-a woman eyes ; and the horrid fear would at times invade [me]0-i , that [her]344-a woman growth was of some hideous fungoid nature , the few grapes being nowise sufficient to account for it . Again [I]0-i was bitten ; and now the thing , whatever it was , began to pay [me]0-i regular visits at intervals of three days . [It]1053-it now generally bit [me]0-i in the neck or the arm , invariably with but one bite , always while [I]0-i slept , and never , even when [I]0-i slept , in the daytime . Hour after hour would [I]0-i lie awake on the watch , but never heard it coming , or saw sign of its approach . Neither , [I]0-i believe , did [I]0-i ever feel it bite [me]0-i . At length [I]0-i became so hopeless of catching it , that [I]0-i no longer troubled [myself]0-i either to look for it by day , or lie in wait for it at night . [I]0-i knew from [my]0-i growing weakness that [I]0-i was losing blood at a dangerous rate , but [I]0-i cared little for that : in sight of [my]0-i eyes death was yielding to life ; a soul was gathering strength to save [me]0-i from loneliness ; [we]1054-we would go away together , and [I]0-i should speedily recover ! The garments were at length finished , and , contemplating [my]0-i handiwork with no small satisfaction , [I]0-i proceeded to mat layers of the fibre into sandals . One night [I]0-i woke suddenly , breathless and faint , and longing after air , and had risen to crawl from [the cave]1016-the cave , when a slight rustle in the leaves of the couch set [me]0-i listening motionless . " [I]1056-i caught the vile thing , "[1056-i] said a feeble voice , in [my]0-i mother - tongue ; " [I]1056-i caught it in the very act ! "[1056-i] [She]1056-i was alive ! [she]1056-i spoke ! [I]0-i dared not yield to [my]0-i transport lest [I]0-i should terrify [her]1056-i . " What creature ? "[0-i] [I]0-i breathed , rather than said . " The creature , "[1056-i] [she]1056-i answered , " that was biting [you]0-i . "[1056-i] " What was it ? "[0-i] " A great white leech . "[1056-i] " How big ? "[0-i] [I]0-i pursued , forcing [myself]0-i to be calm . " Not far from six feet long , [I]1056-i should think , "[1056-i] [she]1056-i answered . " [You]0-i have saved [my]0-i life , perhaps!—But how could [you]1056-i touch the horrid thing ! How brave of [you]1056-i ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " [I]1056-i did ! "[1056-i] was all [her]1056-i answer , and [I]0-i thought [she]1056-i shuddered . " Where is it ? What could [you]1056-i do with [such a monster]3246-such a monster ? "[1056-i] " [I]1056-i threw it in [the river]853-the river . "[1056-i] " Then it will come again , [I]1056-i fear ! "[1056-i] " [I]1056-i do not think [I]1056-i could have killed [it]3246-such a monster , even had [I]1056-i known how!—I heard [you]1056-i moaning , and got up to see what disturbed [you]1056-i ; saw the frightful thing at [your]1056-i neck , and pulled it away . But [I]1056-i could not hold it , and was hardly able to throw it from [me]1056-i . [I]1056-i only heard it splash in [the water]3248-the water ! "[1056-i] " [We]3249-we 'll kill it next time ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; but with that [I]0-i turned faint , sought the open air , but fell . When [I]0-i came to [myself]0-i the sun was up . [The lady]951-the lady stood a little way off , looking , even in the clumsy attire [I]0-i had fashioned for [her]951-the lady , at once grand and graceful . [I]0-i had seen those glorious eyes ! Through the night they had shone ! Dark as the darkness primeval , they now outshone the day ! [She]951-the lady stood erect as a column , regarding [me]0-i . [Her]951-the lady pale cheek indicated no emotion , only question . [I]0-i rose . " [We]3249-we must be going ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [The white leech]3250-the white leech — — "[0-i] [I]0-i stopped : a strange smile had flickered over [her]951-the lady beautiful face . " Did [you]0-i find [me]951-the lady there ? "[951-the lady] " Because [I]0-i hoped [you]951-the lady were not dead . "[0-i] " Why should [you]951-the lady have cared ? "[1059-her] " Doubtless [you]951-the lady pitied [me]951-the lady ! "[951-the lady] " Never had [woman]377-woman more claim on pity , or less on any other feeling ! "[1059-her] With an expression of pain , mortification , and anger unutterable , [she]1059-her turned from [me]0-i and stood silent . " Had [you]0-i failed to rouse [me]1059-her , what would [you]0-i have done ? "[1059-her] [she]1059-her asked suddenly without moving . " [I]1059-her would have buried it . "[1059-her] " It ! [What?—You]3255-what?—you would have buried this ? " Nay ; that [I]1059-her saw not ! "[1059-her] " [I]1059-her can not tell how long [you]1059-her had lain when [I]1059-her found [you]1059-her , but there was nothing left of [you]1059-her save skin and bone : that is more than three months ago.—Your hair was beautiful , nothing else ! "[1059-her] " There is no need , [madam]3076-madam : [I]1059-her would have done the same for [any woman]3260-any woman — yes , or for [any man]3166-any man either !
