" — [You]0-i have done [me]1059-her the two worst of wrongs — compelled [me]1059-her to live , and put [me]1059-her to shame : neither of [them]3265-them can [I]1059-her pardon ! "[1059-her] [She]1059-her raised [her]1059-her left hand , and flung it out as if repelling [me]0-i . Something ice - cold struck [me]0-i on the forehead . When [I]0-i came to [myself]0-i , [I]0-i was on the ground , wet and shivering . [I]0-i ROSE , and looked around [me]0-i , dazed at heart . For a moment [I]0-i could not see [her]1059-her : [she]1059-her was gone , and loneliness had returned like the cloud after the rain ! [She]1059-her whom [I]0-i brought back from the brink of [the grave]1064-the grave , had fled from [me]0-i , and left [me]0-i with desolation ! [I]0-i dared not one moment remain thus hideously alone . Had [I]0-i indeed done [her]1059-her a wrong ? [I]0-i must devote [my]0-i life to sharing the burden [I]0-i had compelled [her]1059-her to resume ! [I]0-i descried [her]1059-her walking swiftly over the grass , away from [the river]853-the river , took one plunge for a farewell restorative , and set out to follow [her]1059-her . The last visit of [the white leech]3250-the white leech , and the blow of [the woman]348-the woman , had enfeebled [me]0-i , but already [my]0-i strength was reviving , and [I]0-i kept [her]1059-her in sight without difficulty . " Is this , then , the end ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said as [I]0-i went , and [my]0-i heart brooded a sad song . [Her]1059-her angry , hating eyes haunted [me]0-i . [I]0-i could understand [her]1059-her resentment at [my]0-i having forced life upon [her]1059-her , but how had [I]0-i farther injured [her]1059-her ? Why should [she]1059-her loathe [me]0-i ? Could modesty itself be indignant with true service ? How should [the proudest woman]1068-the proudest woman , conscious of [my]0-i every action , cherish against [me]0-i the least sense of disgracing wrong ? How reverently had [I]0-i not touched [her]1059-her ! As [a father]1069-a father [[his]1069-a father motherless child]1070-his motherless child , [I]0-i had borne and tended [her]1059-her ! Had all [my]0-i labour , all [my]0-i despairing hope gone to redeem only ingratitude ? " No , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered [myself]0-i ; " beauty must have a heart ! However profoundly hidden , it must be there ! The deeper buried , the stronger and truer will it wake at last in [its]3266-its beautiful grave ! To rouse that heart were a better gift to [her]1059-her than the happiest life ! It would be to give [her]1059-her a nobler , a higher life ! "[0-i] [She]1059-her was ascending a gentle slope before [me]0-i , walking straight and steady as one that knew whither , when [I]0-i became aware that [she]1059-her was increasing the distance between [us]1071-us . [I]0-i summoned [my]0-i strength , and it came in full tide . [My]0-i veins filled with fresh life ! [My]0-i body seemed to become ethereal , and , following like an easy wind , [I]0-i rapidly overtook [her]1059-her . Not once had [she]1059-her looked behind . Swiftly [she]1059-her moved , like [a Greek goddess to rescue , but without haste]1072-a greek goddess to rescue , but without haste . [I]0-i was within three yards of [her]1059-her , when [she]1059-her turned sharply , yet with grace unbroken , and stood . Fatigue or heat [she]1059-her showed none . [Her]1059-her paleness was not pallor , but a pure whiteness ; [her]1059-her breathing was slow and deep . [Her]1059-her eyes seemed to fill the heavens , and give light to [the world]108-the world . It was nearly noon , but the sense was upon [me]0-i as of a great night in which an invisible dew makes the stars look large . " Why do [you]0-i follow [me]1059-her ? "[1059-her] [she]1059-her asked , quietly but rather sternly , as if [she]1059-her had never before seen [me]0-i . " [I]1059-her have lived so long , "[1059-her] [I]0-i answered , " on the mere hope of [your]1059-her eyes , that [I]0-i must want to see them again ! "[0-i] " [You]0-i will not be spared ! "[1059-her] [she]1059-her said coldly . " [I]1059-her command [you]0-i to stop where [you]0-i stand . "[1059-her] " Not until [I]0-i see [you]1059-her in a place of safety will [I]0-i leave [you]1059-her , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " Then take the consequences , "[1059-her] [she]1059-her said , and resumed [her]1059-her swift - gliding walk . But as [she]1059-her turned [she]1059-her cast on [me]0-i a glance , and [I]0-i stood as if run through with a spear . [Her]1059-her scorn had failed : [she]1059-her would kill [me]0-i with [her]1059-her beauty ! Despair restored [my]0-i volition ; the spell broke ; [I]0-i ran , and overtook [her]1059-her . " Have pity upon [me]0-i ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . [She]1059-her gave no heed . [I]0-i followed [her]1059-her like [a child whose mother]1074-a child whose mother pretends to abandon [him]1074-a child whose mother . " [I]0-i will be [[your]1059-her slave]3267-your slave ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and laid [my]0-i hand on [her]1059-her arm . [She]1059-her turned as if a serpent had bit [her]1059-her . [I]0-i cowered before the blaze of [her]1059-her eyes , but could not avert [my]0-i own . " Pity [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried again . [She]1059-her resumed [her]1059-her walking . The whole day [I]0-i followed [her]1059-her . The sun climbed the sky , seemed to pause on its summit , went down the other side . Not a moment did [she]1059-her pause , not a moment did [I]0-i cease to follow . [She]1059-her never turned [her]1059-her head , never relaxed [her]1059-her pace . The sun went below , and the night came up . [I]0-i kept close to [her]1059-her : if [I]0-i lost sight of [her]1059-her for a moment , it would be for ever ! All day long [we]1075-we had been walking over thick soft grass : abruptly [she]1059-her stopped , and threw [herself]1059-her upon it . There was yet light enough to show that [she]1059-her was utterly weary . [I]0-i stood behind [her]1059-her , and gazed down on [her]1059-her for a moment . Did [I]0-i love [her]1059-her ? [I]0-i knew [she]1059-her was not good ! Did [I]0-i hate [her]1059-her ? [I]0-i could not leave [her]1059-her ! [I]0-i knelt beside [her]1059-her . " [Begone]61-begone ! Do not dare touch [me]1059-her , "[1059-her] [she]1059-her cried . [Her]1059-her arms lay on the grass by [her]1059-her sides as if paralyzed . Suddenly they closed about [my]0-i neck , rigid as those of [the torture - maiden]1076-the torture - maiden . [She]1059-her drew down [my]0-i face to [hers]1059-her , and [her]1059-her lips clung to [my]0-i cheek . A sting of pain shot somewhere through [me]0-i , and pulsed . [I]0-i could not stir a hair 's breadth . Gradually the pain ceased . A slumberous weariness , a dreamy pleasure stole over [me]0-i , and then [I]0-i knew nothing . All at once [I]0-i came to [myself]0-i . The moon was a little way above the horizon , but spread no radiance ; [she]1059-her was but a bright thing set in blackness . [My]0-i cheek smarted ; [I]0-i put [my]0-i hand to it , and found a wet spot . [My]0-i neck ached : there again was a wet spot ! [I]0-i sighed heavily , and felt very tired . [I]0-i turned [my]0-i eyes listlessly around [me]0-i — and saw what had become of the light of the moon : it was gathered about [the lady]951-the lady ! [she]951-the lady stood in a shimmering nimbus ! [I]0-i rose and staggered toward [her]951-the lady . " Down ! "[951-the lady] [she]951-the lady cried imperiously , as to a rebellious dog . " Follow [me]951-the lady a step if [you]0-i dare ! "[951-the lady] " [I]0-i will ! "[0-i] [I]0-i murmured , with an agonised effort . " Set foot within the gates of [[my]0-i city]3268-my city , and [[my]0-i people]3269-my people will stone [you]0-i : [they]3269-my people do not love [beggars]3270-beggars ! "[0-i] [I]0-i was deaf to [her]951-the lady words . Weak as water , and half awake , [I]0-i did not know that [I]0-i moved , but the distance grew less between [us]1078-us . [She]951-the lady took one step back , raised [her]951-the lady left arm , and with the clenched hand seemed to strike [me]0-i on the forehead . [I]0-i received as it were a blow from an iron hammer , and fell . [I]0-i sprang to [my]0-i feet , cold and wet , but clear - headed and strong . Had the blow revived [me]0-i ? it had left neither wound nor pain!—But how came [I]0-i wet?—I could not have lain long , for the moon was no higher ! [The lady]951-the lady stood some yards away , [her]951-the lady back toward [me]0-i . [She]951-the lady was doing something , [I]0-i could not distinguish what . Then by [her]951-the lady sudden gleam [I]0-i knew [she]951-the lady had thrown off [her]951-the lady garments , and stood white in the dazed moon . One moment [she]951-the lady stood — and fell forward . A streak of white shot away in a swift - drawn line . The same instant the moon recovered [herself]951-the lady , shining out with a full flash , and [I]0-i saw that the streak was a long - bodied thing , rushing in great , low - curved bounds over the grass . Dark spots seemed to run like a stream adown its back , as if it had been fleeting along under the edge of a wood , and catching the shadows of the leaves . " [God of mercy]3271-god of mercy ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , " is the terrible creature speeding to the night - infolded city?"—and[0-i] [I]0-i seemed to hear from afar the sudden burst and spread of outcrying terror , as [the pale savage]1080-the pale savage bounded from [house]1081-house to [house]1081-house , rending and slaying . While [I]0-i gazed after [it]1080-the pale savage fear - stricken , past [me]0-i from behind , like a swift , all but noiseless arrow , shot a second large creature , pure white . [Its]1080-the pale savage path was straight for the spot where [the lady]951-the lady had fallen , and , as [I]0-i thought , lay . [My]0-i tongue clave to the roof of [my]0-i mouth . [I]0-i sprang forward pursuing the beast . But in a moment the spot [I]0-i made for was far behind [it]1080-the pale savage . " It was well , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought , " that [I]0-i could not cry out : if [she]951-the lady had risen , [the monster]3272-the monster would have been upon [her]951-the lady ! "[0-i] But when [I]0-i reached [the place]2672-the place , [no lady]2735-no lady was there ; only the garments [she]951-the lady had dropped lay dusk in the moonlight . [I]0-i stood staring after the second beast . It tore over the ground with yet greater swiftness than the former — in long , level , skimming leaps , the very embodiment of wasteless speed . [It]1080-the pale savage followed the line the other had taken , and [I]0-i watched [it]1080-the pale savage grow smaller and smaller , until it disappeared in the uncertain distance . But where was [the lady]951-the lady ? Had the first beast surprised [her]951-the lady , creeping upon [her]951-the lady noiselessly ? [I]0-i had heard no shriek ! and there had not been time to devour [her]951-the lady ! Could it have caught [her]951-the lady up as it ran , and borne [her]951-the lady away to its den ? So laden it could not have run so fast ! and [I]0-i should have seen that it carried something ! Horrible doubts began to wake in [me]0-i . After a thorough but fruitless search , [I]0-i set out in the track of the two animals . AS [I]0-i hastened along , a cloud came over the moon , and from the gray dark suddenly emerged a white figure , clasping [a child]106-a child to [her]1088-her bosom , and stooping as [she]1088-her ran . [She]1088-her was on a line parallel with [my]0-i own , but did not perceive [me]0-i as [she]1088-her hurried along , terror and anxiety in every movement of [her]1088-her driven speed . " [She]1088-her is chased ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i . " [Some prowler of this terrible night]3273-some prowler of this terrible night is after [her]1088-her ! "[0-i] To follow would have added to [her]1088-her fright : [I]0-i stepped into [her]1088-her track to stop [[her]1088-her pursuer]1089-her pursuer . As [I]0-i stood for a moment looking after [her]1088-her through the dusk , behind [me]0-i came a swift , soft - footed rush , and ere [I]0-i could turn , something sprang over [my]0-i head , struck [me]0-i sharply on the forehead , and knocked [me]0-i down . [I]0-i was up in an instant , but all [I]0-i saw of [[my]0-i assailant]1090-my assailant was a vanishing whiteness . [I]0-i ran after the beast , with the blood trickling from [my]0-i forehead ; but had run only a few steps , when a shriek of despair tore the quivering night . [I]0-i ran the faster , though [I]0-i could not but fear it must already be too late . In a minute or two [I]0-i spied a low white shape approaching [me]0-i through the vapour - dusted moonlight . It must be another beast , [I]0-i thought at first , for it came slowly , almost crawling , with strange , floundering leaps , as of a creature in agony ! [I]0-i drew aside from [its]1088-her path , and waited . As [it]1088-her neared [me]0-i , [I]0-i saw [it]1088-her was going on three legs , carrying its left fore paw high from the ground . [It]1088-her had many dark , oval spots on a shining white skin , and was attended by a low rushing sound , as of water falling upon grass . "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , " [some readier champion]3274-some readier champion than [I]0-i has wounded the beast ! "[0-i] But , strange to tell , such a pity seized [me]0-i at sight of [the suffering creature]1091-the suffering creature , that , though an axe had been in [my]0-i hand [I]0-i could not have struck at it . " If it go on bleeding like that , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought , " it will soon be hurtless ! "[0-i] [I]0-i heard a little movement . Clouds had by this time gathered so thick over the moon that [I]0-i could scarcely see [[my]0-i companion]475-my companion : [I]0-i feared [she]475-my companion was rising to run from [me]0-i . " [You]475-my companion are in no danger of any sort from [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " What oath would [you]475-my companion like [me]0-i to take ? "[0-i] " [I]475-my companion know by [your]0-i speech that [you]0-i are not of [the people of [Bulika]6-bulika]3106-the people of bulika , "[475-my companion] [she]475-my companion replied ; " [I]475-my companion will trust you!—I am not of [them]3106-the people of bulika , either , else [I]475-my companion should not be able : [they]3106-the people of bulika never trust any one.—If only [I]475-my companion could see [you]0-i ! But [I]475-my companion like [your]0-i voice!—There , [[my]475-my companion darling]3283-my darling is asleep ! [The foul beast]3291-the foul beast has not hurt her!—Yes : it was [[my]475-my companion baby]3282-my baby [she]3291-the foul beast was after ! "[475-my companion] [she]475-my companion went on , caressing [the child]698-the child . " And then [she]3291-the foul beast would have torn [[her]3291-the foul beast mother]3293-her mother to pieces for carrying [her]3291-the foul beast off!—Some say [the princess]3100-the princess has two white leopardesses , "[475-my companion] [she]475-my companion continued : " [I]475-my companion know only one — with spots . [Everybody]154-everybody knows [her]3291-the foul beast ! If [the princess]3100-the princess hear of [a baby]2974-a baby , [she]3100-the princess sends [her]3100-the princess immediately to suck its blood , and then [it]2974-a baby either dies or grows up [an idiot]287-an idiot . [I]475-my companion would have gone away with [[my]475-my companion baby]3282-my baby , but [the princess]3100-the princess was from [home]2676-home , and [I]475-my companion thought [I]475-my companion might wait until [I]475-my companion was a little stronger . But [she]3100-the princess must have taken the beast with [her]3100-the princess , and been on [her]3100-the princess way [home]2676-home when [I]475-my companion left , and come across [[my]475-my companion track]3303-my track . [I]475-my companion heard the sniff - snuff of the leopardess behind [me]475-my companion , and ran;—oh , how [I]475-my companion ran!—But [[my]475-my companion darling]3283-my darling will not die ! There is no mark on [her]3100-the princess ! "[475-my companion] " Where are [you]475-my companion taking [her]3100-the princess ? "[475-my companion] " Where [no one]134-no one ever tells ! "[475-my companion] " Why is [the princess]3100-the princess so cruel ? "[475-my companion] " There is an old prophecy that [a child]106-a child will be the death of [her]3100-the princess . That is why [she]3100-the princess will listen to no offer of marriage , [they]3308-they say . "[475-my companion] " But what will become of [[her]3100-the princess country]3094-her country if [she]3100-the princess kill [all the babies]3310-all the babies ? "[475-my companion] " [She]3100-the princess does not care about [[her]3100-the princess country]3094-her country . [She]3100-the princess sends [witches]3312-witches around to teach [the women]627-the women spells that keep [babies]3314-babies away , and give [them]3314-babies horrible things to eat . [Some]2784-some say [she]3100-the princess is in league with [the Shadows]62-the shadows to put an end to the race . At night [we]3316-we hear [the questing beast]3317-the questing beast , and lie awake and shiver . [She]3317-the questing beast can tell at once [the house]112-the house where [a baby]2974-a baby is coming , and lies down at the door , watching to get in . There are words that have power to shoo [her]3317-the questing beast away , only they do not always work.—But here [I]475-my companion sit talking , and the beast may by this time have got [home]2676-home , and [[her]3317-the questing beast mistress]3321-her mistress be sending the other after [us]3316-we ! "[475-my companion] As thus [she]1100-she ended , [she]1100-she rose in haste . " [I]0-i do not think [she]3317-the questing beast will ever get home.—Let [me]0-i carry [the baby]673-the baby for [you]1100-she ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , as [I]0-i rose also . [She]1100-she returned [me]0-i no answer , and when [I]0-i would have taken it , only clasped it the closer . " [I]0-i can not think , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , walking by [her]1100-she side , " how [the brute]1095-the brute could be bleeding so much ! "[0-i] " Take [my]1100-she advice , and do n't go near [the palace]3135-the palace , "[1100-she] [she]1100-she answered . " There are sounds in it at night as if the dead were trying to shriek , but could not open [their]3325-their mouths ! "[1100-she] [She]1100-she bade [me]0-i an abrupt farewell . Plainly [she]1100-she did not want more of [[my]0-i company]1101-my company ; so [I]0-i stood still , and heard [her]1100-she footsteps die away on the grass . [I]0-i HAD lost all notion of [my]0-i position , and was walking about in pure , helpless impatience , when suddenly [I]0-i found [myself]0-i in the path of the leopardess , wading in the blood from [her]1100-she paw . It ran against [my]0-i ankles with the force of [a small brook]1102-a small brook , and [I]0-i got out of it the more quickly because of an unshaped suspicion in [my]0-i mind as to whose blood it might be . But [I]0-i kept close to the sound of it , walking up the side of [the stream]990-the stream , for it would guide [me]0-i in the direction of [Bulika]6-bulika . [I]0-i soon began to reflect , however , that no leopardess , no elephant , no hugest animal that in [[our]1104-our world]218-our world preceded [man]2682-man , could keep such a torrent flowing , except every artery in its body were open , and its huge system went on filling its vessels from [fields]1107-fields and [lakes]1108-lakes and [forests]1109-forests as fast as they emptied themselves : it could not be blood ! [I]0-i dipped a finger in it , and at once satisfied [myself]0-i that it was not . In truth , however it might have come there , it was a softly murmuring rivulet of water that ran , without channel , over the grass ! But sweet as was its song , [I]0-i dared not drink of it ; [I]0-i kept walking on , hoping after the light , and listening to the familiar sound so long unheard — for that of [the hot stream]1020-the hot stream was very different . The mere wetting of [my]0-i feet in it , however , had so refreshed [me]0-i , that [I]0-i went on without fatigue till the darkness began to grow thinner , and [I]0-i knew the sun was drawing nigh . A few minutes more , and [I]0-i could discern , against the pale aurora , the wall - towers of [a city]610-a city — seemingly old as time itself . Then [I]0-i looked down to get a sight of [the brook]1017-the brook . It was gone . [I]0-i had indeed for a long time noted its sound growing fainter , but at last had ceased to attend to it . [I]0-i looked back : the grass in [its]1017-the brook course lay bent as it had flowed , and here and there glimmered a small pool . Toward [the city]3099-the city , there was no trace of [it]1017-the brook . Near where [I]0-i stood , the flow of [its]1017-the brook fountain must at least have paused ! Around [the city]3099-the city were [gardens]1115-gardens , growing many sorts of vegetables , hardly one of which [I]0-i recognised . [I]0-i saw no water , no flowers , no sign of animals . [The gardens]1116-the gardens came very near the walls , but were separated from [them]1116-the gardens by huge heaps of gravel and refuse thrown from the battlements . [I]0-i went up to the nearest gate , and found [it]1017-the brook but half - closed , nowise secured , and without guard or sentinel . To judge by [its]1017-the brook hinges , it could not be farther opened or shut closer . Passing through , [I]0-i looked down [a long ancient street]1117-a long ancient street . [It]1117-a long ancient street was utterly silent , and with scarce an indication in it of life present . Had [I]0-i come upon [a dead city]1118-a dead city ? [I]0-i turned and went out again , toiled a long way over the dust - heaps , and crossed [several roads]1119-several roads , each leading up to a gate : [I]0-i would not re - enter until [some of [the inhabitants]3122-the inhabitants]1120-some of the inhabitants should be stirring . What was [I]0-i there for ? what did [I]0-i expect or hope to find ? what did [I]0-i mean to do ? [I]0-i must see , if but once more , [the woman [I]0-i had brought to life]1122-the woman i had brought to life ! [I]0-i did not desire [her]1122-the woman i had brought to life society : [she]1122-the woman i had brought to life had waked in [me]0-i frightful suspicions ; and friendship , not to say love , was wildly impossible between [us]1123-us ! But [her]1122-the woman i had brought to life presence had had a strange influence upon [me]0-i , and in [her]1122-the woman i had brought to life presence [I]0-i must resist , and at the same time analyse that influence ! The seemingly inscrutable in [her]1122-the woman i had brought to life [I]0-i would fain penetrate : to understand something of [her]1122-the woman i had brought to life mode of being would be to look into marvels such as imagination could never have suggested ! In this [I]0-i was too daring : [a man]109-a man must not , for knowledge , of [his]109-a man own will encounter temptation ! On the other hand , [I]0-i had reinstated [an evil force about to perish]1125-an evil force about to perish , and was , to the extent of [my]0-i opposing faculty , accountable for what mischief might ensue ! [I]0-i had learned that [she]1122-the woman i had brought to life was the enemy of [children]599-children : [the Little Ones]47-the little ones might be in [her]1122-the woman i had brought to life danger ! It was in the hope of finding out something of [their]599-children history that [I]0-i had left [them]599-children ; on that [I]0-i had received a little light : [I]0-i must have more ; [I]0-i must learn how to protect [them]599-children ! Hearing at length a little stir in [the place]2672-the place , [I]0-i walked through the next gate , and thence along [a narrow street of tall houses]1128-a narrow street of tall houses to [a little square , where [I]0-i sat down on the base of a pillar with a hideous bat - like creature atop]1129-a little square , where i sat down on the base of a pillar with a hideous bat - like creature atop . Ere long , [several of [the inhabitants]3122-the inhabitants]1130-several of the inhabitants came sauntering past . [I]0-i spoke to [one]2690-one : [he]2690-one gave [me]0-i a rude stare and ruder word , and went on . [I]0-i got up and went through [one narrow street]1133-one narrow street after another , gradually filling with idlers , and was not surprised to see [no children]1134-no children . By and by , near one of the gates , [I]0-i encountered [a group of young men who reminded [me]0-i not a little of [the bad giants]2993-the bad giants]1135-a group of young men who reminded me not a little of the bad giants . [They]1135-a group of young men who reminded me not a little of the bad giants came about [me]0-i staring , and presently began to push and hustle [me]0-i , then to throw things at [me]0-i . [I]0-i bore it as well as [I]0-i could , wishing not to provoke enmity where wanted to remain for a while . Oftener than once or twice [I]0-i appealed to passers - by whom [I]0-i fancied more benevolent - looking , but none would halt a moment to listen to [me]0-i . [I]0-i looked poor , and that was enough : to [the citizens of [Bulika]6-bulika]1137-the citizens of bulika , as to [house]1081-house - dogs , poverty was an offence ! Deformity and sickness were taxed ; and no legislation of [[their]1137-the citizens of bulika princess]3110-their princess was more heartily approved of than what tended to make poverty subserve wealth . [I]0-i took to [my]0-i heels at last , and [no one]134-no one followed [me]0-i beyond the gate . [A lumbering fellow]1141-a lumbering fellow , however , who sat by it eating a hunch of bread , picked up a stone to throw after [me]0-i , and happily , in [his]1141-a lumbering fellow stupid eagerness , threw , not the stone but the bread . [I]0-i took it , and [he]1141-a lumbering fellow did not dare follow to reclaim it : beyond the walls [they]1142-they were [cowards every one]1143-cowards every one . [I]0-i went off a few hundred yards , threw [myself]0-i down , ate the bread , fell asleep , and slept soundly in the grass , where the hot sunlight renewed [my]0-i strength . It was night when [I]0-i woke . The moon looked down on [me]0-i in friendly fashion , seeming to claim with [me]0-i old acquaintance . [She]1144-she was very bright , and the same moon , [I]0-i thought , that saw [me]0-i through the terrors of [my]0-i first night in [that strange world]1145-that strange world . A cold wind blew from the gate , bringing with it an evil odour ; but it did not chill [me]0-i , for the sun had plenished [me]0-i with warmth . [I]0-i crept again into [the city]3099-the city . There [I]0-i found [the few that were still in the open air crouched in corners to escape the shivering blast]1147-the few that were still in the open air crouched in corners to escape the shivering blast . [I]0-i was walking slowly through [the long narrow street]1148-the long narrow street , when , just before [me]0-i , a huge white thing bounded across [it]1148-the long narrow street , with a single flash in the moonlight , and disappeared . [I]0-i turned down the next opening , eager to get sight of [it]1149-it again . [It]1150-it was [a narrow lane]1151-a narrow lane , almost too narrow to pass through , but [it]1150-it led [me]0-i into [a wider street]1152-a wider street . The moment [I]0-i entered [the latter]1153-the latter , [I]0-i saw on the opposite side , in the shadow , the creature [I]0-i had followed , itself following like a dog what [I]0-i took for [a man]109-a man . Over [his]109-a man shoulder , every other moment , [he]109-a man glanced at the animal behind [him]109-a man , but neither spoke to it , nor attempted to drive it away . At a place where [he]109-a man had to cross a patch of moonlight , [I]0-i saw that [he]109-a man cast no shadow , and was [himself]109-a man but a flat superficial shadow , of two dimensions . [He]109-a man was , nevertheless , an opaque shadow , for [he]109-a man not merely darkened any object on [the other side of [him]109-a man]1155-the other side of him , but rendered it , in fact , invisible . In the shadow [he]109-a man was blacker than the shadow ; in the moonlight [he]109-a man looked like [one who had drawn [his]109-a man shadow up about [him]109-a man , for not a suspicion of it moved beside or under [him]109-a man]1156-one who had drawn his shadow up about him , for not a suspicion of it moved beside or under him ; while the gleaming animal , which followed so close at [his]109-a man heels as to seem the white shadow of [his]109-a man blackness , and which [I]0-i now saw to be a leopardess , drew [her]1157-her own gliding shadow black over the ground by [her]1157-her side . When [they]1158-they passed together from the shadow into the moonlight , the Shadow deepened in blackness , the animal flashed into radiance . [I]0-i was at the moment walking abreast of [them]1158-they on the opposite side , [my]0-i bare feet sounding on the flat stones : [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess never turned head or twitched ear ; [the Shadow]1160-the shadow seemed once to look at [me]0-i , for [I]0-i lost [his]109-a man profile , and saw for a second only a sharp upright line . That instant the wind found [me]0-i and blew through [me]0-i : [I]0-i shuddered from head to foot , and [my]0-i heart went from wall to wall of [my]0-i bosom , like a pebble in [a child]106-a child 's rattle . [I]0-i TURNED aside into [an alley]1162-an alley , and sought shelter in a small archway . In the mouth of [it]1162-an alley [I]0-i stopped , and looked out at the moonlight which filled [the alley]1163-the alley . The same instant [a woman]344-a woman came gliding in after [me]0-i , turned , trembling , and looked out also . A few seconds passed ; then a huge leopard , its white skin dappled with many blots , darted across [the archway]1165-the archway . [The woman]348-the woman pressed close to [me]0-i , and [my]0-i heart filled with pity . [I]0-i put [my]0-i arm round [her]348-the woman . " If [the brute]1095-the brute come here , [I]0-i will lay hold of it , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " and [you]348-the woman must run . "[0-i] " Thank [you]0-i ! "[348-the woman] [she]348-the woman murmured . " Have [you]348-the woman ever seen it before ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " Several times , "[348-the woman] [she]348-the woman answered , still trembling . " [She]1095-the brute is a pet of [the princess]3100-the princess 's . [You]0-i are [a stranger]2835-a stranger , or [you]0-i would know [her]1095-the brute ! "[348-the woman] " [I]0-i am [a stranger]2835-a stranger , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " But is [she]1095-the brute , then , allowed to run loose ? "[0-i] " [She]1095-the brute is kept in a cage , [her]1095-the brute mouth muzzled , and [her]1095-the brute feet in gloves of crocodile leather . Chained [she]1095-the brute is too ; but [she]1095-the brute gets out often , and sucks the blood of [any child [she]1095-the brute can lay hold of]3330-any child she can lay hold of . Happily there are [not many mothers in [Bulika]6-bulika]3331-not many mothers in bulika ! "[348-the woman] Here [she]348-the woman burst into tears . " [I]348-the woman wish [I]348-the woman were at [home]2676-home ! "[348-the woman] [she]348-the woman sobbed . " [The princess]3100-the princess returned only last night , and there is [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess out already ! How am [I]348-the woman to get into [the house]112-the house ? It is [me]348-the woman [she]1095-the brute is after , [I]348-the woman know ! [She]1095-the brute will be lying at [my]348-the woman own door , watching for me!—But [I]348-the woman am [a fool]3256-a fool to talk to [a stranger]2835-a stranger ! "[348-the woman] " [All strangers]3338-all strangers are not bad ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [The beast]3339-the beast shall not touch [you]0-i till [she]1095-the brute has done with [me]0-i , and by that time [you]0-i will be in . [You]0-i are happy to have [a house]3340-a house to go to ! What a terrible wind it is ! "[0-i] " Take [me]1167-she [home]2676-home safe , and [I]1167-she will give [you]0-i shelter from it , "[1167-she] [she]1167-she rejoined . " But [we]3342-we must wait a little ! "[1167-she] [I]0-i asked [her]1167-she many questions . [She]1167-she told [me]0-i [the people]1168-the people never did anything except dig for precious stones in [[their]1168-the people cellars]1169-their cellars . [They]1168-the people were rich , and had everything made for [them]1168-the people in [other towns]1170-other towns . " Why ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " Because it is a disgrace to work , "[1167-she] [she]1167-she answered . " [Everybody in [Bulika]6-bulika]3343-everybody in bulika knows that ! "[0-i] [I]0-i asked how [they]1168-the people were rich if [none of [them]1168-the people]685-none of them earned money . [She]1167-she replied that [[their]1168-the people ancestors]1172-their ancestors had saved for [them]1168-the people , and [they]1168-the people never spent . When [they]1168-the people wanted money [they]1168-the people sold a few of [their]1168-the people gems . " But there must be [some poor]3344-some poor ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [I]0-i suppose there must be , but [we]3345-we never think of [such people]3346-such people . When one goes poor , [we]3345-we forget [him]3347-him . That is how [we]3345-we keep rich . [We]3345-we mean to be rich always . "[0-i] " But when [you]0-i have dug up all [your]0-i precious stones and sold them , [you]0-i will have to spend [your]0-i money , and one day [you]0-i will have none left ! "[0-i] " [We]3345-we have so many , and there are so many still in the ground , that that day will never come , "[1173-she] [she]1173-she replied . " Suppose [a strange people]3348-a strange people were to fall upon [you]0-i , and take everything [you]0-i have ! "[1173-she] " [No strange people]3349-no strange people will dare ; [they]3349-no strange people are all horribly afraid of [[our]3345-we princess]3350-our princess . [She]3350-our princess it is who keeps [us]3345-we safe and free and rich ! "[1173-she] Every now and then as [she]1173-she spoke , [she]1173-she would stop and look behind [her]1173-she . [I]0-i asked why [[her]1173-she people]1174-her people had such a hatred of [strangers]3108-strangers . [She]1173-she answered that the presence of [a stranger]2835-a stranger defiled [the city]3099-the city . " How is that ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " Because [we]3345-we are more ancient and noble than any other nation.—Therefore , "[1173-she] [she]1173-she added , " [we]3345-we always turn [strangers]3108-strangers out before night . "[1173-she] " How , then , can [you]1173-she take [me]0-i into [[your]1173-she house]2723-your house ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [I]1173-she will make an exception of [you]0-i , "[1173-she] [she]1173-she replied . " Is there no place in [the city]3099-the city for the taking in of [strangers]3108-strangers ? "[1173-she] " Such [a place]3355-a place would be pulled down , and [[its]3355-a place owner]651-its owner burned . How is purity to be preserved except by keeping [low people]3357-low people at a proper distance ? Dignity is such a delicate thing ! "[1173-she] [She]1173-she told [me]0-i that [[their]1178-their princess]3110-their princess had reigned for thousands of years ; that [she]1173-she had power over the air and [the water]3248-the water as well as [the earth]2702-the earth — and , [she]1173-she believed , over the fire too ; that [she]1173-she could do what [she]1173-she pleased , and was answerable to [nobody]149-nobody . When at length [she]1173-she was willing to risk the attempt , [we]1183-we took [our]1183-we way through [lanes]1184-lanes and [narrow passages]1185-narrow passages , and reached [her]1173-she door without having met [a single live creature]1186-a single live creature . It was in [a wider street]1152-a wider street , between [two tall houses]1188-two tall houses , at the top of a narrow , steep stair , up which [she]1173-she climbed slowly , and [I]0-i followed . Ere [we]1183-we reached the top , however , [she]1173-she seemed to take fright , and darted up the rest of the steps : [I]0-i arrived just in time to have the door closed in [my]0-i face , and stood confounded on the landing , where was about length enough , between the opposite doors of [the two houses]1189-the two houses , for [a man]109-a man to lie down . Weary , and not scrupling to defile [Bulika]6-bulika with [my]0-i presence , [I]0-i took advantage of the shelter , poor as it was . AT the foot of the stair lay [the moonlit street]1191-the moonlit street , and [I]0-i could hear the unwholesome , inhospitable wind blowing about below . But not a breath of it entered [my]0-i retreat , and [I]0-i was composing [myself]0-i to rest , when suddenly [my]0-i eyes opened , and there was the head of the shining creature [I]0-i had seen following the Shadow , just rising above the uppermost step ! The moment [she]1173-she caught sight of [my]0-i eyes , [she]1173-she stopped and began to retire , tail foremost . [I]0-i sprang up ; whereupon , having no room to turn , [she]1173-she threw [herself]1173-she backward , head over tail , scrambled to [her]1173-she feet , and in a moment was down the stair and gone . [I]0-i followed [her]1173-she to the bottom , and looked all up and down [the street]1192-the street . Not seeing [her]1173-she , [I]0-i went back to [[my]0-i hard couch]1193-my hard couch . There were , then , two evil creatures prowling about [the city]3099-the city , [one with , and one without spots]1195-one with , and one without spots ! [I]0-i was not inclined to risk much for [man]2682-man or woman in [Bulika]6-bulika , but the life of [a child]106-a child might well be worth such a poor one as [mine]0-i , and [I]0-i resolved to keep watch at that door the rest of the night . Presently [I]0-i heard the latch move , slow , slow : [I]0-i looked up , and seeing the door half - open , rose and slid softly in . Behind [it]1198-it stood , not [the woman [I]0-i had befriended]1199-the woman i had befriended , but [the muffled woman of]1200-the muffled woman of [the desert]3065-the desert . Without a word [she]1173-she led [me]0-i a few steps to [an empty stone - paved chamber]1202-an empty stone - paved chamber , and pointed to a rug on the floor . [I]0-i wrapped [myself]0-i in it , and once more lay down . [She]1173-she shut the door of [the room]126-the room , and [I]0-i heard the outer door open and close again . There was no light save what came from the moonlit air . As [I]0-i lay sleepless , [I]0-i began to hear a stifled moaning . It went on for a good while , and then came the cry of [a child , followed by a terrible shriek]1204-a child , followed by a terrible shriek . [I]0-i sprang up and darted into [the passage]378-the passage : from another door in [it]378-the passage came the white leopardess with [a new - born baby]1206-a new - born baby in [her]1173-she mouth , carrying [it]1206-a new - born baby like a cub of [her]1173-she own . [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i upon [her]1173-she , and compelled [her]1173-she to drop [the infant]672-the infant , which fell on the stone slabs with a piteous wail . At the cry appeared [the muffled woman]1208-the muffled woman . [She]1173-she stepped over [us]1209-us , the beast and [myself]0-i , where [we]1209-us lay struggling in [the narrow passage]1210-the narrow passage , took up [the child]698-the child , and carried [it]698-the child away . Returning , [she]1173-she lifted [me]0-i off the animal , opened the door , and pushed [me]0-i gently out . At [my]0-i heels followed [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess . " [She]1173-she too has failed [me]0-i ! "[0-i] thought [I]0-i ; " — given [me]0-i up to the beast to be settled with at [her]1173-she leisure ! But [we]3358-we shall have a tussle for it ! "[0-i] [I]0-i ran down [the stair]201-the stair , fearing [she]1173-she would spring on [my]0-i back , but [she]1173-she followed [me]0-i quietly . At the foot [I]0-i turned to lay hold of [her]1173-she , but [she]1173-she sprang over [my]0-i head ; and when again [I]0-i turned to face [her]1173-she , [she]1173-she was crouching at [my]0-i feet ! [I]0-i stooped and stroked [her]1173-she lovely white skin ; [she]1173-she responded by licking [my]0-i bare feet with [her]1173-she hard dry tongue . Then [I]0-i patted and fondled [her]1173-she , a well of tenderness overflowing in [my]0-i heart : [she]1173-she might be treacherous too , but if [I]0-i turned from every show of love lest it should be feigned , how was [I]0-i ever to find the real love which must be somewhere in [every world]1214-every world ? [I]0-i stood up ; [she]1173-she rose , and stood beside [me]0-i . A bulky object fell with a heavy squelch in the middle of [the street]1192-the street , a few yards from [us]1216-us . [I]0-i ran to it , and found a pulpy mass , with just form enough left to show [it]1217-it the body of [a woman]344-a woman . It must have been thrown from some neighbouring window ! [I]0-i looked around [me]0-i : [the Shadow]1160-the shadow was walking along the other side of the way , with the white leopardess again at [his]1160-the shadow heel ! [I]0-i followed and gained upon [them]1160-the shadow , urging in [my]0-i heart for [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess that probably [she]1173-she was not [a free agent]2717-a free agent . When [I]0-i got near [them]1160-the shadow , however , [she]3280-the leopardess turned and flew at [me]0-i with such a hideous snarl , that instinctively [I]0-i drew back : instantly [she]3280-the leopardess resumed [her]3280-the leopardess place behind [the Shadow]1160-the shadow . Again [I]0-i drew near ; again [she]3280-the leopardess flew at [me]0-i , [her]3280-the leopardess eyes flaming like live emeralds . Once more [I]0-i made the experiment : [she]3280-the leopardess snapped at [me]0-i like a dog , and bit [me]0-i . [My]0-i heart gave way , and [I]0-i uttered a cry ; whereupon [the creature]3284-the creature looked round with a glance that plainly meant—"Why would [you]0-i make [me]3284-the creature do it ? "[3284-the creature] [I]0-i turned away angry with [myself]0-i : [I]0-i had been losing [my]0-i time ever since [I]0-i entered [the place]2672-the place ! night as it was [I]0-i would go straight to [the palace]3135-the palace ! From [the square]1226-the square [I]0-i had seen [it]3135-the palace — high above [the heart of [the city]3099-the city]1227-the heart of the city , compassed with many defences , more [a fortress than [a palace]1230-a palace]1229-a fortress than a palace ! But [I]0-i found [[its]3135-the palace fortifications]1231-its fortifications , like those of [the city]3099-the city , much neglected , and partly ruinous . For centuries , clearly , [they]1231-its fortifications had been of no account ! [It]3135-the palace had great and strong gates , with something like a drawbridge to [them]1231-its fortifications over a rocky chasm ; but [they]1231-its fortifications stood open , and it was hard to believe that water had ever occupied [the hollow before [them]1231-its fortifications]1233-the hollow before them . All was so still that sleep seemed to interpenetrate [the structure]1234-the structure , causing the very moonlight to look discordantly awake . [I]0-i must either enter like [a thief]1235-a thief , or break a silence that rendered frightful the mere thought of a sound ! Like [an outcast dog]1236-an outcast dog [I]0-i was walking about the walls , when [I]0-i came to a little recess with a stone bench : [I]0-i took refuge in [it]1237-it from the wind , lay down , and in spite of the cold fell fast asleep . [I]0-i was wakened by something leaping upon [me]0-i , and licking [my]0-i face with the rough tongue of a feline animal . " It is the white leopardess ! "[0-i] [I]0-i thought . " [She]1238-she is come to suck [my]0-i blood!—and why should [she]1238-she not have it?—it would cost [me]0-i more to defend than to yield it ! "[0-i] So [I]0-i lay still , expecting a shoot of pain . But the pang did not arrive ; a pleasant warmth instead began to diffuse itself through [me]0-i . Stretched at [my]0-i back , [she]1238-she lay as close to [me]0-i as [she]1238-she could lie , the heat of [her]1238-she body slowly penetrating [mine]0-i , and [her]1238-she breath , which had nothing of the wild beast in it , swathing [my]0-i head and face in a genial atmosphere . A full conviction that [her]1238-she intention toward [me]0-i was good , gained possession of [me]0-i . [I]0-i turned like [a sleepy boy]1239-a sleepy boy , threw [my]0-i arm over [her]1238-she , and sank into profound unconsciousness , When [I]0-i began to come to [myself]0-i , [I]0-i fancied [I]0-i lay warm and soft in [my]0-i own bed . " Is it possible [I]0-i am at [home]2676-home ? "[0-i] [I]0-i thought . The well - known scents of [the garden]2708-the garden seemed to come crowding in . [I]0-i rubbed [my]0-i eyes , and looked out : [I]0-i lay on a bare stone , in [the heart of [a hateful city]1242-a hateful city]1241-the heart of a hateful city ! [I]0-i sprang from the bench . Had [I]0-i indeed had a leopardess for [my]0-i bedfellow , or had [I]0-i but dreamed it ? [She]1238-she had but just left [me]0-i , for the warmth of [her]1238-she body was with [me]0-i yet ! [I]0-i left [the recess]1243-the recess with a new hope , as strong as it was shapeless . One thing only was clear to [me]0-i : [I]0-i must find [the princess]3100-the princess ! Surely [I]0-i had some power with [her]3100-the princess , if not over [her]3100-the princess ! Had [I]0-i not saved [her]3100-the princess life , and had [she]3100-the princess not prolonged it at the expense of [my]0-i vitality ? The reflection gave [me]0-i courage to encounter [her]3100-the princess , be [she]3100-the princess what [she]3100-the princess might . MAKING a circuit of [the castle]1245-the castle , [I]0-i came again to the open gates , crossed [the ravine - like moat]1246-the ravine - like moat , and found [myself]0-i in [a paved court , planted at regular intervals with towering trees like poplars]1247-a paved court , planted at regular intervals with towering trees like poplars . Between [their]1247-a paved court , planted at regular intervals with towering trees like poplars great stems [I]0-i got glimpses of [the palace]3135-the palace , which was of a style strange to [me]0-i , but suggested Indian origin . [It]3135-the palace was long and low , with lofty towers at the corners , and one huge dome in the middle , rising from the roof to half the height of [the towers]1250-the towers . The main entrance was in the centre of the front — a low arch that seemed half an ellipse . [No one]134-no one was visible , the doors stood wide open , and [I]0-i went unchallenged into [a large hall]1252-a large hall , in the form of [a longish ellipse]1253-a longish ellipse . Toward one side stood a cage , in which couched , its head on its paws , a huge leopardess , chained by a steel collar , with its mouth muzzled and its paws muffled . It was white with dark oval spots , and lay staring out of wide - open eyes , with canoe - shaped pupils , and great green irids . It appeared to watch [me]0-i , but not an eyeball , not a foot , not a whisker moved , and its tail stretched out behind it rigid as an iron bar . [I]0-i could not tell whether it was a live thing or not . From [this vestibule]1254-this vestibule [two low passages]1255-two low passages led ; [I]0-i took one of them , and found [it]1256-it branch into many , all narrow and irregular . " To see [the princess]3100-the princess , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " A likely thing ! "[1258-a page] [he]1258-a page returned . [The man [I]0-i had sent to [the princess]3100-the princess]1266-the man i had sent to the princess entered . "[3100-the princess] [I]0-i stood as [she]3100-the princess left [me]0-i , accusing [my]0-i presumption : how was [I]0-i to treat [this lovely woman]1273-this lovely woman as a thing of evil , who behaved to [me]0-i like a sister?—Whence the marvellous change in [her]1273-this lovely woman ? [She]3100-the princess left [me]0-i with a blow ; [she]3100-the princess received [me]0-i almost with an embrace ! [She]3100-the princess had reviled [me]0-i ; [she]3100-the princess said [she]3100-the princess knew [I]0-i would follow and find [her]3100-the princess ! Could [I]0-i believe [her]3100-the princess if [she]3100-the princess did ? As to [her]3100-the princess hospitality , [I]0-i had surely earned and might accept that — at least until [I]0-i came to a definite judgment concerning [her]3100-the princess ! Unable to answer the former question , [I]0-i must let the latter wait ! Clear as crystal , the water in the great white bath sent a sparkling flash from the corner where it lay sunk in the marble floor , and seemed to invite [me]0-i to its embrace . Except the hot stream , two draughts in [the cottage of [the veiled woman]1277-the veiled woman]1276-the cottage of the veiled woman , and the pools in the track of [the wounded leopardess]1278-the wounded leopardess , [I]0-i had not seen water since leaving [home]2676-home : it looked a thing celestial . [I]0-i plunged in . Immediately [my]0-i brain was filled with an odour strange and delicate , which yet [I]0-i did not altogether like . It made [me]0-i doubt [the princess]3100-the princess afresh : had [she]3100-the princess medicated it ? had [she]3100-the princess enchanted it ? was [she]3100-the princess in any way working on [me]0-i unlawfully ? And how was there water in [the palace]3135-the palace , and not a drop in [the city]3099-the city ? [I]0-i remembered the crushed paw of [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess , and sprang from [the bath]1284-the bath . What had [I]0-i been bathing in ? Again [I]0-i saw [the fleeing mother]1285-the fleeing mother , again [I]0-i heard the howl , again [I]0-i saw the limping beast . But what matter whence it flowed ? was not the water sweet ? Was it not very water the pitcher - plant secreted from [its]3280-the leopardess heart , and stored for [the weary traveller]1286-the weary traveller ? Water came from [heaven]1287-heaven : what mattered the well where it gathered , or the spring whence it burst ? But [I]0-i did not re - enter [the bath]1284-the bath . [I]0-i put on the robe of white wool , embroidered on the neck and hem , that lay ready for [me]0-i , and went down the stair to [the room]126-the room whither [[my]0-i hostess]780-my hostess had directed [me]0-i . [It]126-the room was round , all of alabaster , and without a single window : the light came through everywhere , a soft , pearly shimmer rather than shine . Vague shadowy forms went flitting about over the walls and low dome , like loose rain - clouds over a gray - blue sky . [The princess]3100-the princess stood waiting [me]0-i , in a robe embroidered with argentine rings and discs , rectangles and lozenges , close together — a silver mail . It fell unbroken from [her]3100-the princess neck and hid [her]3100-the princess feet , but its long open sleeves left [her]3100-the princess arms bare . In [the room]126-the room was a table of ivory , bearing cakes and fruit , an ivory jug of milk , a crystal jug of wine of a pale rose - colour , and a white loaf . " Here [we]3376-we do not kill to eat , "[3100-the princess] [she]3100-the princess said ; " but [I]3100-the princess think [you]0-i will like what [I]3100-the princess can give [you]0-i . [She]3100-the princess seated [herself]3100-the princess on a couch by the table , and made [me]0-i a sign to sit by [her]3100-the princess . Then [she]3100-the princess filled from the wine - jug two silver goblets of grotesquely graceful workmanship . " [You]0-i have never drunk wine like this ! "[3100-the princess] [she]3100-the princess said . [I]0-i drank , and wondered : every flower of [Hybla]9-hybla and [Hymettus]64-hymettus must have sent its ghost to swell the soul of that wine ! " And now that [you]0-i will be able to listen , "[3100-the princess] [she]3100-the princess went on , " [I]3100-the princess must do what [I]3100-the princess can to make [myself]3100-the princess intelligible to [you]0-i . [Our]3377-we natures , however , are so different , that this may not be easy . [Men]169-men and [women]3201-women live but to die ; [we]3377-we , that is such as [I]3100-the princess — [we]3377-we are but a few — live to live on . Old age is to [you]0-i a horror ; to [me]3100-the princess it is a dear desire : the older [we]3377-we grow , the nearer [we]3377-we are to [our]3377-we perfection . [Your]0-i perfection is a poor thing , comes soon , and lasts but a little while ; [ours]3380-ours is a ceaseless ripening . [I]3100-the princess am not yet ripe , and have lived thousands of [your]0-i years — how many , [I]3100-the princess never cared to note . The everlasting will not be measured . "[3100-the princess] [Many lovers]1293-many lovers have sought [me]0-i ; [I]0-i have loved none of [them]1293-many lovers : [they]1293-many lovers sought but to enslave [me]0-i ; [they]1293-many lovers sought [me]0-i but as [the men of [[my]0-i city]3268-my city]1294-the men of my city seek gems of price.—When [you]1296-you found [me]0-i , [I]0-i found [a man]109-a man ! [I]0-i put [you]1296-you to the test ; [you]1296-you stood it ; [your]1296-you love was genuine!—It was , however , far from ideal — far from such love as [I]0-i would have . [You]1296-you loved [me]0-i truly , but not with true love . Pity has , but is not love . [What woman of [any world]570-any world]1298-what woman of any world would return love for pity ? Such love as [yours]1296-you was then , is hateful to [me]0-i . [I]0-i knew that , if [you]1296-you saw [me]0-i as [I]0-i am , [you]1296-you would love [me]0-i — like the rest of [them]1300-them — to have and to hold : [I]0-i would none of that either ! [I]0-i would be otherwise loved ! [I]0-i would have a love that outlived hopelessness , outmeasured indifference , hate , scorn ! Therefore did [I]0-i put on cruelty , despite , ingratitude . When [I]0-i left [you]1296-you , [I]0-i had shown [myself]0-i such as [you]1296-you could at least no longer follow from pity : [I]0-i was no longer in need of [you]1296-you ! But [you]1296-you must satisfy [my]0-i desire or set [me]0-i free — prove [yourself]1296-you priceless or worthless ! To satisfy the hunger of [my]0-i love , [you]1296-you must follow [me]0-i , looking for nothing , not gratitude , not even pity in return!—follow and find [me]0-i , and be content with merest presence , with scantest forbearance!—I , not [you]1296-you , have failed ; [I]0-i yield the contest . " [She]0-i looked at [me]1301-beautiful princess tenderly , and hid [her]0-i face in [her]0-i hands . But [I]1301-beautiful princess had caught a flash and a sparkle behind the tenderness , and did not believe [her]0-i . [She]0-i laid [herself]0-i out to secure and enslave [me]1301-beautiful princess ; [she]0-i only fascinated [me]1301-beautiful princess ! "[1301-beautiful princess] [Beautiful princess]1301-beautiful princess , " [I]1301-beautiful princess said , "[1301-beautiful princess] let [me]0-i understand how [you]1301-beautiful princess came to be found in such evil plight . " "[1301-beautiful princess] There are things [I]0-i can not explain , " [she]0-i replied , "[1301-beautiful princess] until [you]1296-you have become capable of understanding them — which can only be when love is grown perfect . " [I]0-i had set out to visit [a part of [[my]0-i dominions]3382-my dominions occupied by [a savage dwarf]3383-a savage dwarf - people , strong and fierce , [enemies to law and order , opposed to every kind of progress]3384-enemies to law and order , opposed to every kind of progress]3381-a part of my dominions occupied by a savage dwarf - people , strong and fierce , enemies to law and order , opposed to every kind of progress — an evil race . "[0-i] [I]0-i set out on [my]0-i journey , reached [the stream]990-the stream , bounded across [it]990-the stream , — — " A shadow of embarrassment darkened [her]0-i cheek : [I]0-i understood it , but showed no sign . Checked for the merest moment , [she]0-i went on : "[0-i] — [you]1303-i know what a step it is in parts!—But in the very act , an indescribable cold invaded [me]0-i . [I]0-i recognised at once the nature of the assault , and knew it could affect [me]0-i but temporarily . " [She]0-i rose , [her]0-i eyes flashing as never human eyes flashed , and threw [her]0-i arms high over [her]0-i head . "[0-i] What [you]1303-i have made [me]0-i is [yours]1304-yours ! " [She]0-i dropt kneeling beside [me]1303-i , laid [her]0-i arms across [my]1303-i knees , and looked up in [my]1303-i face . Then first [I]1303-i noted on [her]0-i left hand a large clumsy glove . [I]1303-i glanced at the other : it was lovely as hand could be , and [I]1303-i felt that , if [I]1303-i did less than loathe [her]0-i , [I]1303-i should love [her]0-i . Not to dally with usurping emotions , [I]1303-i turned [my]1303-i eyes aside . [She]0-i started to [her]0-i feet . [I]1303-i sat motionless , looking down . "[1303-i] To [me]0-i [she]1306-my may be true ! " said [my]1306-my vanity . For a moment [I]1306-my was tempted to love a lie . An odour , rather than the gentlest of airy pulses , was fanning [me]1306-my . [I]1306-my glanced up . [She]0-i stood erect before [me]1306-my , waving [her]0-i lovely arms in seemingly mystic fashion . A frightful roar made [my]1306-my heart rebound against the walls of its cage . The alabaster trembled as if it would shake into shivers . [The princess]3100-the princess shuddered visibly . "[1306-my] [My]0-i wine was too strong for [you]1307-you ! [I]0-i had but reached this conclusion when [I]0-i fell asleep . The lovely wine may not have been quite innocent . When [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes , it was night . A lamp , suspended from the ceiling , cast a clear , although soft light through [the chamber]208-the chamber . A delicious languor infolded [me]0-i . [I]0-i seemed floating , far from [land]3400-land , upon the bosom of [a twilight sea]3401-a twilight sea . Existence was in itself pleasure . [I]0-i had no pain . Surely [I]0-i was dying ! No pain!—ah , what a shoot of mortal pain was that ! what a sickening sting ! It went right through [my]0-i heart ! Again ! That was sharpness itself!—and so sickening ! [I]0-i could not move [my]0-i hand to lay it on [my]0-i heart ; something kept it down ! The pain was dying away , but [my]0-i whole body seemed paralysed . Some evil thing was upon me!—something hateful ! [I]0-i would have struggled , but could not reach a struggle . [My]0-i will agonised , but in vain , to assert itself . [I]0-i desisted , and lay passive . Then [I]0-i became aware of a soft hand on [my]0-i face , pressing [my]0-i head into the pillow , and of a heavy weight lying across [me]0-i . [I]0-i began to breathe more freely ; the weight was gone from [my]0-i chest ; [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes . [The princess]3100-the princess was standing above [me]0-i on the bed , looking out into [the room]126-the room , with the air of [one who dreamed]3404-one who dreamed . [Her]3100-the princess great eyes were clear and calm . [Her]3100-the princess mouth wore a look of satisfied passion ; [she]3100-the princess wiped from it a streak of red . [She]3100-the princess caught [my]0-i gaze , bent down , and struck [me]0-i on the eyes with the handkerchief in [her]3100-the princess hand : it was like drawing the edge of a knife across them , and for a moment or two [I]0-i was blind . [I]0-i heard a dull heavy sound , as of a large soft - footed animal alighting from a little jump . [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes , and saw the great swing of a long tail as it disappeared through the half - open doorway . [I]0-i sprang after it . The creature had vanished quite . [I]0-i shot down [the stair]201-the stair , and into [the hall of alabaster]3406-the hall of alabaster . The moon was high , and the place like the inside of a faint , sun - blanched moon . [I]0-i was a tame animal for [her]3100-the princess to feed upon ; [a human fountain for a thirst demoniac]3408-a human fountain for a thirst demoniac ! Only with [my]0-i eyes upon [her]3100-the princess could [I]0-i feel safe from [her]3100-the princess ! Outside [the alabaster hall]3410-the alabaster hall it was pitch - dark , and [I]0-i had to grope [my]0-i way along with hands and feet . At last [I]0-i felt a curtain , put it aside , and entered [the black hall]3411-the black hall . There [I]0-i found a great silent assembly . How it was visible [I]0-i neither saw nor could imagine , for the walls , the floor , the roof , were shrouded in what seemed an infinite blackness , blacker than the blackest of moonless , starless nights ; yet [my]0-i eyes could separate , although vaguely , not a few of [the individuals in the mass interpenetrated and divided , as well as surrounded , by the darkness]3412-the individuals in the mass interpenetrated and divided , as well as surrounded , by the darkness . It seemed as if [my]0-i eyes would never come quite to themselves . [I]0-i pressed [their]3413-their balls and looked and looked again , but what [I]0-i saw would not grow distinct . Blackness mingled with form , silence and undefined motion possessed the wide space . All was a dim , confused dance , filled with recurrent glimpses of shapes not unknown to [me]0-i . Now appeared [a woman , with glorious eyes looking out of a skull]3414-a woman , with glorious eyes looking out of a skull ; now [an armed figure on a skeleton horse]3415-an armed figure on a skeleton horse ; now [one now another of the hideous burrowing phantasms]3416-one now another of the hideous burrowing phantasms . [I]0-i could trace no order and little relation in the mingling and crossing currents and eddies . If [I]0-i seemed to catch the shape and rhythm of a dance , it was but to see it break , and confusion prevail . With the shifting colours of the seemingly more solid shapes , mingled a multitude of shadows , independent apparently of originals , each moving after its own free shadow - will . [I]0-i looked everywhere for [the princess]3100-the princess , but throughout the wildly changing kaleidoscopic scene , could not see [her]3100-the princess nor discover indication of [her]3100-the princess presence . Where was [she]3100-the princess ? What might [she]3100-the princess not be doing ? [No one]134-no one took the least notice of [me]0-i as [I]0-i wandered hither and thither seeking [her]3100-the princess . At length losing hope , [I]0-i turned away to look elsewhere . Finding the wall , and keeping to it with [my]0-i hand , for even then [I]0-i could not see it , [I]0-i came , groping along , to a curtained opening into [the vestibule]3419-the vestibule . Dimly moonlighted , the cage of [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess was the arena of what seemed a desperate although silent struggle . Two vastly differing forms , human and bestial , with entangled confusion of mingling bodies and limbs , writhed and wrestled in closest embrace . It had lasted but an instant when [I]0-i saw [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess out of the cage , walking quietly to the open door . The moon , half - way up the sky , was shining round and clear ; the bodiless shadow [I]0-i had seen the night before , was walking through the trees toward the gate ; and after [him]3423-him went the leopardess , swinging [her]3280-the leopardess tail . [I]0-i followed , a little way off , as silently as [they]3424-they , and neither of [them]3424-they once looked round . Through the open gate [we]3425-we went down to [the city]3099-the city , lying quiet as the moonshine upon [it]3099-the city . The face of the moon was very still , and its stillness looked like that of expectation . What a sight it was — now the one , now the other uppermost , both too intent for any noise beyond a low growl , a whimpered cry , or a snarl of hate — followed by a quicker scrambling of claws , as each , worrying and pushing and dragging , struggled for foothold on [the pavement]3437-the pavement ! [I]0-i followed in dazed compliance . The moon was near the zenith , and [her]0-i present silver seemed brighter than the gold of the absent sun . [She]0-i brought [me]0-i through the trees to the tallest of them , the one in the centre . It was not quite like the rest , for its branches , drawing their ends together at the top , made a clump that looked from beneath like a fir - cone . [The princess]3100-the princess stood close under it , gazing up , and said , as if talking to [herself]3100-the princess , "[0-i] On the summit of that tree grows a tiny blossom which would at once heal [my]0-i scratches ! [I]0-i might be a dove for a moment and fetch it , but [I]0-i see a little snake in the leaves whose bite would be worse to a dove than the bite of a tiger to me!—How [I]0-i hate [that cat - woman]1313-that cat - woman ! " [She]0-i turned to [me]1313-that cat - woman quickly , saying with one of [her]0-i sweetest smiles , "[1313-that cat - woman] Can [you]1312-you climb ? " The smile vanished with the brief question , and [her]0-i face changed to a look of sadness and suffering . [I]1313-that cat - woman ought to have left [her]0-i to suffer , but the way [she]0-i put [her]0-i hand to [her]0-i wounded neck went to [my]1313-that cat - woman heart . [I]1313-that cat - woman considered the tree . All the way up to the branches , were projections on the stem like the remnants on a palm of its fallen leaves . "[1313-that cat - woman] [I]0-i can climb that tree , " [I]0-i answered . "[0-i] Not with bare feet ! " [she]0-i returned . In [my]0-i haste to follow [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess disappearing , [I]0-i had left [my]0-i sandals in [[my]0-i room]3391-my room . "[0-i] It is no matter , " [I]0-i said ; "[0-i] [I]0-i have long gone barefoot ! " Again [I]0-i looked at the tree , and [my]0-i eyes went wandering up the stem until [my]0-i sight lost itself in the branches . The moon shone like silvery foam here and there on the rugged bole , and a little rush of wind went through the top with a murmurous sound as of water falling softly into water . [I]0-i approached the tree to begin [my]0-i ascent of it . [The princess]3100-the princess stopped [me]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i can not let [you]0-i attempt it with [your]0-i feet bare ! " [she]0-i insisted . "[0-i] A fall from the top would kill [you]0-i ! " "[0-i] So would a bite from the snake ! " [I]0-i answered — not believing , [I]0-i confess , that there was any snake . "[0-i] It would not hurt [you]0-i ! " [she]0-i replied . "[0-i] — Wait a moment . " [She]0-i tore from [her]0-i garment the two wide borders that met in front , and kneeling on one knee , made [me]0-i put first [my]0-i left foot , then [my]0-i right on the other , and bound them about with the thick embroidered strips . "[0-i] [You]0-i have left the ends hanging , [princess]3098-princess ! " [I]0-i said . "[0-i] [I]0-i have nothing to cut them off with ; but they are not long enough to get entangled , " [she]0-i replied . [I]0-i turned to the tree , and began to climb . Now in [Bulika]6-bulika the cold after sundown was not so great as in [certain other parts of [the country]454-the country]3477-certain other parts of the country — especially about [the sexton 's cottage]2796-the sexton 's cottage ; yet when [I]0-i had climbed a little way , [I]0-i began to feel very cold , grew still colder as [I]0-i ascended , and became coldest of all when [I]0-i got among the branches . Then [I]0-i shivered , and seemed to have lost [my]0-i hands and feet . There was hardly any wind , and the branches did not sway in the least , yet , as [I]0-i approached [the summit]3480-the summit , [I]0-i became aware of a peculiar unsteadiness : every branch on which [I]0-i placed foot or laid hold , seemed on the point of giving way . When [my]0-i head rose above the branches near the top , and in the open moonlight [I]0-i began to look about for the blossom , that instant [I]0-i found [myself]0-i drenched from head to foot . The next , as if plunged in a stormy water , [I]0-i was flung about wildly , and felt [myself]0-i sinking . Tossed up and down , tossed this way and tossed that way , rolled over and over , checked , rolled the other way and tossed up again , [I]0-i was sinking lower and lower . Gasping and gurgling and choking , [I]0-i fell at last upon a solid bottom . "[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]1315-you so ! " croaked a voice in [my]0-i ear . [I]0-i RUBBED the water out of [my]0-i eyes , and saw the raven on the edge of a huge stone basin . With the cold light of the dawn reflected from [his]3481-his glossy plumage , [he]3481-his stood calmly looking down upon [me]0-i . [I]0-i lay on [my]0-i back in water , above which , leaning on [my]0-i elbows , [I]0-i just lifted [my]0-i face . [I]0-i was in the basin of the large fountain constructed by [[my]0-i father]105-my father in [the middle of [the lawn]268-the lawn]3483-the middle of the lawn . High over [me]0-i glimmered the thick , steel - shiny stalk , shooting , with a torrent uprush , a hundred feet into the air , to spread in a blossom of foam . Nettled at the coolness of the raven 's remark , "[0-i] [You]1315-you told [me]0-i nothing ! " [I]0-i said . "[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]1315-you to do nothing any one [you]1315-you distrusted asked [you]1315-you ! " "[0-i] Tut ! how was mortal to remember that ? " "[1315-you] [You]1315-you will not forget the consequences of having forgotten it ! " replied [Mr. Raven]24-mr. raven , who stood leaning over the margin of the basin , and stretched [his]24-mr. raven hand across to [me]1315-you . [I]1315-you took it , and was immediately beside [him]24-mr. raven on [the lawn]268-the lawn , dripping and streaming . "[1315-you] [You]1315-you must change [your]1315-you clothes at once ! " [he]24-mr. raven said . "[1315-you] A wetting does not signify where [you]1315-you come from — though at present such an accident is unusual ; here it has its inconveniences ! " [He]24-mr. raven was again [a raven]241-a raven , walking , with something stately in [his]24-mr. raven step , toward [the house]112-the house , the door of which stood open . "[0-i] [I]0-i have not much to change ! " [I]0-i laughed ; for [I]0-i had flung aside [my]0-i robe to climb the tree . "[0-i] It is a long time since [I]0-i moulted a feather ! " said [the raven]233-the raven . In [the house]112-the house [no one]134-no one seemed awake . [I]0-i went to [[my]0-i room]3391-my room , found a dressing - gown , and descended to [the library]117-the library . As [I]0-i entered , [the librarian]245-the librarian came from [the closet]148-the closet . [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i on a couch . [Mr. Raven]24-mr. raven drew a chair to [my]0-i side and sat down . For a minute or two neither spoke . [I]0-i was the first to break the silence . "[0-i] What does it all mean ? " [I]0-i said . "[0-i] A good question ! " [he]24-mr. raven rejoined : "[149-nobody] [nobody]149-nobody knows what anything is ; [a man]109-a man can learn only what a thing means ! Whether [he]109-a man do , depends on the use [he]109-a man is making of it . " "[109-a man] [I]0-i have made no use of anything yet ! " "[0-i] Not much ; but [you]0-i know the fact , and that is something ! [Most people]1318-most people take more than a lifetime to learn that [they]1318-most people have learned nothing , and done less ! At least [you]0-i have not been without the desire to be of use ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i did want to do something for [the children]2965-the children — [the precious Little Ones]1320-the precious little ones , [I]0-i mean . " "[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]0-i did — and started the wrong way ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i did not know the right way . " "[0-i] That is true also — but [you]0-i are to blame that [you]0-i did not . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am ready to believe whatever [you]0-i tell [me]0-i — as soon as [I]0-i understand what it means . " "[0-i] Had [you]0-i accepted [our]1321-our invitation , [you]0-i would have known the right way . When [a man]109-a man will not act where [he]109-a man is , [he]109-a man must go far to find [his]109-a man work . " "[109-a man] Indeed [I]0-i have gone far , and got nowhere , for [I]0-i have not found [my]0-i work ! [I]0-i left [the children]2965-the children to learn how to serve [them]2965-the children , and have only learned the danger [they]2965-the children are in . " "[47-the little ones] That is one of the pet falsehoods of [[your]0-i world]2679-your world ! Is [man]2682-man 's greatest knowledge more than a little ? or is it therefore dangerous ? The fancy that knowledge is in itself a great thing , would make any degree of knowledge more dangerous than any amount of ignorance . To know all things would not be greatness . " "[0-i] At least it was for love of [them]47-the little ones , not from cowardice that [I]0-i served [the giants]634-the giants ! " "[0-i] Granted . " [He]24-mr. raven rose , went to the door of [the closet]148-the closet , brought from it the mutilated volume , and sat down again beside [me]0-i . "[0-i] Listen , " [he]24-mr. raven said : "[0-i] [I]0-i am going to read a stanza or two . There is one present who , [I]0-i imagine , will hardly enjoy the reading ! " [He]24-mr. raven opened the vellum cover , and turned a leaf or two . The parchment was discoloured with age , and one leaf showed a dark stain over two - thirds of it . [He]24-mr. raven slowly turned this also , and seemed looking for a certain passage in what appeared a continuous poem . Somewhere about the middle of the book [he]24-mr. raven began to read . But what follows represents — not what [he]24-mr. raven read , only the impression it made upon [me]0-i . The poem seemed in a language [I]0-i had never before heard , which yet [I]0-i understood perfectly , although [I]0-i could not write the words , or give their meaning save in poor approximation . These fragments , then , are the shapes which those [he]24-mr. raven read have finally taken in passing again through [my]0-i brain : — [He]24-mr. raven turned a leaf and read again : — Again [he]24-mr. raven paused , again turned a leaf , and again began : — A strange , repulsive feline wail arose somewhere in [the room]126-the room . [I]0-i started up on [my]0-i elbow and stared about [me]0-i , but could see nothing . [Mr. Raven]24-mr. raven turned several leaves , and went on : — Again [I]0-i heard the ugly cry of feline pain . Again [I]0-i looked , but saw neither shape nor motion . [Mr. Raven]24-mr. raven seemed to listen a moment , but again turned several pages , and resumed : — Once more arose the bestial wail . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought some foul thing was in [the room]126-the room ! " said [the librarian]245-the librarian , casting a glance around [him]24-mr. raven ; but instantly [he]24-mr. raven turned a leaf or two , and again read : — With a fearsome yell , [her]245-the librarian clammy fur staring in clumps , [her]245-the librarian tail thick as a cable , [her]245-the librarian eyes flashing green as a chrysoprase , [her]245-the librarian distended claws entangling themselves so that [she]245-the librarian floundered across the carpet , a huge white cat rushed from somewhere , and made for the chimney . Quick as thought [the librarian]245-the librarian threw the manuscript between [her]245-the librarian and the hearth . [She]245-the librarian crouched instantly , [her]245-the librarian eyes fixed on the book . But [his]24-mr. raven voice went on as if still [he]24-mr. raven read , and [his]24-mr. raven eyes seemed also fixed on the book : — At these words such a howling , such a prolonged yell of agony burst from the cat , that [we]1359-we both stopped [our]1359-we ears . When it ceased , [Mr. Raven]24-mr. raven walked to the fire - place , took up the book , and , standing between the creature and the chimney , pointed [his]24-mr. raven finger at [her]245-the librarian for a moment . [She]245-the librarian lay perfectly still . [He]24-mr. raven took a half - burnt stick from the hearth , drew with it some sign on the floor , put the manuscript back in its place , with a look that seemed to say , "[0-i] Now [we]1359-we have [her]1360-her , [I]0-i think ! " and , returning to the cat , stood over [her]245-the librarian and said , in a still , solemn voice : — "[1360-her] [Lilith]66-lilith , when [you]66-lilith came here on the way to [your]66-lilith evil will , [you]66-lilith little thought into whose hands [you]66-lilith were delivering yourself!—Mr . [Vane]27-mr. vane , when [God]33-god created [me,—not]1361-me,—not out of Nothing , as say the unwise , but out of [His]33-god own endless glory — [He]33-god brought [me]0-i an angelic splendour to be [[my]0-i wife]2760-my wife : there [she]1360-her lies ! For [her]1360-her first thought was power ; [she]1360-her counted it slavery to be one with [me]0-i , and bear [children]599-children for [Him]33-god who gave [her]1360-her being . [One child]1364-one child , indeed , [she]1360-her bore ; then , puffed with the fancy that [she]1360-her had created [her]1360-her , would have [me]0-i fall down and worship [her]1360-her ! Finding , however , that [I]0-i would but love and honour , never obey and worship [her]1360-her , [she]1360-her poured out [her]1360-her blood to escape [me]0-i , fled to [the army of [the aliens]1366-the aliens]1365-the army of the aliens , and soon had so ensnared the heart of [the great Shadow]1367-the great shadow , that [he]33-god became [[her]1360-her slave]1368-her slave , wrought [her]1360-her will , and made [[her]1360-her queen of [Hell]11-hell]1369-her queen of hell . How it is with [her]1360-her now , [she]1360-her best knows , but [I]0-i know also . [The one child of [her]1360-her body]1370-the one child of her body [she]1360-her fears and hates , and would kill , asserting a right , which is a lie , over what [God]33-god sent through [her]1360-her into [[His]33-god new world]1371-his new world . Of creating , [she]1360-her knows no more than the crystal that takes its allotted shape , or the worm that makes two worms when it is cloven asunder . [Vilest of [God]33-god 's creatures]1372-vilest of god 's creatures , [she]1360-her lives by the blood and lives and souls of [men]169-men . [She]1360-her consumes and slays , but is powerless to destroy as to create . " The animal lay motionless , [its]1360-her beryl eyes fixed flaming on [the man]2887-the man : [his]2887-the man eyes on [hers]1360-her held them fixed that they could not move from [his]2887-the man . "[1360-her] Then [God]33-god gave [me]0-i [another wife]1374-another wife — not [an angel]1375-an angel but [a woman — who is to this as light is to darkness]1376-a woman — who is to this as light is to darkness . " The cat gave a horrible screech , and began to grow bigger . [She]1360-her went on growing and growing . At last the spotted leopardess uttered a roar that made [the house]112-the house tremble . [I]1360-her sprang to [my]1360-her feet . [I]1360-her do not think [Mr. Raven]24-mr. raven started even with [his]24-mr. raven eyelids . [[Her]1360-her hated daughter]1379-her hated daughter lives also , but beyond [her]1360-her evil ken , one day to be what [she]1360-her counts [her]1360-her destruction — for even [Lilith]66-lilith shall be saved by [[her]66-lilith child]1094-her child - bearing . [I]0-i too have repented , and am blessed.—Thou , [Lilith]66-lilith , hast not yet repented ; but [thou]1389-thou must.—Tell [me]0-i , is the great Shadow beautiful ?
