" Then at last [I]1389-thou understood that [Mr. Raven]24-mr. raven was indeed [Adam]58-adam , [the old and the new man]3504-the old and the new man ; and that [[his]24-mr. raven wife]358-his wife , ministering in [the house of the dead]3506-the house of the dead , was [Eve]59-eve , [the mother of [us]3508-us all]3507-the mother of us all , [the lady of the New [Jerusalem]12-jerusalem]3509-the lady of the new jerusalem . "[1389-thou] [I]0-i am beautiful — and immortal ! " [she]0-i said — and [she]0-i looked [the goddess]3511-the goddess [she]0-i would be . " For [her]0-i arm lay across [her]0-i bosom , and [her]0-i hand was pressed to [her]0-i side . A swift pang contorted [her]0-i beautiful face , and passed . "[0-i] It is not on the leopard ; it is in [the woman]348-the woman ! " [he]33-god said . "[0-i] Nor will it leave [thee]0-i until it hath eaten to [thy]0-i heart , and [thy]0-i beauty hath flowed from [thee]0-i through the open wound ! " [She]0-i gave a glance downward , and shivered . "[66-lilith] [Lilith]66-lilith , " said [Adam]58-adam , and [his]58-adam tone had changed to a tender beseeching , "[0-i] hear [me]0-i , and repent , and [He]1393-he who made [thee]66-lilith will cleanse [thee]66-lilith ! " [Her]0-i hand returned quivering to [her]0-i side . [Her]0-i face grew dark . [She]0-i gave the cry of [one from whom hope is vanishing]3513-one from whom hope is vanishing . "[1393-he] The evil [thou]66-lilith meditatest , " [Adam]58-adam resumed , "[66-lilith] [thou]66-lilith shalt never compass , [Lilith]66-lilith , for Good and not Evil is [the Universe]13-the universe . The battle between [them]1394-them may last for countless ages , but it must end : how will it fare with [thee]66-lilith when Time hath vanished in the dawn of the eternal morn ? Repent , [I]0-i beseech [thee]66-lilith ; repent , and be again [an angel of God]1395-an angel of god ! " [She]0-i rose , [she]0-i stood upright , [a woman]344-a woman once more , and said , "[0-i] [I]0-i will not repent . [I]0-i will drink the blood of [[thy]0-i child]1396-thy child . " [My]0-i eyes were fastened on [the princess]3100-the princess ; but when [Adam]58-adam spoke , [I]0-i turned to [him]58-adam : [he]58-adam stood towering above [her]0-i ; the form of [his]58-adam visage was altered , and [his]58-adam voice was terrible . " [She]0-i flung [herself]0-i on the floor , dwindled and dwindled , and was again a gray cat . [[Her]1396-thy child daughter]1405-her daughter appears to [her]1396-thy child an open channel through which [her]1396-thy child immortality — which yet [she]1396-thy child counts self - inherent — is flowing fast away : to fill it up , almost from [her]1396-thy child birth [she]1396-thy child has pursued [her]1396-thy child with an utter enmity . But the result of [her]1396-thy child machinations hitherto is , that in [the region]512-the region [she]1396-thy child claims as [her]1396-thy child own , has appeared a colony of [children]599-children , to which [that daughter]1408-that daughter is heart and head and sheltering wings . [[My]0-i [Eve]59-eve]1382-my eve longed after [the child]698-the child , and would have been to [her]698-the child as [a mother to [her]698-the child first - born]1411-a mother to her first - born , but [we]1412-we were then unfit to train [her]698-the child : [she]698-the child was carried into [the wilderness]1413-the wilderness , and for ages [we]1412-we knew nothing of [her]698-the child fate . One by one [she]698-the child has found [many children]1419-many children since , and that heart is not yet full . [[Her]698-the child family]1420-her family is [her]698-the child absorbing charge , and never [children]599-children were better mothered . "[0-i] " [I]1427-i am sorry [I]1427-i can not explain the thing to [you]0-i , "[1427-i] [he]1427-i answered ; " but there is no provision in [you]0-i for understanding it . At the same time [you]0-i are constantly experiencing things which [you]0-i not only do not , but can not understand . [You]0-i think [you]0-i understand them , but [your]0-i understanding of [them]3540-them is only [your]0-i being used to [them]3540-them , and therefore not surprised at [them]3540-them . The fact is , [no man]286-no man understands anything ; when [he]286-no man knows [he]286-no man does not understand , that is [his]286-no man first tottering step — not toward understanding , but toward the capability of one day understanding . To such things as these [you]0-i are not used , therefore [you]0-i do not fancy [you]0-i understand them . Neither [I]1427-i nor [any man]3166-any man can here help [you]0-i to understand ; but [I]1427-i may , perhaps , help [you]0-i a little to believe ! "[1427-i] [He]1428-he went to the door of [the closet]148-the closet , gave a low whistle , and stood listening . [I]0-i hesitated , and half turned . " To think of [her]1433-her lying there alone , "[0-i] [I]0-i murmured , " — with that terrible wound ! "[0-i] " Nothing will ever close that wound , "[1428-he] [he]1428-he answered , with a sigh . " It must eat into [her]1433-her heart ! Annihilation itself is no death to evil . Only good where evil was , is evil dead . An evil thing must live with its evil until it chooses to be good . That alone is the slaying of evil . "[0-i] [I]0-i STOOD and watched the last gleam of the white leopardess melt away , then turned to follow [[my]0-i guide]200-my guide — but reluctantly . What had [I]0-i to do with sleep ? Surely reason was the same in [every world]1214-every world , and what reason could there be in going to sleep with the dead , when the hour was calling [the live man]1444-the live man ? Besides , [no one]134-no one would wake [me]0-i , and how could [I]0-i be certain of waking early — of waking at all?—the sleepers in [that house]296-that house let morning glide into noon , and noon into night , nor ever stirred ! [I]0-i murmured , but followed , for [I]0-i knew not what else to do . [The librarian]245-the librarian walked on in silence , and [I]0-i walked silent as [he]245-the librarian . Time and space glided past [us]1448-us . The sun set ; it began to grow dark , and [I]0-i felt in the air the spreading cold of the chamber of death . [My]0-i heart sank lower and lower . [I]0-i began to lose sight of [the lean , long - coated figure]1449-the lean , long - coated figure , and at length could no more hear [his]1449-the lean , long - coated figure swishing stride through the heather . " [You]0-i must make acquaintance with the horse that will carry [you]0-i in the morning ! "[1449-the lean , long - coated figure] [He]1449-the lean , long - coated figure gave a strange whistle through [his]1449-the lean , long - coated figure long black beak . A spot appeared on the face of the half - risen moon . To [my]0-i ears came presently the drumming of swift , soft - galloping hoofs , and in a minute or two , out of the very disc of the moon , low - thundered the terrible horse . [His]1449-the lean , long - coated figure mane flowed away behind [him]1449-the lean , long - coated figure like the crest of a wind - fighting wave , torn seaward in hoary spray , and the whisk of [his]1449-the lean , long - coated figure tail kept blinding the eye of the moon . Nineteen hands [he]1449-the lean , long - coated figure seemed , huge of bone , tight of skin , hard of muscle — a steed the holy Death [himself]1449-the lean , long - coated figure might choose on which to ride abroad and slay ! The moon seemed to regard [him]1449-the lean , long - coated figure with awe ; in [her]1451-her scary light [he]1449-the lean , long - coated figure looked a very skeleton , loosely roped together . Terrifically large , [he]1449-the lean , long - coated figure moved with the lightness of a winged insect . As [he]1449-the lean , long - coated figure drew near , [his]1449-the lean , long - coated figure speed slackened , and [his]1449-the lean , long - coated figure mane and tail drifted about [him]1449-the lean , long - coated figure settling . Now [I]0-i was not merely [a lover of horses]1452-a lover of horses , but [I]0-i loved every horse [I]0-i saw . [I]0-i had never spent money except upon horses , and had never sold a horse . The sight of [this mighty one]1453-this mighty one , terrible to look at , woke in [me]0-i longing to possess [him]1449-the lean , long - coated figure . It was pure greed , nay , rank covetousness , an evil thing in [all the worlds]1454-all the worlds . [I]0-i do not mean that [I]0-i could have stolen [him]1449-the lean , long - coated figure , but that , regardless of [his]1449-the lean , long - coated figure proper place , [I]0-i would have bought [him]1449-the lean , long - coated figure if [I]0-i could . " The most — nearly the only foolish thing [you]27-mr. vane ever did , was to run from [our]3564-our dead . "[1463-he] [I]0-i pressed the horse 's ribs , and [he]1463-he was off like a sudden wind . [I]0-i gave [him]1463-he a pat on the side of the neck , and [he]1463-he went about in a sharp - driven curve , " close to the ground , like a cat when scratchingly [she]3565-she wheels about after a mouse , "[1463-he] leaning sideways till [his]1463-he mane swept the tops of the heather . Through the dark [I]0-i heard the wings of the raven . Five quick flaps [I]0-i heard , and [he]1463-he perched on the horse 's head . [The horse]1459-the horse checked [himself]1459-the horse instantly , ploughing up the ground with [his]1459-the horse feet . " [Mr. Vane]27-mr. vane , "[233-the raven] croaked [the raven]233-the raven , " think what [you]27-mr. vane are doing ! Twice already has evil befallen [you]27-mr. vane — once from fear , and once from heedlessness : breach of word is far worse ; it is a crime . "[233-the raven] " [The Little Ones]633-the little ones are in frightful peril , and [I]0-i brought it upon [them]633-the little ones ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " — But indeed [I]0-i will not break [my]0-i word to [you]27-mr. vane . [I]0-i will return , and spend in [[your]27-mr. vane house]2723-your house what nights — what days — what years [you]27-mr. vane please . "[0-i] " [I]1459-the horse tell [you]0-i once more [you]0-i will do them other than good if [you]0-i go to - night , "[1459-the horse] [he]1459-the horse insisted . But a false sense of power , a sense which had no root and was merely vibrated into [me]0-i from the strength of the horse , had , alas , rendered [me]0-i too stupid to listen to anything [he]1459-the horse said ! " Would [you]1459-the horse take from [me]0-i [my]0-i last chance of reparation ? "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " This time there shall be no shirking ! it is [my]0-i duty , and [I]0-i will go — if [I]0-i perish for it ! "[0-i] " Go , then , [foolish boy]3568-foolish boy ! "[1459-the horse] [he]1459-the horse returned , with anger in [his]1459-the horse croak . " Take the horse , and ride to failure ! May it be to humility ! "[1459-the horse] [He]1459-the horse spread [his]1459-the horse wings and flew . Again [I]0-i pressed the lean ribs under [me]0-i . " After the spotted leopardess ! "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered in [his]1459-the horse ear . [He]1459-the horse turned [his]1459-the horse head this way and that , snuffing the air ; then started , and went a few paces in a slow , undecided walk . Suddenly [he]1459-the horse quickened [his]1459-the horse walk ; broke into a trot ; began to gallop , and in a few moments [his]1459-the horse speed was tremendous . [He]1459-the horse seemed to see in the dark ; never stumbled , not once faltered , not once hesitated . [I]0-i sat as on the ridge of a wave . [I]0-i felt under [me]0-i the play of each individual muscle : [his]1459-the horse joints were so elastic , and [his]1459-the horse every movement glided so into the next , that not once did [he]1459-the horse jar [me]0-i . [His]1459-the horse growing swiftness bore [him]1459-the horse along until [he]1459-the horse flew rather than ran . The wind met and passed [us]1466-we like a tornado . Across [the evil hollow]1467-the evil hollow [we]1466-we sped like a bolt from an arblast . [No monster]1468-no monster lifted its neck ; all knew the hoofs that thundered over [their]1469-their heads ! [We]1466-we rushed up [the hills]531-the hills , [we]1466-we shot down [their farther slopes]1471-their farther slopes ; from [the rocky chasms of [the river - bed]554-the river - bed]1472-the rocky chasms of the river - bed [he]1459-the horse did not swerve ; [he]1459-the horse held on over [them]1469-their [his]1459-the horse fierce , terrible gallop . The moon , half - way up [the heaven]814-the heaven , gazed with a solemn trouble in [her]1475-her pale countenance . Rejoicing in the power of [my]0-i steed and in the pride of [my]0-i life , [I]0-i sat like [a king]842-a king and rode . [We]1466-we were near the middle of [the many channels]1477-the many channels , [my]0-i horse every other moment clearing one , sometimes two in [his]1459-the horse stride , and now and then gathering [himself]1459-the horse for a great bounding leap , when the moon reached the key - stone of [her]1475-her arch . Then came a wonder and a terror : [she]1475-her began to descend rolling like the nave of [Fortune]68-fortune 's wheel bowled by [the gods]1478-the gods , and went faster and faster . Like [our]1466-we own moon , [this one]1479-this one had a human face , and now the broad forehead now the chin was uppermost as [she]1475-her rolled . [I]0-i gazed aghast . Across [the ravines]1480-the ravines came the howling of wolves . An ugly fear began to invade the hollow places of [my]0-i heart ; [my]0-i confidence was on the wane ! [The horse]1459-the horse maintained [his]1459-the horse headlong swiftness , with ears pricked forward , and thirsty nostrils exulting in the wind [his]1459-the horse career created . But there was the moon jolting like an old chariot - wheel down [the hill of heaven]1482-the hill of heaven , with awful boding ! [She]1475-her rolled at last over the horizon - edge and disappeared , carrying all [her]1475-her light with [her]1475-her . [The mighty steed]1483-the mighty steed was in the act of clearing [a wide shallow channel]1484-a wide shallow channel when [we]1466-we were caught in the net of the darkness . [His]1459-the horse head dropped ; its impetus carried [his]1459-the horse helpless bulk across , but [he]1459-the horse fell in a heap on the margin , and where [he]1459-the horse fell [he]1459-the horse lay . [I]0-i got up , kneeled beside [him]1459-the horse , and felt [him]1459-the horse all over . Not a bone could [I]0-i find broken , but [he]1459-the horse was a horse no more . [I]0-i sat down on the body , and buried [my]0-i face in [my]0-i hands . BITTERLY cold grew the night . The body froze under [me]0-i . The cry of the wolves came nearer ; [I]0-i heard [their]1485-they feet soft - padding on the rocky ground ; [their]1485-they quick panting filled the air . Through the darkness [I]0-i saw the many glowing eyes ; [their]1485-they half - circle contracted around [me]0-i . [My]0-i time was come ! [I]0-i sprang to [my]0-i feet.—Alas , [I]0-i had not even a stick ! [They]1485-they came in a rush , [their]1485-they eyes flashing with fury of greed , [their]1485-they black throats agape to devour [me]0-i . [I]0-i stood hopelessly waiting [them]1485-they . One moment [they]1485-they halted over the horse — then came at [me]0-i . With a sound of swiftness all but silence , a cloud of green eyes came down on [their]1485-they flank . The heads that bore [them]1485-they flew at the wolves with a cry feebler yet fiercer than [their]1485-they howling snarl , and by the cry [I]0-i knew [them]1485-they : [they]1485-they were cats , led by [a huge gray one]1486-a huge gray one . [I]0-i could see nothing of [him]1486-a huge gray one but [his]1486-a huge gray one eyes , yet [I]0-i knew [him]1486-a huge gray one — and so knew [his]1486-a huge gray one colour and bigness . A terrific battle followed , whose tale alone came to [me]0-i through the night . [I]0-i would have fled , for surely it was but a fight which should have me!—only where was the use ? [my]0-i first step would be a fall ! and [[my]0-i foes of either kind]1487-my foes of either kind could both see and scent [me]0-i in the dark ! All at once [I]0-i missed the howling , and the caterwauling grew wilder . Then came the soft padding , and [I]0-i knew it meant flight : the cats had defeated the wolves ! In a moment the sharpest of sharp teeth were in [my]0-i legs ; a moment more and the cats were all over [me]0-i in a live cataract , biting wherever [they]1485-they could bite , furiously scratching [me]0-i anywhere and everywhere . A multitude clung to [my]0-i body ; [I]0-i could not flee . Madly [I]0-i fell on the hateful swarm , every finger instinct with destruction . [I]0-i tore [them]1485-they off [me]0-i , [I]0-i throttled at [them]1485-they in vain : when [I]0-i would have flung [them]1485-they from [me]0-i , they clung to [my]0-i hands like limpets . [I]0-i trampled [them]1485-they under [my]0-i feet , thrust [my]0-i fingers in [their]1485-they eyes , caught [them]1485-they in jaws stronger than [theirs]1485-they , but could not rid [myself]0-i of one . Without cease [they]1485-they kept discovering upon [me]0-i space for fresh mouthfuls ; [they]1485-they hauled at [my]0-i skin with the widespread , horribly curved pincers of clutching claws ; [they]1485-they hissed and spat in [my]0-i face — but never touched it until , in [my]0-i despair , [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i on the ground , when [they]1485-they forsook [my]0-i body , and darted at [my]0-i face . [I]0-i rose , and immediately [they]1485-they left it , the more to occupy [themselves]1485-they with [my]0-i legs . In an agony [I]0-i broke from [them]1485-they and ran , careless whither , cleaving the solid dark . [They]1485-they accompanied [me]0-i in a surrounding torrent , now rubbing , now leaping up against [me]0-i , but tormenting [me]0-i no more . When [I]0-i fell , which was often , [they]1485-they gave [me]0-i time to rise ; when from fear of falling [I]0-i slackened [my]0-i pace , [they]1485-they flew afresh at [my]0-i legs . All that miserable night [they]1485-they kept [me]0-i running — but [they]1485-they drove [me]0-i by a comparatively smooth path , for [I]0-i tumbled into [no gully]1488-no gully , and passing [the Evil Wood]5-the evil wood without seeing it , left it behind in the dark . When at length the morning appeared , [I]0-i was beyond [the channels]789-the channels , and on the verge of [the orchard valley]1490-the orchard valley . In [my]0-i joy [I]0-i would have made [friends]647-friends with [[my]0-i persecutors]1492-my persecutors , but not a cat was to be seen . [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i on the moss , and fell fast asleep . [I]0-i was waked by a kick , to find [myself]0-i bound hand and foot , once more the thrall of [the giants]634-the giants ! " What fitter ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i ; " to whom else should [I]0-i belong ? "[0-i] and [I]0-i laughed in the triumph of self - disgust . A second kick stopped [my]0-i false merriment ; and thus recurrently assisted by [[my]0-i captors]1494-my captors , [I]0-i succeeded at length in rising to [my]0-i feet . [Six of [them]1494-my captors]1495-six of them were about [me]0-i . [They]1494-my captors undid the rope that tied [my]0-i legs together , attached a rope to each of [them]1494-my captors , and dragged [me]0-i away . [I]0-i walked as well as [I]0-i could , but , as [they]1494-my captors frequently pulled both ropes at once , [I]0-i fell repeatedly , whereupon [they]1494-my captors always kicked [me]0-i up again . Straight to [[my]0-i old labour]1496-my old labour [they]1494-my captors took [me]0-i , tied [my]0-i leg - ropes to a tree , undid [my]0-i arms , and put the hateful flint in [my]0-i left hand . Then [they]1494-my captors lay down and pelted [me]0-i with fallen fruit and stones , but seldom hit [me]0-i . If [I]0-i could have freed [my]0-i legs , and got hold of a stick [I]0-i spied a couple of yards from [me]0-i , [I]0-i would have fallen upon [all six of [them]1494-my captors]1497-all six of them ! " But [the Little Ones]633-the little ones will come at night ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , and was comforted . All day [I]0-i worked hard . When the darkness came , [they]1494-my captors tied [my]0-i hands , and left [me]0-i fast to the tree . [I]0-i slept a good deal , but woke often , and every time from a dream of lying in the heart of [a heap of [children]599-children]1498-a heap of children . With the morning [[my]0-i enemies]1500-my enemies reappeared , bringing [their]1500-my enemies kicks and [their]1500-my enemies bestial company . It was about noon , and [I]0-i was nearly failing from fatigue and hunger , when [I]0-i heard a sudden commotion in the brushwood , followed by a burst of the bell - like laughter so dear to [my]0-i heart . [I]0-i gave a loud cry of delight and welcome . Immediately rose a trumpeting as of [baby elephants , a neighing as of foals , and a bellowing as of calves]1501-baby elephants , a neighing as of foals , and a bellowing as of calves , and through the bushes came a crowd of Little Ones , on diminutive horses , on small elephants , on little bears ; but the noises came from [the riders]1502-the riders , not the animals . [The giants]634-the giants sprang to [their]634-the giants lumbering feet , but were instantly saluted with a storm of sharp stones ; the horses charged [their]634-the giants legs ; the bears rose and hugged [them]634-the giants at the waist ; the elephants threw [their]634-the giants trunks round [their]634-the giants necks , pulled [them]634-the giants down , and gave [them]634-the giants such a trampling as [they]634-the giants had sometimes given , but never received before . In a moment [my]0-i ropes were undone , and [I]0-i was in the arms , seemingly innumerable , of [the Little Ones]633-the little ones . [I]0-i got up , and laid [myself]0-i in the hollow between [their]1517-the elephants two backs ; when the wise animals , counteracting the weight that pushed them apart , leaned against each other , and made for [me]0-i a most comfortable litter . Whither [they]1517-the elephants were carrying [me]0-i , [I]0-i did not try to conjecture ; [I]0-i yielded [myself]0-i to [their]1517-the elephants pleasure , almost as happy as [they]1517-the elephants . [I]0-i woke : a sudden musical uproar greeted the opening of [my]0-i eyes . "[0-i] The sun was set , and it was fast getting dark , yet presently a multitude of birds began to sing . [I]0-i lay down to listen , pretty sure that , if [I]0-i left [them]2965-the children alone , [the hiders]1532-the hiders would soon come out again . The singing grew to a little storm of bird - voices . " Surely [the children]2965-the children must have something to do with it!—And yet how could [they]2965-the children set the birds singing ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i as [I]0-i lay and listened . Soon , however , happening to look up into the tree under which [[my]0-i elephants]1533-my elephants stood , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i spied a little motion among the leaves , and looked more keenly . Sudden white spots appeared in the dark foliage , the music died down , a gale of childish laughter rippled the air , and white spots came out in every direction : the trees were full of [children]599-children ! In the wildest merriment [they]2965-the children began to descend , some dropping from bough to bough so rapidly that [I]0-i could scarce believe [they]2965-the children had not fallen . [I]0-i left [my]0-i litter , and was instantly surrounded — a mark for all the artillery of [their]2965-the children jubilant fun . With stately composure the elephants walked away to bed . " But , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , when [their]2965-the children uproarious gladness had had scope for a while , " how is it that [I]0-i never before heard [you]2965-the children sing like the birds ? Even when [I]0-i thought it must be [you]2965-the children , [I]0-i could hardly believe it ! "[0-i] " Ah , "[0-i] said one of the wildest , " but [we]3573-we were not birds then ! [We]3573-we were [run - creatures]3574-run - creatures , [not fly - creatures]3575-not fly - creatures ! [We]3573-we had [our]3573-we hide - places in the bushes then ; but when [we]3573-we came to no - bushes , only trees , [we]3573-we had to build nests !
