[I]0-i LAY down by a tree , and [one and one or in little groups]1538-one and one or in little groups , [the children]2965-the children left [me]0-i and climbed to [[their]2965-the children nests]1540-their nests . [They]2965-the children were always so tired at night and so rested in the morning , that [they]2965-the children were equally glad to go to sleep and to get up again . [I]0-i , although tired also , lay awake : [Lona]44-lona had not bid [me]0-i good night , and [I]0-i was sure [she]44-lona would come . [I]0-i had been struck , the moment [I]0-i saw [her]44-lona again , with [her]44-lona resemblance to [the princess]3100-the princess , and could not doubt [her]44-lona [the daughter of whom [Adam]58-adam had told [me]0-i]1542-the daughter of whom adam had told me ; but in [Lona]44-lona the dazzling beauty of [Lilith]66-lilith was softened by childlikeness , and deepened by the sense of motherhood . " [She]44-lona is occupied probably , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , " with [the child of [the woman [I]0-i met fleeing]3588-the woman i met fleeing]3587-the child of the woman i met fleeing ! "[0-i] who , [she]44-lona had already told [me]0-i , was not half [mother enough]1543-mother enough . [She]44-lona came at length , sat down beside [me]0-i , and after a few moments of silent delight , expressed mainly by stroking [my]0-i face and hands , began to tell [me]0-i everything that had befallen since [I]0-i went . The moon appeared as [we]1544-we talked , and now and then , through the leaves , lighted for a quivering moment [her]44-lona beautiful face — full of thought , and a care whose love redeemed and glorified it . How [such a child]1545-such a child should have been born of [such a mother]1546-such a mother — [such a woman of such [a princess]1548-a princess]1547-such a woman of such a princess , was hard to understand ; but then , happily , [she]44-lona had [two parents]1549-two parents — say rather , three ! [She]44-lona drew [my]0-i heart by what in [me]0-i was likest [herself]44-lona , and [I]0-i loved [her]44-lona as one who , grow to what perfection [she]44-lona might , could only become the more [a child]106-a child . [I]0-i knew now that [I]0-i loved [her]44-lona when [I]0-i left [her]44-lona , and that the hope of seeing [her]44-lona again had been [my]0-i main comfort . Every word [she]44-lona spoke seemed to go straight to [my]0-i heart , and , like the truth itself , make it purer . [She]44-lona told [me]0-i that after [I]0-i left [the orchard valley]1490-the orchard valley , [the giants]634-the giants began to believe a little more in the actual existence of [[their]634-the giants neighbours]917-their neighbours , and became in consequence more hostile to [them]634-the giants . Sometimes [the Little Ones]47-the little ones would see [them]634-the giants trampling furiously , perceiving or imagining some indication of [their]634-the giants presence , while [they]47-the little ones indeed stood beside , and laughed at [their]47-the little ones foolish rage . By and by , however , [their]634-the giants animosity assumed a more practical shape : [they]634-the giants began to destroy the trees on whose fruit [the Little Ones]633-the little ones lived . This drove [the mother of [them]633-the little ones all]1555-the mother of them all to meditate counteraction . Setting the sharpest of [them]633-the little ones to listen at night , [she]44-lona learned that [the giants]634-the giants thought [I]0-i was hidden somewhere near , intending , as soon as [I]0-i recovered [my]0-i strength , to come in the dark and kill [them]634-the giants sleeping . Thereupon [she]44-lona concluded that the only way to stop the destruction was to give [them]634-the giants ground for believing that [they]634-the giants had abandoned [the place]2672-the place . [The Little Ones]47-the little ones must remove into [the forest]314-the forest — beyond the range of [the giants]634-the giants , but within reach of [their]47-the little ones own trees , which [they]47-the little ones must visit by night ! The main objection to the plan was , that [the forest]314-the forest had little or no undergrowth to shelter — or conceal [them]634-the giants if necessary . But [she]44-lona reflected that where birds , there [the Little Ones]633-the little ones could find habitation . [They]633-the little ones had eager sympathies with all modes of life , and could learn of [the wildest creatures]1562-the wildest creatures : why should [they]633-the little ones not take refuge from the cold and [[their]633-the little ones enemies]1563-their enemies in the tree - tops ? why not , having lain in the low brushwood , seek now the lofty foliage ? why not build nests where it would not serve to scoop hollows ? All that the birds could do , [the Little Ones]633-the little ones could learn — except , indeed , to fly ! [She]44-lona spoke to [them]633-the little ones on the subject , and [they]633-the little ones heard with approval . [They]633-the little ones could already climb the trees , and [they]633-the little ones had often watched the birds building [[their]633-the little ones nests]1540-their nests ! [The trees of [the forest]314-the forest]1566-the trees of the forest , although large , did not look bad ! [They]1566-the trees of the forest went up much nearer the sky than those of [the giants]634-the giants , and spread out [their]1566-the trees of the forest arms — some even stretched them down — as if inviting [them]633-the little ones to come and live with [them]633-the little ones ! Perhaps , in the top of the tallest , [they]633-the little ones might find the bird that laid the baby - eggs , and sat upon [them]633-the little ones till they were ripe , then tumbled [them]633-the little ones down to let [the little ones]633-the little ones out ! Yes ; [they]633-the little ones would build sleep - houses in the trees , where [no giant]1570-no giant would see [them]633-the little ones , for never by any chance did one throw back [his]1571-his dull head to look up ! Then [the bad giants]2993-the bad giants would be sure [they]2993-the bad giants had left [the country]454-the country , and [the Little Ones]47-the little ones would gather [their]47-the little ones own apples and pears and figs and mesples and peaches when [they]47-the little ones were asleep ! Thus reasoned [the Lovers]3115-the lovers , and eagerly adopted [Lona]44-lona 's suggestion — with the result that [they]633-the little ones were soon as much at [home]2676-home in [the tree - tops]1576-the tree - tops as the birds [themselves]633-the little ones , and that [the giants]634-the giants came ere long to the conclusion that [they]634-the giants had frightened [them]634-the giants out of [the country]454-the country — whereupon [they]634-the giants forgot [[their]634-the giants trees]1579-their trees , and again almost ceased to believe in the existence of [[their]634-the giants small neighbours]1580-their small neighbours . [Lona]44-lona asked [me]0-i whether [I]0-i had not observed that [many of [the children]2965-the children]1581-many of the children were grown . [I]0-i answered [I]0-i had not , but could readily believe it . [She]44-lona assured [me]0-i it was so , but said the certain evidence that [their]2965-the children minds too had grown since [their]2965-the children migration upward , had gone far in mitigation of the alarm the discovery had occasioned [her]44-lona . In the last of the short twilight , and later when the moon was shining , [they]2965-the children went down to [the valley]623-the valley , and gathered fruit enough to serve [them]2965-the children the next day ; for [the giants]634-the giants never went out in the twilight : that to [them]634-the giants was darkness ; and [they]634-the giants hated the moon : had [they]634-the giants been able , [they]634-the giants would have extinguished [her]44-lona . But soon [the Little Ones]47-the little ones found that fruit gathered in the night was not altogether good the next day ; so the question arose whether it would not be better , instead of pretending to have left [the country]454-the country , to make [the bad giants]2993-the bad giants [themselves]2993-the bad giants leave [it]454-the country . [They]2965-the children had already , [she]44-lona said , in exploring [the forest]314-the forest , made acquaintance with the animals in [it]314-the forest , and with most of [them]2965-the children personally . Knowing therefore how strong as well as wise and docile some of [them]2965-the children were , and how swift as well as manageable many others , [they]2965-the children now set [themselves]2965-the children to secure [their]2965-the children aid against the giants , and with loving , playful approaches , had soon made [more than friends of most of [them]2965-the children]1588-more than friends of most of them , from the first addressing horse or elephant as [Brother]192-brother or [Sister Elephant]69-sister elephant , [Brother]192-brother or [Sister Horse]70-sister horse , until before long [they]2965-the children had an individual name for each . It was some little time longer before [they]2965-the children said [Brother]71-brother or [Sister Bear]72-sister bear , but that came next , and the other day [she]44-lona had heard [one little fellow]1591-one little fellow cry , " Ah , [Sister Serpent]73-sister serpent ! "[1591-one little fellow] to a snake that bit [him]1591-one little fellow as [he]1591-one little fellow played with it too roughly . [Most of [them]2965-the children]1592-most of them would have nothing to do with a caterpillar , except watch it through its changes ; but when at length it came from its retirement with wings , [all]1593-all would immediately address it as [Sister Butterfly]74-sister butterfly , congratulating [it]74-sister butterfly on its metamorphosis — for which [they]1593-all used a word that meant something like repentance — and evidently regarding it as something sacred . One moonlit evening , as [they]2965-the children were going to gather [their]2965-the children fruit , [they]2965-the children came upon [a woman seated on the ground with [a baby]2974-a baby in [her]1594-a woman seated on the ground with a baby in her lap lap]1594-a woman seated on the ground with a baby in her lap — [the woman [I]0-i had met on [my]0-i way to [Bulika]6-bulika]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika . [They]2965-the children took [her]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika for [a giantess that had stolen one of [[their]2965-the children babies]762-their babies]1597-a giantess that had stolen one of their babies , for [they]2965-the children regarded [all babies]1599-all babies as [their]2965-the children property . Filled with anger [they]2965-the children fell upon [her]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika multitudinously , beating [her]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika after a childish , yet sufficiently bewildering fashion . [She]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika would have fled , but [a boy]1600-a boy threw [himself]1600-a boy down and held [her]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika by the feet . Recovering [her]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika wits , [she]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika recognised in [[her]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika assailants]1601-her assailants [the children whose hospitality [she]1596-the woman i had met on my way to bulika sought]1602-the children whose hospitality she sought , and at once yielded [the baby]673-the baby . [Lona]44-lona appeared , and carried it away in [her]44-lona bosom . But while [the woman]348-the woman noted that in striking [her]44-lona [they]2965-the children were careful not to hurt [the child]698-the child , [the Little Ones]633-the little ones noted that , as [she]44-lona surrendered [her]44-lona , [she]44-lona hugged and kissed [her]44-lona just as [they]2965-the children wanted to do , and came to the conclusion that [she]44-lona must be [a giantess of the same kind as the good giant]1607-a giantess of the same kind as the good giant . The moment [Lona]44-lona had [the baby]673-the baby , therefore , [they]2965-the children brought [the mother]1418-the mother fruit , and began to show [her]44-lona every sort of childish attention . Now [the woman]348-the woman had been in perplexity whither to betake [herself]348-the woman , not daring to go back to [the city]3099-the city , because [the princess]3100-the princess was certain to find out who had lamed [[her]3100-the princess leopardess]1613-her leopardess : delighted with the friendliness of [the little people]641-the little people , [she]3100-the princess resolved to remain with [them]641-the little people for the present : [she]3100-the princess would have no trouble with [[her]3100-the princess infant]1615-her infant , and might find some way of returning to [[her]3100-the princess husband]350-her husband , who was rich in money and gems , and very seldom unkind to [her]3100-the princess . Here [I]0-i must supplement , partly from conjecture , what [Lona]44-lona told [me]0-i about [the woman]348-the woman . With [the rest of [the inhabitants of [Bulika]6-bulika]1619-the inhabitants of bulika]1618-the rest of the inhabitants of bulika , [she]348-the woman was aware of the tradition that [the princess]3100-the princess lived in terror of the birth of [an infant destined to [her]3100-the princess destruction]1621-an infant destined to her destruction . [They]1618-the rest of the inhabitants of bulika were all unacquainted , however , with the frightful means by which [she]3100-the princess preserved [her]3100-the princess youth and beauty ; and [her]3100-the princess deteriorating physical condition requiring a larger use of those means , [they]1618-the rest of the inhabitants of bulika took the apparent increase of [her]3100-the princess hostility to [children]599-children for a sign that [she]3100-the princess saw [her]3100-the princess doom approaching . This , although [no one]134-no one dreamed of any attempt against [her]3100-the princess , nourished in [them]1618-the rest of the inhabitants of bulika hopes of change . Now arose in the mind of [the woman]348-the woman the idea of furthering the fulfilment of the shadowy prediction , or of using the myth at least for [her]3100-the princess own restoration to [[her]3100-the princess husband]350-her husband . For what seemed more probable than that the fate foretold lay with [these very children]1626-these very children ? [They]1626-these very children were marvellously brave , and [the Bulikans cowards]1627-the bulikans cowards , in abject terror of animals ! If [she]3100-the princess could rouse in [the Little Ones]47-the little ones the ambition of taking [the city]3099-the city , then in the confusion of the attack , [she]3100-the princess would escape from [the little army]1629-the little army , reach [[her]3100-the princess house]1630-her house unrecognised , and there lying hidden , await the result ! Should [the children]2965-the children now succeed in expelling [the giants]634-the giants , [she]3100-the princess would begin at once , while [they]2965-the children were yet flushed with victory , to suggest the loftier aim ! By disposition , indeed , [they]2965-the children were unfit for warfare ; [they]2965-the children hardly ever quarrelled , and never fought ; loved every live thing , and hated either to hurt or to suffer . Still , [they]2965-the children were easily influenced , and could certainly be taught any exercise within [their]2965-the children strength!—At once [she]3100-the princess set some of [the smaller ones]1633-the smaller ones throwing stones at a mark ; and soon [they]2965-the children were all engrossed with the new game , and growing skilful in it . The first practical result was [their]2965-the children use of stones in [my]0-i rescue . While gathering fruit , [they]2965-the children found [me]0-i asleep , went [home]2676-home , held a council , came the next day with [their]2965-the children elephants and horses , overwhelmed [the few giants watching [me]0-i]1635-the few giants watching me , and carried [me]0-i off . Jubilant over [their]2965-the children victory , [the smaller boys]1636-the smaller boys were childishly boastful , [the bigger boys]727-the bigger boys less ostentatious , while [the girls]1638-the girls , although [their]1638-the girls eyes flashed more , were not so talkative as usual . [The woman of [Bulika]6-bulika]1639-the woman of bulika no doubt felt encouraged . [We]1640-we talked the greater part of the night , chiefly about the growth of [the children]2965-the children , and what it might indicate . With [Lona]44-lona 's power of recognising truth [I]0-i had long been familiar ; now [I]0-i began to be astonished at [her]44-lona practical wisdom . Probably , had [I]0-i been more of [a child]106-a child [myself]0-i , [I]0-i should have wondered less . It was yet far from morning when [I]0-i became aware of a slight fluttering and scrambling . [I]0-i rose on [my]0-i elbow , and looking about [me]0-i , saw [many Little Ones]1643-many little ones descend from [[their]1643-many little ones nests]1540-their nests . [They]1643-many little ones disappeared , and in a few moments all was again still . " What are [they]1643-many little ones doing ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [They]1643-many little ones think , "[44-lona] answered [Lona]44-lona , " that , stupid as [they]1643-many little ones are , [the giants]634-the giants will search the wood , and [they]1643-many little ones are gone to gather stones with which to receive [them]1643-many little ones . Stones are not plentiful in [the forest]314-the forest , and [they]1643-many little ones have to scatter far to find enow . [They]1643-many little ones will carry [them]1643-many little ones to [[their]1643-many little ones nests]1540-their nests , and from the trees attack [the giants]634-the giants as [they]1643-many little ones come within reach . Knowing [their]1643-many little ones habits , [they]1643-many little ones do not expect [them]1643-many little ones before the morning . If [they]1643-many little ones do come , it will be the opening of a war of expulsion : one or [the other people]3593-the other people must go . The result , however , is hardly doubtful . [We]3594-we do not mean to kill [them]1643-many little ones ; indeed , [their]1643-many little ones skulls are so thick that [I]44-lona do not think [we]3594-we could!—not that killing would do [them]1643-many little ones much harm ; [they]1643-many little ones are so little alive ! If [one]2690-one were killed , [[his]2690-one giantess]3596-his giantess would not remember [him]2690-one beyond three days ! "[44-lona] " Do [the children]2965-the children then throw so well that the thing might happen ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " Wait till [you]0-i see [them]1643-many little ones ! "[1645-i] [she]1645-i answered , with a touch of pride . " — But [I]1645-i have not yet told [you]0-i , "[1645-i] [she]1645-i went on , " of a strange thing that happened the night before [last!—We]3594-we had come [home]2676-home from gathering [our]3594-we fruit , and were asleep in [[our]3594-we nests]3599-our nests , when [we]3594-we were roused by the horrid noises of beasts fighting . The moon was bright , and in a moment [our]3594-we trees glittered with staring little eyes , watching two huge leopardesses , [one perfectly white , the other covered with black spots , which worried and tore each other]3600-one perfectly white , the other covered with black spots , which worried and tore each other with [I]1645-i do not know how many teeth and claws . To judge by [her]1645-i back , the spotted creature must have been climbing a tree when the other sprang upon [her]1645-i . When first [I]1645-i saw [them]1643-many little ones , [they]1643-many little ones were just under [my]1645-i own tree , rolling over and over each other . [I]1645-i got down on the lowest branch , and saw [them]1643-many little ones perfectly . [The children]2965-the children enjoyed the spectacle , siding some with this one , some with that , for [we]3594-we had never seen such beasts before , and thought [they]1643-many little ones were only at play . But by degrees [their]1643-many little ones roaring and growling almost ceased , and [I]1645-i saw that [they]1643-many little ones were in deadly earnest , and heartily wished neither might be left able to climb a tree . But when [the children]2965-the children saw the blood pouring from [their]1643-many little ones flanks and throats , what do [you]3603-you think [they]2965-the children did ? [They]2965-the children scurried down to comfort [them]1643-many little ones , and gathering in [a great crowd about the terrible creatures]3604-a great crowd about the terrible creatures , began to pat and stroke [them]1643-many little ones . Then [I]1645-i got down as well , for [they]2965-the children were much too absorbed to heed [my]1645-i calling to [them]2965-the children ; but before [I]1645-i could reach [them]2965-the children , [the white one]3441-the white one stopped fighting , and sprang among [them]2965-the children with such a hideous yell that [they]2965-the children flew up into the trees like birds . Before [I]1645-i got back into [mine]1645-i , the wicked beasts were at it again tooth and claw . Then [Whitey]75-whitey had the best of it ; [Spotty]76-spotty ran away as fast as [she]76-spotty could run , and [Whitey]75-whitey came and lay down at the foot of [[my]1645-i tree]695-my tree . But in a minute or two [she]76-spotty was up again , and walking about as if [she]76-spotty thought [Spotty]76-spotty might be lurking somewhere . [I]1645-i waked often , and every time [I]1645-i looked out , [I]1645-i saw [her]76-spotty . In the morning [she]76-spotty went away . "[1645-i] " [I]0-i know both the beasts , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [Spotty]76-spotty is [a bad beast]3607-a bad beast . [She]76-spotty hates [the children]2965-the children , and would kill [every one of [them]2965-the children]3609-every one of them . But [Whitey]75-whitey loves [them]633-the little ones . [She]76-spotty ran at [them]633-the little ones only to frighten [them]633-the little ones away , lest [Spotty]76-spotty should get hold of any of [them]633-the little ones . [No one]134-no one needs be afraid of [Whitey]75-whitey ! "[0-i] By this time [the Little Ones]633-the little ones were coming back , and with much noise , for [they]633-the little ones had no care to keep quiet now that [they]633-the little ones were at open war with [the giants]634-the giants , and laden with good stones . [They]633-the little ones mounted to [[their]633-the little ones nests]1540-their nests again , though with difficulty because of [their]633-the little ones burdens , and in a minute were fast asleep . [Lona]44-lona retired to [her]44-lona tree . [I]0-i lay where [I]0-i was , and slept the better that [I]0-i thought most likely the white leopardess was still [somewhere in the wood]1649-somewhere in the wood . [I]0-i woke soon after the sun , and lay pondering . Two hours passed , and then in truth [the giants]634-the giants began to appear , in straggling companies of three and four , until [I]0-i counted over [a hundred of [them]634-the giants]1651-a hundred of them . [The children]2965-the children were still asleep , and to call [them]2965-the children would draw the attention of [the giants]634-the giants : [I]0-i would keep quiet so long as [they]634-the giants did not discover [me]0-i . But by and by one came blundering upon [me]0-i , stumbled , fell , and rose again . [I]0-i thought [he]1654-he would pass heedless , but [he]1654-he began to search about . [I]0-i sprang to [my]0-i feet , and struck [him]1654-he in the middle of [his]1654-he huge body . The roar [he]1654-he gave roused [the children]2965-the children , and a storm as of hail instantly came on , of which not a stone struck [me]0-i , and not one missed [the giant]1656-the giant . [He]1654-he fell and lay . [Others]2785-others drew near , and the storm extended , [each purblind creature]1658-each purblind creature becoming , as [he]1654-he entered the range of a garrisoned tree , a target for converging stones . In a short time almost every giant was prostrate , and [a jubilant pæan of bird - song]1659-a jubilant pæan of bird - song rose from the tops of fifty trees . Many elephants came hurrying up , and [the children]2965-the children descending the trees like monkeys , in a moment every elephant had three or four of [them]2965-the children on [his]1654-he back , and thus loaded , began to walk over [the giants , who lay and roared]1661-the giants , who lay and roared . Losing patience at length with [their]1661-the giants , who lay and roared noise , the elephants gave [them]1661-the giants , who lay and roared a few blows of [their]1661-the giants , who lay and roared trunks , and left [them]1661-the giants , who lay and roared . Until night [the bad giants]2993-the bad giants remained where [they]2993-the bad giants had fallen , silent and motionless . The next morning [they]1661-the giants , who lay and roared had disappeared every one , and [the children]2965-the children saw no more of [them]1661-the giants , who lay and roared . [They]1661-the giants , who lay and roared removed to [the other end of [the orchard valley]1490-the orchard valley]1664-the other end of the orchard valley , and never after ventured into [the forest]314-the forest . VICTORY thus gained , [the woman of [Bulika]6-bulika]1639-the woman of bulika began to speak about [the city]3099-the city , and talked much of [its]3099-the city defenceless condition , of the wickedness of [[its]3099-the city princess]1669-its princess , of the cowardice of [[its]3099-the city inhabitants]1670-its inhabitants . In a few days [the children]2965-the children chattered of nothing but [Bulika]6-bulika , although indeed [they]2965-the children had not the least notion of what [a city]610-a city was . Then first [I]0-i became aware of the design of [the woman]348-the woman , although not yet of its motive . The idea of taking possession of [the place]2672-the place , recommended itself greatly to [Lona]44-lona — and to [me]0-i also . [The children]2965-the children were now so rapidly developing faculty , that [I]0-i could see no serious obstacle to the success of the enterprise . For [the terrible Lilith]1676-the terrible lilith — [woman]377-woman or leopardess , [I]0-i knew [her]1676-the terrible lilith one vulnerable point , [her]1676-the terrible lilith doom through [[her]1676-the terrible lilith daughter]1405-her daughter , and the influence the ancient prophecy had upon [the citizens]1679-the citizens : surely whatever in the enterprise could be called risk , was worth taking ! Successful,—and who could doubt [their]1680-their success?—must not [the Little Ones]633-the little ones , from [a crowd of [children]599-children]1682-a crowd of children , speedily become [a youthful people , whose government and influence would be all for righteousness]1684-a youthful people , whose government and influence would be all for righteousness ? Ruling [the wicked]1685-the wicked with a rod of iron , would [they]1680-their not be the redemption of [the nation]1686-the nation ? At the same time , [I]0-i have to confess that [I]0-i was not without views of personal advantage , not without ambition in the undertaking . It was just , it seemed to [me]0-i , that [Lona]44-lona should take [her]44-lona seat on the throne that had been [[her]44-lona mother]3293-her mother 's , and natural that [she]44-lona should make of [me]0-i [[her]44-lona consort]1688-her consort and [minister]1689-minister . For [me]0-i , [I]0-i would spend [my]0-i life in [her]44-lona service ; and between [us]1690-we , what might [we]1690-we not do , with such a core to it as [the Little Ones]633-the little ones , for the development of [a noble state]1692-a noble state ? [I]0-i confess also to an altogether foolish dream of opening a commerce in gems between the two worlds — happily impossible , for it could have done nothing but harm to both . Calling to mind the appeal of [Adam]58-adam , [I]0-i suggested to [Lona]44-lona that to find [them]633-the little ones water might perhaps expedite the growth of [the Little Ones]633-the little ones . [She]44-lona judged it prudent , however , to leave that alone for the present , as [we]1690-we did not know what its first consequences might be ; while , in the course of time , it would almost certainly subject [them]633-the little ones to a new necessity . " [They]633-the little ones are what [they]633-the little ones are without it ! "[44-lona] [she]44-lona said : " when [we]1690-we have [the city]3099-the city , [we]1690-we will search for water ! "[44-lona] [We]1690-we began , therefore , and pushed forward [our]1690-we preparations , constantly reviewing [the merry troops]1694-the merry troops and [companies]1695-companies . [Lona]44-lona gave [her]44-lona attention chiefly to [the commissariat]1696-the commissariat , while [I]0-i drilled [the little soldiers]1697-the little soldiers , exercised [them]1697-the little soldiers in stone - throwing , taught [them]1697-the little soldiers the use of some other weapons , and did all [I]0-i could to make [[warriors]1698-warriors of [them]1697-the little soldiers]1699-warriors of them . The main difficulty was to get [them]1697-the little soldiers to rally to [their]1697-the little soldiers flag the instant the call was sounded . [Most of [them]1697-the little soldiers]1592-most of them were armed with slings , some of [the bigger boys with bows and arrows]1701-the bigger boys with bows and arrows . [The bigger girls]637-the bigger girls carried aloe - spikes , strong as steel and sharp as needles , fitted to longish shafts — rather formidable weapons . [Their]637-the bigger girls sole duty was the charge of such as were too small to fight . [Lona]44-lona had [herself]44-lona grown a good deal , but did not seem aware of it : [she]44-lona had always been , as [she]44-lona still was , the tallest ! [Her]44-lona hair was much longer , and [she]44-lona was become almost [a woman]344-a woman , but [not one beauty of childhood]1704-not one beauty of childhood had [she]44-lona outgrown . When first [we]1705-we met after [our]1705-we long separation , [she]44-lona laid down [[her]44-lona infant]1615-her infant , put [her]44-lona arms round [my]0-i neck , and clung to [me]0-i silent , [her]44-lona face glowing with gladness : [the child]698-the child whimpered ; [she]44-lona sprang to [him]698-the child , and had [him]698-the child in [her]44-lona bosom instantly . To see [her]44-lona with [any thoughtless , obstinate , or irritable little one]1708-any thoughtless , obstinate , or irritable little one , was to think of [a tender grandmother]1709-a tender grandmother . [I]0-i seemed to have known [her]44-lona for ages — for always — from before time began ! [I]0-i hardly remembered [[my]0-i mother]107-my mother , but in [my]0-i mind 's eye [she]107-my mother now looked like [Lona]44-lona ; and if [I]0-i imagined [sister]193-sister or [child]1712-child , invariably [she]107-my mother had the face of [Lona]44-lona ! [My]0-i every imagination flew to [her]44-lona ; [she]44-lona was [[my]0-i heart]1713-my heart 's wife ! [She]44-lona hardly ever sought [me]0-i , but was almost always within sound of [my]0-i voice . What [I]0-i did or thought , [I]0-i referred constantly to [her]44-lona , and rejoiced to believe that , while doing [her]44-lona work in absolute independence , [she]44-lona was most at [home]2676-home by [my]0-i side . Never for [me]0-i did [she]44-lona neglect [the smallest child]1715-the smallest child , and [my]0-i love only quickened [my]0-i sense of duty . To love [her]44-lona and to do [my]0-i duty , seemed , not indeed one , but inseparable . [She]44-lona might suggest something [I]0-i should do ; [she]44-lona might ask [me]0-i what [she]44-lona ought to do ; but [she]44-lona never seemed to suppose that [I]0-i , any more than [she]44-lona , would like to do , or could care about anything except what must be done . [Her]44-lona love overflowed upon [me]0-i — not in caresses , but in a closeness of recognition which [I]0-i can compare to nothing but the devotion of a divine animal . [I]0-i never told [her]44-lona anything about [[her]44-lona mother]3293-her mother . The wood was full of birds , the splendour of whose plumage , while it took nothing from [their]1717-their song , seemed almost to make up for the lack of flowers — which , apparently , could not grow without water . Their glorious feathers being everywhere about in [the forest]314-the forest , it came into [my]0-i heart to make from them a garment for [Lona]44-lona . While [I]0-i gathered , and bound them in overlapping rows , [she]44-lona watched [me]0-i with evident appreciation of [my]0-i choice and arrangement , never asking what [I]0-i was fashioning , but evidently waiting expectant the result of [my]0-i work . In a week or two it was finished — a long loose mantle , to fasten at the throat and waist , with openings for the arms . [I]0-i rose and put it on [her]44-lona . [She]44-lona rose , took it off , and laid it at [my]0-i feet — [I]0-i imagine from a sense of propriety . [I]0-i put it again on [her]44-lona shoulders , and showed [her]44-lona where to put [her]44-lona arms through . [She]44-lona smiled , looked at the feathers a little and stroked them — again took it off and laid it down , this time by [her]44-lona side . When [she]44-lona left [me]0-i , [she]44-lona carried it with [her]44-lona , and [I]0-i saw no more of it for some days . At length [she]44-lona came to [me]0-i one morning wearing it , and carrying another garment which [she]44-lona had fashioned similarly , but of the dried leaves of a tough evergreen . It had the strength almost of leather , and the appearance of scale - armour . [I]0-i put it on at once , and [we]1719-we always thereafter wore those garments when on horseback . For , on [the outskirts of [the forest]314-the forest]1720-the outskirts of the forest , had appeared one day a troop of full - grown horses , with which , as [they]1722-they were nowise alarmed at creatures of a shape so different from [their]1722-they own , [I]0-i had soon made [friends]647-friends , and [two of the finest [I]0-i had trained for [Lona]44-lona and [myself]0-i]1724-two of the finest i had trained for lona and myself . Already accustomed to ride [a small one]1725-a small one , [her]44-lona delight was great when first [she]44-lona looked down from the back of [an animal of the giant kind]1726-an animal of the giant kind ; and the horse showed [himself]1727-himself proud of the burden [he]1727-himself bore . [We]1719-we exercised [them]1722-they every day until [they]1722-they had such confidence in [us]1719-we as to obey instantly and fear nothing ; after which [we]1719-we always rode [them]1722-they at parade and on the march . [The undertaking]1728-the undertaking did indeed at times appear to [me]0-i a foolhardy one , but the confidence of [the woman of [Bulika]6-bulika]1639-the woman of bulika , real or simulated , always overcame [my]0-i hesitancy . [The princess]3100-the princess 's magic , [she]1639-the woman of bulika insisted , would prove powerless against [the children]2965-the children ; and as to any force [she]1639-the woman of bulika might muster , [[our]1719-we animal - allies]1732-our animal - allies alone would assure [our]1719-we superiority : [she]1639-the woman of bulika was [herself]1639-the woman of bulika , [she]1639-the woman of bulika said , ready , with a good stick , to encounter [any two men of [Bulika]6-bulika]1733-any two men of bulika . [She]1639-the woman of bulika confessed to not a little fear of [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess , but [I]0-i was [myself]0-i ready for [her]1639-the woman of bulika . [I]0-i shrank , however , from carrying all [the children]2965-the children with [us]1719-we . " Would it not be better , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " that [you]1639-the woman of bulika remained in [the forest]314-the forest with [[your]1639-the woman of bulika baby]3613-your baby and [the smallest of [the Little Ones]633-the little ones]3614-the smallest of the little ones ? "[0-i] [She]1639-the woman of bulika answered that [she]1639-the woman of bulika greatly relied on the impression the sight of [them]2965-the children would make on [the women]627-the women , especially [the mothers]1737-the mothers . " When [they]2965-the children see [the darlings]1336-the darlings , "[1639-the woman of bulika] [she]1639-the woman of bulika said , " [their]2965-the children hearts will be taken by storm ; and [I]1639-the woman of bulika must be there encouraging [them]2965-the children to make a stand ! If there be a remnant of hardihood in [the place]2672-the place , it will be found among [the women]627-the women ! "[1639-the woman of bulika] " [You]44-lona must not encumber [yourself]44-lona , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [Lona]44-lona , " with any of [the children]2965-the children ; [you]44-lona will be wanted everywhere ! "[0-i] For there were [two babies]1738-two babies besides [the woman]348-the woman 's , and even on horseback [she]1639-the woman of bulika had almost always one in [her]1639-the woman of bulika arms . " [I]1639-the woman of bulika do not remember ever being without [a child to take care of]3620-a child to take care of , "[1639-the woman of bulika] [she]1639-the woman of bulika answered ; " but when [we]3621-we reach [the city]3099-the city , it shall be as [you]0-i wish ! "[1639-the woman of bulika] [Her]1639-the woman of bulika confidence in one who had failed so unworthily , shamed [me]0-i . But neither had [I]0-i initiated the movement , nor had [I]0-i any ground for opposing it ; [I]0-i had no choice , but must give it the best help [I]0-i could ! For [myself]0-i , [I]0-i was ready to live or die with [Lona]44-lona . [Her]44-lona humility as well as [her]44-lona trust humbled [me]0-i , and [I]0-i gave [myself]0-i heartily to [her]44-lona purposes . [Our]1740-we way lying across [a grassy plain]1741-a grassy plain , there was no need to take food for the horses , or the two cows which would accompany [us]1740-we for [the infants]1742-the infants ; but the elephants had to be provided for . True , the grass was as good for [them]1743-them as for those other animals , but it was short , and with [their]1743-them one - fingered long noses , [they]1743-them could not pick enough for a single meal . [We]1740-we had , therefore , set the whole colony to gather grass and make hay , of which [the elephants]1517-the elephants [themselves]1517-the elephants could carry a quantity sufficient to last [them]1517-the elephants several days , with the supplement of what [we]1740-we would gather fresh every time [we]1740-we halted . For the bears [we]1740-we stored nuts , and for [ourselves]1740-we dried plenty of fruits . [We]1740-we had caught and tamed several more of the big horses , and now having loaded [them]1517-the elephants and the elephants with these provisions , [we]1740-we were prepared to set out . Then [Lona]44-lona and [I]0-i held a general review , and [I]0-i made [them]1743-them a little speech . [I]0-i began by telling [them]1743-them that [I]0-i had learned a good deal about [them]1743-them , and knew now where [they]1743-them came from . " [We]1740-we did not come from anywhere , "[1743-them] [they]1743-them cried , interrupting [me]0-i ; " [we]1740-we are here ! "[1743-them] [I]0-i told [them]1743-them that [every one of [them]1743-them]3609-every one of them had [a mother]1746-a mother of [his]3609-every one of them own , like [the mother of the last baby]1747-the mother of the last baby ; that [I]0-i believed [they]1743-them had all been brought from [Bulika]6-bulika when [they]1743-them were so small that [they]1743-them could not now remember it ; that [the wicked princess there]1748-the wicked princess there was so afraid of [babies]3314-babies , and so determined to destroy [them]3314-babies , that [[their]3314-babies mothers]1750-their mothers had to carry [them]3314-babies away and leave [them]3314-babies where [she]1748-the wicked princess there could not find [them]3314-babies ; and that now [we]1751-we were going to [Bulika]6-bulika , to find [[their]3314-babies mothers]1750-their mothers , and deliver [them]3314-babies from [the bad giantess]1753-the bad giantess . " But [I]0-i must tell [you]3021-the boys , "[0-i] [I]0-i continued , " that there is danger before [us]1751-we , for , as [you]3021-the boys know , [we]1751-we may have to fight hard to take [the city]3099-the city . "[0-i] " [We]1751-we can fight ! [we]1751-we are ready ! "[3021-the boys] cried [the boys]3021-the boys . " Yes , [you]3021-the boys can , "[0-i] [I]0-i returned , " and [I]0-i know [you]3021-the boys will : [mothers]3013-mothers are worth fighting for ! Only mind , [you]3021-the boys must all keep together . "[0-i] " Yes , yes ; [we]1751-we 'll take care of [each other]2772-each other , "[3021-the boys] [they]3021-the boys answered . " [Nobody]149-nobody shall touch one of [us]1751-we but [[his]149-nobody own mother]3627-his own mother ! "[3021-the boys] " [You]3021-the boys must mind , [every one]2818-every one , to do immediately what [[your]3021-the boys officers]3629-your officers tell [you]3021-the boys ! "[0-i] " [We]1751-we will , [we]1751-we will!—Now [we]1751-we 're quite ready ! Let [us]1751-we go ! "[0-i] " Another thing [you]3021-the boys must not forget , "[0-i] [I]0-i went on : " when [you]3021-the boys strike , be sure [you]3021-the boys make it a downright swinging blow ; when [you]3021-the boys shoot an arrow , draw it to the head ; when [you]3021-the boys sling a stone , sling it strong and straight . "[0-i] " That [we]1751-we will ! "[1755-they] [they]1755-they cried with jubilant , fearless shout . " Perhaps [you]0-i will be hurt ! "[1755-they] " [We]1751-we do n't mind that!—Do [we]1751-we , [boys]2983-boys ? "[0-i] " Not a bit ! "[0-i] " Some of [you]3021-the boys may very possibly be killed ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [I]1758-i do n't mind being killed ! "[1758-i] cried one of [the finest of [the smaller boys]1636-the smaller boys]1756-the finest of the smaller boys : [he]1758-i rode a beautiful little bull , which galloped and jumped like a horse . " [I]1758-i do n't either ! [I]1758-i do n't either ! "[1758-i] came from all sides . Then [Lona]44-lona , [queen]740-queen and [mother]1760-mother and [sister of [them]1755-they all]1761-sister of them all , spoke from [her]44-lona big horse by [my]0-i side : " [I]44-lona would give [my]44-lona life , "[44-lona] [she]44-lona said , " to have [[my]44-lona mother]107-my mother ! [She]107-my mother might kill [me]44-lona if [she]107-my mother liked ! [I]44-lona should just kiss [her]107-my mother and die ! "[44-lona] " Come along , [boys]2983-boys ! "[3101-a girl] cried [a girl]3101-a girl . " [We]1763-we 're going to [[our]1763-we [mothers]3013-mothers]3633-our mothers ! "[44-lona] A pang went through [my]0-i heart.—But [I]0-i could not draw back ; it would be moral ruin to [the Little Ones]47-the little ones ! IT was early in the morning when [we]1763-we set out , making , between the blue sky and the green grass , a gallant show on [the wide plain]1764-the wide plain . [We]1763-we would travel all the morning , and rest the afternoon ; then go on at night , rest the next day , and start again in the short twilight . The latter part of [our]1763-we journey [we]1763-we would endeavour so to divide as to arrive at [the city]3099-the city with the first of the morning , and be already inside the gates when discovered . It seemed as if [all the inhabitants of]1766-all the inhabitants of [the forest]314-the forest would migrate with [us]1763-we . A multitude of birds flew in front , imagining [themselves]1768-themselves , no doubt , [the leading division]1769-the leading division ; great companies of butterflies and other insects played about [our]1763-we heads ; and a crowd of four - footed creatures followed [us]1763-we . These last , when night came , left [us]1763-we almost all ; but the birds and the butterflies , the wasps and the dragon - flies , went with [us]1763-we to [the very gates of [the city]3099-the city]1770-the very gates of the city . [We]1763-we halted and slept soundly through the afternoon : it was [our]1763-we first real march , but [none]574-none were tired . In the night [we]1763-we went faster , because it was cold . [Many]1773-many fell asleep on the backs of [their]1773-many beasts , and woke in the morning quite fresh . [None]574-none tumbled off . [Some]2784-some rode shaggy , shambling bears , which yet made speed enough , going as fast as the elephants . [Others]2785-others were mounted on different kinds of deer , and would have been racing all the way had [I]0-i not prevented it . Those atop of the hay on the elephants , unable to see the animals below [them]1777-them , would keep talking to [them]1777-them as long as [they]1777-them were awake . Once , when [we]1763-we had halted to feed , [I]0-i heard [a little fellow]1778-a little fellow , as [he]1778-a little fellow drew out the hay to give [him]1778-a little fellow , commune thus with [his]1778-a little fellow " darling beast "[1778-a little fellow] : " Nosy dear , [I]1778-a little fellow am digging [you]1778-a little fellow out of [the mountain]3635-the mountain , and shall soon get down to [you]1778-a little fellow : be patient ; [I]1778-a little fellow 'm a coming ! Very soon now [you]1778-a little fellow 'll send up [your]1778-a little fellow nose to look for [me]1778-a little fellow , and then [we]1763-we 'll kiss like good elephants , [we]1763-we will ! "[1778-a little fellow] The same night there burst out such a tumult of elephant - trumpeting , horse - neighing , and child - imitation , ringing far over the silent levels , that , uncertain how near [the city]3099-the city might not be , [I]0-i quickly stilled the uproar lest it should give warning of [our]1763-we approach . Suddenly , one morning , the sun and [the city]3099-the city rose , as it seemed , together . To [the children]2965-the children the walls appeared only a great mass of rock , but when [I]0-i told [them]2965-the children the inside was full of nests of stone , [I]0-i saw apprehension and dislike at once invade [their]2965-the children hearts : for the first time in [their]2965-the children lives , [I]0-i believe — many of [them]2965-the children long little lives — [they]2965-the children knew fear . [The place]2672-the place looked to [them]2965-the children bad : how were [they]2965-the children to find [mothers]3013-mothers in such a place ? But [they]2965-the children went on bravely , for [they]2965-the children had confidence in [Lona]44-lona — and in [me]0-i too , little as [I]0-i deserved it . [We]1763-we rode through [the sounding archway]1784-the sounding archway . Sure never had such a drumming of hoofs , such a padding of paws and feet been heard on [its]2672-the place old pavement ! The horses started and looked scared at the echo of [their]1785-their own steps ; [some]2784-some halted a moment , [some]2784-some plunged wildly and wheeled about ; but [they]2965-the children were soon quieted , and went on . [Some of [the Little Ones]633-the little ones]1788-some of the little ones shivered , and all were still as death . [The three girls]1790-the three girls held closer the infants [they]1790-the three girls carried . All except the bears and butterflies manifested fear . On the countenance of [the woman]348-the woman lay a dark anxiety ; nor was [I]0-i [myself]0-i unaffected by the general dread , for the whole army was on [my]0-i hands and on [my]0-i conscience : [I]0-i had brought it up to the danger whose shadow was now making itself felt ! But [I]0-i was supported by the thought of the coming kingdom of [the Little Ones]633-the little ones , with [the bad giants its slaves]1793-the bad giants its slaves , and [the animals its loving , obedient friends]1794-the animals its loving , obedient friends ! Alas , [I]0-i who dreamed thus , had not [myself]0-i learned to obey ! [Untrusting , unfaithful obstinacy]1795-untrusting , unfaithful obstinacy had set [me]0-i at the head of [that army of [innocents]1797-innocents]1796-that army of innocents ! [I]0-i was [myself]0-i but [[a slave]1798-a slave , like [any king in [the world]108-the world]1800-any king in the world [I]0-i had left who does or would do only what pleases [him]1800-any king in the world ! But [Lona]44-lona rode beside [me]0-i [a child indeed]1802-a child indeed , therefore [a free woman]1803-a free woman — calm , silent , watchful , not a whit afraid ! [We]1804-we were nearly in [the heart of [the city]3099-the city]1227-the heart of the city before [any of [its]3099-the city inhabitants]1807-any of its inhabitants]1799-a slave , like any king in the world i had left who does or would do only what pleases him ! but lona rode beside me a child indeed , therefore a free woman — calm , silent , watchful , not a whit afraid ! we were nearly in the heart of the city before any of its inhabitants became aware of [our]1804-we presence . But now windows began to open , and sleepy heads to look out . [Every face]1808-every face wore at first a dull stare of wonderless astonishment , which , as soon as [the starers]1809-the starers perceived the animals , changed to one of consternation . In spite of [their]1809-the starers fear , however , when [they]1809-the starers saw that [[their]1809-the starers invaders]1810-their invaders were almost [all children]1811-all children , [the women]627-the women came running into [the streets]1813-the streets , and [the men]161-the men followed . But for a time [all of [them]1815-all of them]1815-all of them kept close to [the houses]1816-the houses , leaving open the middle of the way , for [they]1809-the starers durst not approach the animals . At length [a boy , who looked about five years old]1817-a boy , who looked about five years old , and was full of the idea of [[his]1817-a boy , who looked about five years old mother]1818-his mother , spying in the crowd [a woman whose face attracted [him]1817-a boy , who looked about five years old]1819-a woman whose face attracted him , threw [himself]1817-a boy , who looked about five years old upon [her]1819-a woman whose face attracted him from [his]1817-a boy , who looked about five years old antelope , and clung about [her]1819-a woman whose face attracted him neck ; nor was [she]1819-a woman whose face attracted him slow to return [his]1817-a boy , who looked about five years old embrace and kisses . But the hand of [a man]109-a man came over [her]1819-a woman whose face attracted him shoulder , and seized [him]1817-a boy , who looked about five years old by the neck . Instantly [a girl]3101-a girl ran [her]3101-a girl sharp spear into [the fellow]1822-the fellow 's arm . [He]1822-the fellow sent forth a savage howl , and immediately stabbed by [two or three more]1823-two or three more , fled yelling . " [They]3636-they are just [bad giants]708-bad giants ! "[44-lona] said [Lona]44-lona , [her]44-lona eyes flashing as [she]44-lona drove [her]44-lona horse against one of unusual height who , having stirred up the little manhood in [him]1822-the fellow , stood barring [her]44-lona way with a club . [He]1822-the fellow dared not abide the shock , but slunk aside , and the next moment went down , struck by several stones . [Another huge fellow]1824-another huge fellow , avoiding [[my]0-i charger]1825-my charger , stepped suddenly , with a speech whose rudeness alone was intelligible , between [me]0-i and [the boy who rode behind [me]0-i]1826-the boy who rode behind me . [The boy]1262-the boy told [him]1824-another huge fellow to address [the king]1828-the king ; [the giant]1656-the giant struck [his]1656-the giant little horse on the head with a hammer , and [he]1656-the giant fell . Before [the brute]1095-the brute could strike again , however , one of the elephants behind laid [him]1656-the giant prostrate , and trampled on [him]1656-the giant so that [he]1656-the giant did not attempt to get up until hundreds of feet had walked over [him]1656-the giant , and [the army]1831-the army was gone by . But at sight of [the women]627-the women what a dismay clouded the face of [Lona]44-lona ! Hardly one of [them]627-the women was even pleasant to look upon ! Were [[her]44-lona darlings]1833-her darlings to find [mothers among such as these]1834-mothers among such as these ? Hardly had [we]1835-we halted in [the central square]1836-the central square , when [two girls]1837-two girls rode up in anxious haste , with the tidings that [two of [the boys]3021-the boys]1838-two of the boys had been hurried away by [some women]1840-some women . [We]1835-we turned at once , and then first discovered that [the woman [we]1835-we befriended]1841-the woman we befriended had disappeared with [[her]1841-the woman we befriended baby]757-her baby . But at the same moment [we]1835-we descried a white leopardess come bounding toward [us]1835-we down [a narrow lane that led from [the square]1226-the square to [the palace]3135-the palace]1843-a narrow lane that led from the square to the palace . [The Little Ones]633-the little ones had not forgotten the fight of [the two leopardesses]1847-the two leopardesses in [the forest]314-the forest : some of [them]633-the little ones looked terrified , and [their]633-the little ones ranks began to waver ; but [they]633-the little ones remembered the order [I]0-i had just given [them]633-the little ones , and stood fast . [We]1835-we stopped to see the result ; when suddenly [a small boy]1849-a small boy , called [Odu]77-odu , remarkable for [his]77-odu speed and courage , who had heard [me]0-i speak of the goodness of [the white leopardess]1261-the white leopardess , leaped from the back of [his]1849-a small boy bear , which went shambling after [him]1849-a small boy , and ran to meet [her]1261-the white leopardess . [The leopardess]3280-the leopardess , to avoid knocking [him]1849-a small boy down , pulled [herself]3280-the leopardess up so suddenly that [she]3280-the leopardess went rolling over and over : when [she]3280-the leopardess recovered [her]3280-the leopardess feet [she]3280-the leopardess found [the child]698-the child on [her]3280-the leopardess back . Who could doubt the subjugation of [a people which saw an urchin of the enemy]1853-a people which saw an urchin of the enemy bestride an animal of which [they]1853-a people which saw an urchin of the enemy lived in daily terror ? Confident of the effect on [the whole army]1854-the whole army , [we]1855-we rode on . As [we]1855-we stopped at [the house to which [[our]1855-we guides]1857-our guides led [us]1855-we]1856-the house to which our guides led us , [we]1855-we heard a scream ; [I]0-i sprang down , and thundered at the door . [My]0-i horse came and pushed [me]0-i away with [his]1858-his nose , turned about , and had begun to batter the door with [his]1858-his heels , when up came [little Odu]77-odu on [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess , and at sight of [her]3280-the leopardess [he]77-odu stood still , trembling . But [she]3280-the leopardess too had heard the cry , and forgetting [the child]698-the child on [her]3280-the leopardess back , threw [herself]3280-the leopardess at the door ; [the boy]1262-the boy was dashed against it , and fell senseless . Before [I]0-i could reach [him]1262-the boy , [Lona]44-lona had [him]1262-the boy in [her]44-lona arms , and as soon as [he]1262-the boy came to [himself]1262-the boy , set [him]1262-the boy on the back of [his]1262-the boy bear , which had still followed [him]1262-the boy . When [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess threw [herself]3280-the leopardess the third time against the door , it gave way , and [she]3280-the leopardess darted in . [We]1863-we followed , but [she]3280-the leopardess had already vanished . [We]1863-we sprang up a stair , and went all over [the house]112-the house , to find [no one]134-no one . Darting down again , [we]1863-we spied a door under the stair , and got into [a labyrinth of excavations]1866-a labyrinth of excavations . [We]1863-we had not gone far , however , when [we]1863-we met [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess with [the child [we]1863-we sought across [her]3280-the leopardess back]1868-the child we sought across her back . [He]1262-the boy told [us]1863-we that [the woman [he]1262-the boy took for [[his]1262-the boy mother]1818-his mother]1869-the woman he took for his mother threw [him]1262-the boy into a hole , saying [she]1869-the woman he took for his mother would give [him]1262-the boy to [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess . But [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess was [a good one]1873-a good one , and took [him]1262-the boy out . Following in search of [the other boy]1874-the other boy , [we]1863-we got into [the next house]1875-the next house more easily , but to find , alas , that [we]1863-we were too late : [one of [the savages]972-the savages]1876-one of the savages had just killed [the little captive]1878-the little captive ! It consoled [Lona]44-lona , however , to learn which [he]1262-the boy was , for [she]44-lona had been expecting [him]1262-the boy to grow a bad giant , from which worst of fates death had saved [him]1262-the boy . [The leopardess]3280-the leopardess sprang upon [[his]1262-the boy murderer]1880-his murderer , took [him]1262-the boy by the throat , dragged [him]1262-the boy into [the street]1192-the street , and followed [Lona]44-lona with [him]1262-the boy , like a cat with a great rat in [her]3280-the leopardess jaws . " Let [us]1885-we leave [the horrible place]3638-the horrible place , "[44-lona] said [Lona]44-lona ; " there are [no mothers]3639-no mothers [here]2675-here ! [This people]3641-this people is not worth delivering . "[44-lona] [The leopardess]3280-the leopardess dropped [her]3280-the leopardess burden , and charged into the crowd , this way and that , wherever it was thickest . [The slaves]1883-the slaves cried out and ran , tumbling over [each other in heaps]1884-each other in heaps . When [we]1885-we got back to [the army]1831-the army , [we]1885-we found it as [we]1885-we had left [it]1831-the army , standing in order and ready . But [I]0-i was far from easy : [the princess]3100-the princess gave no sign , and what [she]3100-the princess might be plotting [we]1885-we did not know ! Watch and ward must be kept the night through ! [The Little Ones]47-the little ones were such hardy creatures that [they]47-the little ones could repose anywhere : [we]1885-we told [them]47-the little ones to lie down with [their]47-the little ones animals where [they]47-the little ones were , and sleep till [they]47-the little ones were called . In one moment [they]47-the little ones were down , and in another lapt in the music of [their]47-the little ones sleep , a sound as of water over grass , or a soft wind among leaves . [Their]47-the little ones animals slept more lightly , ever on the edge of waking . [The bigger boys]727-the bigger boys and [girls]1506-girls walked softly hither and thither among [the dreaming multitude]1890-the dreaming multitude . All was still ; [the whole wicked place]1891-the whole wicked place appeared at rest . [LONA]44-lona was so disgusted with [the people]1168-the people , and especially with [the women]627-the women , that [she]44-lona wished to abandon [the place]2672-the place as soon as possible ; [I]0-i , on the contrary , felt very strongly that to do so would be to fail wilfully where success was possible ; and , far worse , to weaken the hearts of [the Little Ones]47-the little ones , and so bring [them]47-the little ones into much greater danger . If [we]1885-we retreated , it was certain [the princess]3100-the princess would not leave [us]1885-we unassailed ! if [we]1885-we encountered [her]3100-the princess , the hope of the prophecy went with [us]1885-we ! [Mother]1760-mother and [daughter]1897-daughter must meet : it might be that [Lona]44-lona 's loveliness would take [Lilith]66-lilith 's heart by storm ! if [she]44-lona threatened violence , [I]0-i should be there between [them]1898-them ! If [I]0-i found that [I]0-i had no other power over [her]3100-the princess , [I]0-i was ready , for the sake of [[my]0-i Lona]1512-my lona , to strike [her]3100-the princess pitilessly on the closed hand ! [I]0-i knew [she]3100-the princess was doomed : most likely it was decreed that [her]3100-the princess doom should now be brought to pass through [us]1885-we ! Still without hint of the relation in which [she]3100-the princess stood to [the princess]3100-the princess , [I]0-i stated the case to [Lona]44-lona as it appeared to [me]0-i . At once [she]3100-the princess agreed to accompany [me]0-i to [the palace]3135-the palace . From the top of one of [[its]3135-the palace great towers]1902-its great towers , [the princess]3100-the princess had , in the early morning , while [the city]3099-the city yet slept , descried the approach of [the army of [the Little Ones]47-the little ones]1905-the army of the little ones . The sight awoke in [her]3100-the princess an over - mastering terror : [she]3100-the princess had failed in [her]3100-the princess endeavour to destroy [them]1906-them , and [they]1906-them were upon [her]3100-the princess ! The prophecy was about to be fulfilled ! When [she]3100-the princess came to [herself]3100-the princess , [she]3100-the princess descended to [the black hall]3411-the black hall , and seated [herself]3100-the princess in the north focus of the ellipse , under the opening in the roof . For [she]3100-the princess must think ! Now what [she]3100-the princess called thinking required a clear consciousness of [herself]3100-the princess , not as [she]3100-the princess was , but as [she]3100-the princess chose to believe [herself]3100-the princess ; and to aid [her]3100-the princess in the realisation of this consciousness , [she]3100-the princess had suspended , a little way from and above [her]3100-the princess , itself invisible in the darkness of [the hall]185-the hall , a mirror to receive the full sunlight reflected from [her]3100-the princess person . For the resulting vision of [herself]3100-the princess in the splendour of [her]3100-the princess beauty , [she]3100-the princess sat waiting the meridional sun . Many a shadow moved about [her]3100-the princess in the darkness , but as often as , with a certain inner eye which [she]3100-the princess had , [she]3100-the princess caught sight of one , [she]3100-the princess refused to regard it . Close under the mirror stood the Shadow which attended [her]3100-the princess walks , but , self - occupied , [him]1909-him [she]3100-the princess did not see . [The city]3099-the city was taken ; [the inhabitants]3122-the inhabitants were cowering in terror ; [the Little Ones]47-the little ones and [[their]47-the little ones strange cavalry]1912-their strange cavalry were encamped in [the square]1226-the square ; the sun shone upon [the princess]3100-the princess , and for a few minutes [she]3100-the princess saw [herself]3100-the princess glorious . The vision passed , but [she]3100-the princess sat on . The night was now come , and darkness clothed and filled the glass , yet [she]3100-the princess did not move . A gloom that swarmed with shadows , wallowed in [the palace]3135-the palace ; [the servants]179-the servants shivered and shook , but dared not leave it because of the beasts of [the Little Ones]47-the little ones ; all night long [the princess]3100-the princess sat motionless ; [she]3100-the princess must see [her]3100-the princess beauty again ! [she]3100-the princess must try again to think ! But courage and will had grown weary of [her]3100-the princess , and would dwell with [her]3100-the princess no more ! In the morning [we]1918-we chose [twelve of the tallest and bravest of [the boys]3021-the boys]1919-twelve of the tallest and bravest of the boys to go with [us]1918-we to [the palace]3135-the palace . [We]1918-we rode [our]1918-we great horses , and [they]1922-they small horses and elephants . [The princess]3100-the princess sat waiting the sun to give [her]3100-the princess the joy of [her]3100-the princess own presence . The tide of the light was creeping up the shore of the sky , but until the sun stood overhead , [not a ray]1924-not a ray could enter [the black hall]3411-the black hall . [He]1926-he rose to [our]1918-we eyes , and swiftly ascended . As [we]1918-we climbed the steep way to [the palace]3135-the palace , [he]1926-he climbed the dome of [[its]3135-the palace great hall]1928-its great hall . [He]1926-he looked in at the eye of it — and with sudden radiance [the princess]3100-the princess flashed upon [her]3100-the princess own sight . But [she]3100-the princess sprang to [her]3100-the princess feet with a cry of despair : alas [her]3100-the princess whiteness ! the spot covered half [her]3100-the princess side , and was black as the marble around [her]3100-the princess ! [She]3100-the princess clutched [her]3100-the princess robe , and fell back in [her]3100-the princess chair . [The Shadow]1160-the shadow glided out , and [she]3100-the princess saw [him]1926-he go . [We]1918-we found the gate open as usual , passed through [the paved grove]1931-the paved grove up to [the palace]3135-the palace door , and entered [the vestibule]3419-the vestibule . There in [her]3100-the princess cage lay the spotted leopardess , apparently asleep or lifeless . [The Little Ones]47-the little ones paused a moment to look at [her]3100-the princess . [She]3100-the princess leaped up rampant against the cage . The horses reared and plunged ; the elephants retreated a step . The next instant [she]3100-the princess fell supine , writhed in quivering spasms , and lay motionless . [We]1918-we rode into [the great hall]447-the great hall . [The princess]3100-the princess yet leaned back in [her]3100-the princess chair in the shaft of sunlight , when from the stones of [the court]3472-the court came to [her]3100-the princess ears the noise of the horses ' hoofs . [She]3100-the princess started , listened , and shook : never had such sound been heard in [[her]3100-the princess palace]1937-her palace ! [She]3100-the princess pressed [her]3100-the princess hand to [her]3100-the princess side , and gasped . The trampling came nearer and nearer ; it entered [the hall]185-the hall itself ; [moving figures that were not shadows]1939-moving figures that were not shadows approached [her]3100-the princess through the darkness ! For [us]1918-we , [we]1918-we saw a splendour , [a glorious woman centring the dark]1940-a glorious woman centring the dark . [Lona]44-lona sprang from [her]44-lona horse , and bounded to [her]44-lona . [I]0-i sprang from [mine]0-i , and followed [Lona]44-lona . " [Mother]1760-mother ! [mother]1760-mother ! "[44-lona] [she]44-lona cried , and [her]44-lona clear , lovely voice echoed in the dome . [The princess]3100-the princess shivered ; [her]3100-the princess face grew almost black with hate , [her]3100-the princess eyebrows met on [her]3100-the princess forehead . [She]3100-the princess rose to [her]3100-the princess feet , and stood . " [Mother]1760-mother ! [mother]1760-mother ! "[44-lona] cried [Lona]44-lona again , as [she]44-lona leaped on the daïs , and flung [her]44-lona arms around [the princess]3100-the princess . An instant more and [I]0-i should have reached them!—in that instant [I]0-i saw [Lona]44-lona lifted high , and dashed on the marble floor . Oh , the horrible sound of [her]44-lona fall ! At [my]0-i feet [she]44-lona fell , and lay still . [The princess]3100-the princess sat down with the smile of [a demoness]1944-a demoness . [I]0-i dropped on [my]0-i knees beside [Lona]44-lona , raised [her]44-lona from the stones , and pressed [her]44-lona to [my]0-i bosom . With indignant hate [I]0-i glanced at [the princess]3100-the princess ; [she]3100-the princess answered [me]0-i with [her]3100-the princess sweetest smile . [I]0-i would have sprung upon [her]3100-the princess , taken [her]3100-the princess by the throat , and strangled [her]3100-the princess , but love of [the child]698-the child was stronger than hate of [the mother]1418-the mother , and [I]0-i clasped closer [my]0-i precious burden . [Her]3100-the princess arms hung helpless ; [her]3100-the princess blood trickled over [my]0-i hands , and fell on the floor with soft , slow little plashes . The horses scented it — [mine]0-i first , then [the small ones]1948-the small ones . [Mine]78-mine reared , shivering and wild - eyed , went about , and thundered blindly down [the dark hall]1949-the dark hall , with the little horses after [him]1950-him . [Lona]44-lona 's stood gazing down at [[his]1950-him mistress]1951-his mistress , and trembling all over . [The boys]3021-the boys flung [themselves]3021-the boys from [their]3021-the boys horses ' backs , and [they]3021-the boys , not seeing the black wall before [them]3021-the boys , dashed [themselves]3021-the boys , with mine , to pieces against it . The elephants came on to the foot of [the daïs]1953-the daïs , and stopped , wildly trumpeting ; [the Little Ones]47-the little ones sprang upon it , and stood horrified ; [the princess]3100-the princess lay back in [her]3100-the princess seat , [her]3100-the princess face that of a corpse , [her]3100-the princess eyes alone alive , wickedly flaming . [She]3100-the princess was again withered and wasted to what [I]0-i found in the wood , and [her]3100-the princess side was as if a great branding hand had been laid upon it . But [Lona]44-lona saw nothing , and [I]0-i saw but [Lona]44-lona . " [Mother]1760-mother ! [mother]1760-mother ! "[3100-the princess] [she]3100-the princess sighed , and [her]3100-the princess breathing ceased . [I]0-i carried [her]3100-the princess into [the court]3472-the court : the sun shone upon a white face , and the pitiful shadow of a ghostly smile . [Her]3100-the princess head hung back . [She]3100-the princess was " dead as earth . "[3100-the princess] [I]0-i forgot [the Little Ones]47-the little ones , forgot [the murdering princess]1956-the murdering princess , forgot the body in [my]0-i arms , and wandered away , looking for [[my]0-i [Lona]44-lona]1512-my lona . The doors and windows were crowded with brute - faces jeering at [me]0-i , but not daring to speak , for [they]47-the little ones saw the white leopardess behind [me]0-i , hanging [her]3100-the princess head close at [my]0-i heel . [I]0-i spurned [her]3100-the princess with [my]0-i foot . [She]3100-the princess held back a moment , and followed [me]0-i again . [I]0-i reached [the square]1226-the square : [the little army]1629-the little army was gone ! [Its]1629-the little army emptiness roused [me]0-i . Where were [the Little Ones]47-the little ones , [her]3100-the princess Little Ones ? [I]0-i had lost [[her]3100-the princess children]3152-her children ! [I]0-i stared helpless about [me]0-i , staggered to the pillar , and sank upon its base . But as [I]0-i sat gazing on the still countenance , it seemed to smile a live momentary smile . [I]0-i never doubted it an illusion , yet believed what it said : [I]0-i should yet see [her]3100-the princess alive ! It was not [she]3100-the princess , it was [I]0-i who was lost , and [she]3100-the princess would find [me]0-i ! [I]0-i rose to go after [the Little Ones]47-the little ones , and instinctively sought the gate by which [we]1961-we had entered . [I]0-i looked around [me]0-i , but saw nothing of [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess . [The street]1192-the street was rapidly filling with [a fierce crowd]1964-a fierce crowd . [They]47-the little ones saw [me]0-i encumbered with [my]0-i dead , but for a time dared not assail [me]0-i . Ere [I]0-i reached the gate , however , [they]47-the little ones had gathered courage . [The women]627-the women began to hustle [me]0-i ; [I]0-i held on heedless . [A man]109-a man pushed against [my]0-i sacred burden : with a kick [I]0-i sent [him]109-a man away howling . But [the crowd]1967-the crowd pressed upon [me]0-i , and fearing for the dead that was beyond hurt , [I]0-i clasped [my]0-i treasure closer , and freed [my]0-i right arm . That instant , however , a commotion arose in [the street]1192-the street behind [me]0-i ; [the crowd]1967-the crowd broke ; and through it came [the Little Ones [I]0-i had left in [the palace]3135-the palace]1970-the little ones i had left in the palace . Ten of [them]1970-the little ones i had left in the palace were upon four of the elephants ; on [the two other elephants]1972-the two other elephants lay [the princess]3100-the princess , bound hand and foot , and quite still , save that [her]3100-the princess eyes rolled in [their]1972-the two other elephants ghastly sockets . [I]0-i walked on in front , and out of [the city]3099-the city . What an end to the hopes with which [I]0-i entered [the evil place]1977-the evil place ! [We]1978-we had captured [the bad princess]1979-the bad princess , and lost [[our]1978-we all - beloved queen]1980-our all - beloved queen ! [My]0-i life was bare ! [my]0-i heart was empty ! A MURMUR of pleasure from [[my]0-i companions]1981-my companions roused [me]0-i : [they]1981-my companions had caught sight of [[their]1981-my companions fellows]1982-their fellows in the distance ! The two on [Lona]44-lona 's horse rode on to join [them]1981-my companions . [They]1981-my companions were greeted with a wavering shout — which immediately died away . As [we]1978-we drew near , the sound of [their]1981-my companions sobs reached [us]1978-we like the breaking of tiny billows . When [I]0-i came among [them]1981-my companions , [I]0-i saw that something dire had befallen [them]1981-my companions : on [their]1981-my companions childish faces was the haggard look left by some strange terror . No possible grief could have wrought the change . [A few of [them]1981-my companions]1983-a few of them came slowly round [me]0-i , and held out [their]1983-a few of them arms to take [my]0-i burden . [I]0-i yielded it ; the tender hopelessness of the smile with which [they]1983-a few of them received it , made [my]0-i heart swell with pity in the midst of its own desolation . In vain were [their]1983-a few of them sobs over [[their]1983-a few of them mother]660-their mother - queen ; in vain [they]1983-a few of them sought to entice from [her]660-their mother some recognition of [their]1983-a few of them love ; in vain [they]1983-a few of them kissed and fondled [her]660-their mother as [they]1983-a few of them bore [her]660-their mother away : [she]660-their mother would not wake ! On each side one carried an arm , gently stroking it ; [as many as could get near]1985-as many as could get near , put [their]1985-as many as could get near arms under [her]660-their mother body ; [those who could not ,]1986-those who could not , crowded around [the bearers]1987-the bearers . [Those next [me]0-i]1992-those next me caught sight of [the princess]3100-the princess , and stared trembling . [Odu]77-odu was the first to speak .
