" Even now is [his]92-the shadow head under [my]59-eve heel ! "[59-eve] The dim light in [Adam]58-adam 's hand glimmered on the sleeping faces , and as [he]58-adam went on , the darkness closed over [them]2276-them . The very air seemed dead : was it because none of [the sleepers]428-the sleepers breathed it ? Profoundest sleep filled [the wide place]2278-the wide place . It was as if [not one]568-not one had waked since last [I]0-i was there , for the forms [I]0-i had then noted lay there still . [[My]0-i father]105-my father was just as [I]0-i had left [him]105-my father , save that [he]105-my father seemed yet nearer to a perfect peace . [The woman beside [him]105-my father]2281-the woman beside him looked younger . The darkness , the cold , the silence , the still air , the faces of the lovely dead , made the hearts of [the children]2965-the children beat softly , but [their]2965-the children little tongues would talk — with low , hushed voices . " What a curious place to sleep in ! "[2690-one] said [one]2690-one , " [I]2690-one would rather be in [[my]2690-one nest]3585-my nest ! "[2690-one] " It is so cold ! "[603-another] said [another]603-another . " Yes , it is cold , "[2286-our host] answered [[our]2285-we host]2286-our host ; " but [you]0-i will not be cold in [your]0-i sleep . "[2286-our host] " Where are [[our]2285-we nests]3599-our nests ? "[2690-one] asked more than one , looking round and seeing no couch unoccupied . " Find places , and sleep where [you]0-i choose , "[58-adam] replied [Adam]58-adam . Instantly [they]2965-the children scattered , advancing fearlessly beyond the light , but [we]2285-we still heard [their]2965-the children gentle voices , and it was plain [they]2965-the children saw where [I]0-i could not . " Oh , "[2690-one] cried [one]2690-one , " here is such a beautiful lady!—may [I]2690-one sleep beside [her]951-the lady ? [I]2690-one will creep in quietly , and not wake [her]951-the lady . "[2690-one] " Yes , [you]59-eve may , "[59-eve] answered the voice of [Eve]59-eve behind [us]2285-we ; and [we]2285-we came to the couch while [the little fellow]2288-the little fellow was yet creeping slowly and softly under the sheet . [He]2288-the little fellow laid [his]2288-the little fellow head beside [the lady]951-the lady 's , looked up at [us]2285-we , and was still . [His]2288-the little fellow eyelids fell ; [he]2288-the little fellow was asleep . [We]2285-we went a little farther , and there was another who had climbed up on the couch of [a woman]344-a woman . " [Mother]85-mother ! [mother]1760-mother ! "[2288-the little fellow] [he]2288-the little fellow cried , kneeling over [her]344-a woman , [his]2288-the little fellow face close to [hers]344-a woman . " — [She]344-a woman 's so cold [she]344-a woman ca n't speak , "[2288-the little fellow] [he]2288-the little fellow said , looking up to [us]2285-we ; " but [I]2288-the little fellow will soon make [her]344-a woman warm ! "[2288-the little fellow] [He]2288-the little fellow lay down , and pressing close to [her]344-a woman , put [his]2288-the little fellow little arm over [her]344-a woman . In an instant [he]2288-the little fellow too was asleep , smiling an absolute content . [We]2285-we came to [a third Little One]2291-a third little one ; it was [Luva]81-luva . [She]81-luva stood on tiptoe , leaning over the edge of a couch . " [[My]81-luva own mother]3823-my own mother would n't have [me]81-luva , "[81-luva] [she]81-luva said softly : " will [you]59-eve ? "[81-luva] Receiving no reply , [she]81-luva looked up at [Eve]59-eve . [The great mother]2292-the great mother lifted [her]81-luva to the couch , and [she]81-luva got at once under the snowy covering . [Each of [the Little Ones]633-the little ones]2293-each of the little ones had by this time , except [three of [the boys]3021-the boys]2295-three of the boys , found at least an unobjecting bedfellow , and lay still and white beside [a still , white woman]2297-a still , white woman . [The little orphans]2298-the little orphans had adopted [mothers]3013-mothers ! [One tiny girl]2300-one tiny girl had chosen [a father to sleep with]2301-a father to sleep with , and that was [mine]2302-mine . [A boy]1600-a boy lay by the side of [the beautiful matron with the slow - healing hand]2304-the beautiful matron with the slow - healing hand . On the middle one of the three couches hitherto unoccupied , lay [Lona]44-lona . [Eve]59-eve set [Lilith]66-lilith down beside [it]44-lona . [Adam]58-adam pointed to [the vacant couch on [Lona]44-lona 's right hand]2305-the vacant couch on lona 's right hand , and said , " There , [Lilith]66-lilith , is the bed [I]58-adam have prepared for [you]66-lilith ! "[58-adam] [She]59-eve glanced at [[her]59-eve daughter]1405-her daughter lying before [her]59-eve like a statue carved in semi - transparent alabaster , and shuddered from head to foot . " How cold it is ! "[59-eve] [she]59-eve murmured . " [You]66-lilith will soon begin to find comfort in the cold , "[58-adam] answered [Adam]58-adam . " Promises to [the dying]3824-the dying are easy ! "[59-eve] [she]59-eve said . " But [I]59-eve know it : [I]59-eve too have slept . [I]59-eve am dead ! "[59-eve] " [I]44-lona believed [you]66-lilith dead long ago ; but [I]44-lona see [you]66-lilith alive ! "[44-lona] " More alive than [you]66-lilith know , or are able to understand . [I]44-lona was scarce alive when first [you]66-lilith knew [me]44-lona . Now [I]44-lona have slept , and am awake ; [I]44-lona am dead , and live indeed ! "[44-lona] " [I]59-eve fear [that child]3825-that child , "[59-eve] [she]59-eve said , pointing to [Lona]44-lona : " [she]3825-that child will rise and terrify [me]59-eve ! "[59-eve] " [She]3825-that child is dreaming love to [you]66-lilith . "[44-lona] " But [the Shadow]92-the shadow ! "[59-eve] [she]59-eve moaned ; " [I]59-eve fear [the Shadow]92-the shadow ! [he]92-the shadow will be wroth with [me]59-eve ! "[59-eve] " [He]92-the shadow at sight of whom the horses of heaven start and rear , dares not disturb one dream in [this quiet chamber]3826-this quiet chamber ! "[44-lona] " [I]44-lona shall dream then ? "[44-lona] " [You]44-lona will dream . "[59-eve] " What dreams ? "[44-lona] " That [I]44-lona can not tell , but none [he]92-the shadow can enter into . When [the Shadow]92-the shadow comes here , it will be to lie down and sleep also.—His hour will come , and [he]92-the shadow knows it will . "[44-lona] " How long shall [I]59-eve sleep ? "[59-eve] " [You]44-lona and [he]92-the shadow will be the last to wake in the morning of [the universe]266-the universe . "[44-lona] [The princess]3100-the princess lay down , drew the sheet over [her]3100-the princess , stretched [herself]3100-the princess out straight , and lay still with open eyes . [Adam]58-adam turned to [[his]58-adam daughter]2308-his daughter . [She]2308-his daughter drew near . " [Lilith]66-lilith , "[36-mara] said [Mara]36-mara , " [you]66-lilith will not sleep , if [you]66-lilith lie there a thousand years , until [you]66-lilith have opened [your]66-lilith hand , and yielded that which is not [yours]66-lilith to give or to withhold . "[36-mara] " [I]2308-his daughter can not , "[2308-his daughter] [she]2308-his daughter answered . " [I]2308-his daughter would if [I]2308-his daughter could , and gladly , for [I]2308-his daughter am weary , and the shadows of death are gathering about [me]2308-his daughter . "[2308-his daughter] " [They]3828-they will gather and gather , but [they]3828-they can not infold [you]66-lilith while yet [your]66-lilith hand remains unopened . [You]66-lilith may think [you]66-lilith are dead , but it will be only a dream ; [you]66-lilith may think [you]66-lilith have come awake , but it will still be only a dream . Open [your]66-lilith hand , and [you]66-lilith will sleep indeed — then wake indeed . "[36-mara] " [I]36-mara am trying hard , but the fingers have grown together and into the palm . "[36-mara] " [I]2308-his daughter pray [you]66-lilith put forth the strength of [your]66-lilith will . For the love of life , draw together [your]66-lilith forces and break its bonds ! "[2308-his daughter] " [I]36-mara have struggled in vain ; [I]36-mara can do no more . [I]36-mara am very weary , and sleep lies heavy upon [my]36-mara lids . "[36-mara] " The moment [you]66-lilith open [your]66-lilith hand , [you]66-lilith will sleep . Open it , and make an end . "[2308-his daughter] A tinge of colour arose in the parchment - like face ; the contorted hand trembled with agonised effort . [Mara]36-mara took it , and sought to aid [her]36-mara . " Hold , [Mara]36-mara ! "[2015-her father] cried [[her]36-mara father]2015-her father . " There is danger ! "[2015-her father] [The princess]3100-the princess turned [her]3100-the princess eyes upon [Eve]59-eve , beseechingly . " There was a sword [I]3100-the princess once saw in [[your]59-eve husband]3817-your husband 's hands , "[3100-the princess] [she]3100-the princess murmured . " [I]3100-the princess fled when [I]3100-the princess saw it . [I]3100-the princess heard [him]3817-your husband who bore it say it would divide whatever was not one and indivisible ! "[3100-the princess] " [I]58-adam have the sword , "[58-adam] said [Adam]58-adam . " [The angel]3830-the angel gave it [me]58-adam when [he]3817-your husband left the gate . "[58-adam] " Bring it , [Adam]58-adam , "[66-lilith] pleaded [Lilith]66-lilith , " and cut [me]66-lilith off this hand that [I]66-lilith may sleep . "[66-lilith] " [I]58-adam will , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam answered . [He]58-adam gave the candle to [Eve]59-eve , and went . [The princess]3100-the princess closed [her]3100-the princess eyes . In a few minutes [Adam]58-adam returned with an ancient weapon in [his]58-adam hand . The scabbard looked like vellum grown dark with years , but the hilt shone like gold that nothing could tarnish . [He]58-adam drew out the blade . It flashed like a pale blue northern streamer , and the light of it made [the princess]3100-the princess open [her]3100-the princess eyes . [She]3100-the princess saw the sword , shuddered , and held out [her]3100-the princess hand . [Adam]58-adam took it . The sword gleamed once , there was one little gush of blood , and [he]58-adam laid the severed hand in [Mara]36-mara 's lap . [Lilith]66-lilith had given one moan , and was already fast asleep . [Mara]36-mara covered the arm with the sheet , and [the three]2313-the three turned away . " Will [you]58-adam not dress the wound ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " A wound from that sword , "[58-adam] answered [Adam]58-adam , " needs no dressing . [It]3831-it is healing and not hurt . "[58-adam] " [Poor lady]3832-poor lady ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [she]3832-poor lady will wake with but one hand ! "[0-i] " Where the dead deformity clung , "[36-mara] replied [Mara]36-mara , " the true , lovely hand is already growing . "[36-mara] [We]2314-we heard a childish voice behind [us]2314-we , and turned again . The candle in [Eve]59-eve 's hand shone on the sleeping face of [Lilith]66-lilith , and the waking faces of [the three Little Ones]2315-the three little ones , grouped on the other side of [her]59-eve couch . " How beautiful [she]3832-poor lady is grown ! "[2315-the three little ones] said one of [them]2315-the three little ones . " [Poor princess]3833-poor princess ! " [She]3832-poor lady shall have two to kiss [her]3832-poor lady when [she]3832-poor lady wakes ! "[2317-the third] " And [I]639-the first am left alone ! "[639-the first] said [the first]639-the first mournfully . " [I]59-eve will put [you]698-the child to bed , "[59-eve] said [Eve]59-eve . [I]0-i was very sad , for [no one]134-no one had offered [me]0-i a place in [the house of the dead]3506-the house of the dead . [Eve]59-eve joined [us]2321-we as [we]2321-we went , and walked on before with [[her]59-eve husband]350-her husband . "[59-eve] [we]2321-we heard [Eve]59-eve say as [we]2321-we stepped into [the cottage]340-the cottage . The door stood open ; two elephant - trunks came through [it]2327-it out of the night beyond . " [I]59-eve sent [them]3834-them with the lantern , "[59-eve] [she]59-eve went on to [[her]59-eve husband]350-her husband , " to look for [[Mara]36-mara 's leopardess]3835-mara 's leopardess : [they]3834-them have brought [her]2329-her . "[59-eve] [I]0-i followed [Adam]58-adam to the door , and between [us]2321-we [we]2321-we took the white creature from the elephants , and carried [her]2329-her to [the chamber [we]2321-we had just left]2330-the chamber we had just left , [the women preceding [us]2321-we]2331-the women preceding us , [Eve]59-eve with the light , and [Mara]36-mara still carrying the hand . There [we]2321-we laid the beauty across the feet of [the princess]3100-the princess , [her]3100-the princess fore paws outstretched , and [her]3100-the princess head couching between [them]2333-them . THEN [I]0-i turned and said to [Eve]59-eve , " [Mother]85-mother , [one couch next to [Lona]44-lona]3836-one couch next to lona is empty : [I]0-i know [I]0-i am unworthy , but may [I]0-i not sleep this night in [[your]85-mother chamber]3837-your chamber with [[my]0-i dead]3838-my dead ? Will [you]85-mother not pardon both [my]0-i cowardice and [my]0-i self - confidence , and take [me]0-i in ? [I]0-i give [me]0-i up . [I]0-i am sick of [myself]0-i , and would fain sleep the sleep ! "[0-i] " [The couch next to [Lona]44-lona]3839-the couch next to lona is the one already prepared for [you]0-i , "[2334-she] [she]2334-she answered ; " but something waits to be done ere [you]0-i sleep . "[2334-she] " [I]0-i am ready , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " How do [you]0-i know [you]0-i can do it ? "[2334-she] [she]2334-she asked with a smile . " Because [you]2334-she require it , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " What is it ? "[2334-she] [She]2334-she turned to [Adam]58-adam : " Is [he]58-adam forgiven , [husband]2824-husband ? "[2334-she] " From [my]2334-she heart . "[2334-she] " Then tell [him]58-adam what [he]58-adam has to do . "[58-adam] [Adam]58-adam turned to [[his]58-adam daughter]2308-his daughter . " Give [me]2334-she that hand , [Mara]36-mara , [[my]2334-she child]3715-my child . "[2334-she] [She]2334-she held it out to [him]58-adam in [her]2334-she lap . [He]58-adam took it tenderly . " Let [us]2336-us go to [the cottage]340-the cottage , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam said to [me]0-i ; " there [I]58-adam will instruct [you]0-i . "[58-adam] As [we]2336-us went , again arose a sudden stormful blast , mingled with a great flapping on the roof , but it died away as before in a deep moan . When the door of [the death - chamber]2337-the death - chamber was closed behind [us]2336-us , [Adam]58-adam seated [himself]58-adam , and [I]0-i stood before [him]58-adam . " [You]0-i will remember , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam said , " how , after leaving [[[my]58-adam daughter]3670-my daughter 's house]3844-my daughter 's house , [you]0-i came to [a dry rock]3845-a dry rock , bearing the marks of an ancient cataract ; [you]0-i climbed that rock , and found [a sandy desert]3846-a sandy desert : go to that rock now , and from [its]3845-a dry rock summit walk deep into [the desert]3065-the desert . But go not many steps ere [you]0-i lie down , and listen with [your]0-i head on [the sand]3848-the sand . If [you]0-i hear the murmur of water beneath , go a little farther , and listen again . If [you]0-i still hear the sound , [you]0-i are in the right direction . Every few yards [you]0-i must stop , lie down , and hearken . If , listening thus , at any time [you]0-i hear no sound of water , [you]0-i are out of the way , and must hearken in every direction until [you]0-i hear it again . Keeping with the sound , and careful not to retrace [your]0-i steps , [you]0-i will soon hear it louder , and the growing sound will lead [you]0-i to where it is loudest : that is the spot [you]0-i seek . There dig with the spade [I]58-adam will give [you]0-i , and dig until [you]0-i come to moisture : in it lay the hand , cover it to the level of [the desert]3065-the desert , and come home.—But give good heed , and carry the hand with care . Never lay it down , in what place of seeming safety soever ; let nothing touch it ; stop nor turn aside for any attempt to bar [your]0-i way ; never look behind [you]0-i ; speak to [no one]134-no one , answer [no one]134-no one , walk straight on.—It is yet dark , and the morning is far distant , but [you]0-i must set out at once . "[58-adam] [He]2338-he gave [me]0-i the hand , and brought [me]0-i a spade . " This is [my]2338-he gardening spade , "[2338-he] [he]2338-he said ; " with it [I]2338-he have brought many a lovely thing to the sun . "[2338-he] [I]0-i took it , and went out into the night . It was very cold , and pitch - dark . To fall would be a dread thing , and the way [I]0-i had to go was a difficult one even in the broad sunlight ! But [I]0-i had not set [myself]0-i the task , and the minute [I]0-i started [I]0-i learned that [I]0-i was left to no chance : a pale light broke from the ground at every step , and showed [me]0-i where next to set [my]0-i foot . Through the heather and the low rocks [I]0-i walked without once even stumbling . [I]0-i found the bad burrow quite still ; not a wave arose , not a head appeared as [I]0-i crossed it . A moon came , and [herself]2339-herself showed [me]0-i the easy way : toward morning [I]0-i was almost over the dry channels of [the first branch of [the river - bed]554-the river - bed]2340-the first branch of the river - bed , and not far , [I]0-i judged , from [[Mara]36-mara 's cottage]2342-mara 's cottage . The moon was very low , and the sun not yet up , when [I]0-i saw before [me]0-i in the path , here narrowed by rocks , [a figure covered from head to foot as with a veil of moonlit mist]2343-a figure covered from head to foot as with a veil of moonlit mist . [I]0-i kept on [my]0-i way as if [I]0-i saw nothing . [The figure]2344-the figure threw aside its veil . " Have [you]0-i forgotten [me]3100-the princess already ? "[3100-the princess] said [the princess]3100-the princess — or what seemed [she]3100-the princess . [I]0-i neither hesitated nor answered ; [I]0-i walked straight on . " [You]3100-the princess meant then to leave [me]0-i in [that horrible sepulchre]3852-that horrible sepulchre ! Do [you]0-i not yet understand that where [I]0-i please to be , there [I]0-i am ? Take [my]0-i hand : [I]0-i am alive as [you]0-i ! "[0-i] [I]0-i was on the point of saying , " Give [me]0-i [your]3100-the princess left hand , "[0-i] but bethought [myself]0-i , held [my]0-i peace , and steadily advanced . " Give [me]3100-the princess [my]3100-the princess hand , "[3100-the princess] [she]3100-the princess suddenly shrieked , " or [I]3100-the princess will tear [you]0-i in pieces : [you]0-i are [mine]3100-the princess ! "[3100-the princess] [She]3100-the princess flung [herself]3100-the princess upon [me]0-i . [I]0-i shuddered , but did not falter . Nothing touched [me]0-i , and [I]0-i saw [her]3100-the princess no more . With measured tread along [the path]2346-the path , filling it for some distance , came a body of [armed men]2347-armed men . [I]0-i walked through [them]2347-armed men — nor know whether [they]2347-armed men gave way to [me]0-i , or were bodiless things . But [they]2347-armed men turned and followed [me]0-i ; [I]0-i heard and felt [their]2347-armed men march at [my]0-i very heels ; but [I]0-i cast no look behind , and the sound of [their]2347-armed men steps and the clash of [their]2347-armed men armour died away . A little farther on , the moon being now close to the horizon and the way in deep shadow , [I]0-i descried , seated where the path was so narrow that [I]0-i could not pass [her]3100-the princess , [a woman with muffled face]2348-a woman with muffled face . " Ah , "[3100-the princess] [she]3100-the princess said , " [you]0-i are come at last ! [I]3100-the princess have waited here for [you]0-i an hour or more ! [You]0-i have done well ! [Your]0-i trial is over . [[My]3100-the princess father]105-my father sent [me]3100-the princess to meet [you]0-i that [you]0-i might have a little rest on the way . Give [me]3100-the princess [your]0-i charge , and lay [your]0-i head in [my]3100-the princess lap ; [I]3100-the princess will take good care of both until the sun is well risen . [I]3100-the princess am not bitterness always , neither to [all men]1037-all men ! "[3100-the princess] [Her]3100-the princess words were terrible with temptation , for [I]0-i was very weary . And what more likely to be true ! If [I]0-i were , through slavish obedience to the letter of the command and lack of pure insight , to trample under [my]0-i feet [the very person of [the Lady of Sorrow]2182-the lady of sorrow]2349-the very person of the lady of sorrow ! [My]0-i heart grew faint at the thought , then beat as if it would burst [my]0-i bosom . Nevertheless [my]0-i will hardened itself against [my]0-i heart , and [my]0-i step did not falter . [I]0-i took [my]0-i tongue between [my]0-i teeth lest [I]0-i should unawares answer , and kept on [my]0-i way . If [Adam]58-adam had sent [her]3100-the princess , [he]58-adam could not complain that [I]0-i would not heed [her]3100-the princess ! Nor would [the Lady of Sorrow]2182-the lady of sorrow love [me]0-i the less that even [she]2182-the lady of sorrow had not been able to turn [me]0-i aside ! Just ere [I]0-i reached [the phantom]2352-the phantom , [she]3100-the princess pulled the covering from [her]3100-the princess face : great indeed was [her]3100-the princess loveliness , but those were not [Mara]36-mara 's eyes ! no lie could truly or for long imitate them ! [I]0-i advanced as if the thing were not there , and [my]0-i foot found [empty room]2353-empty room . [I]0-i had almost reached the other side when a Shadow — [I]0-i think it was [The Shadow]92-the shadow , barred [my]0-i way . [He]58-adam seemed to have a helmet upon [his]58-adam head , but as [I]0-i drew closer [I]0-i perceived it was the head itself [I]0-i saw — so distorted as to bear but a doubtful resemblance to [the human]2354-the human . A cold wind smote [me]0-i , dank and sickening — repulsive as the air of [a charnel - house]2355-a charnel - house ; firmness forsook [my]0-i joints , and [my]0-i limbs trembled as if they would drop in a helpless heap . [I]0-i seemed to pass through [him]58-adam , but [I]0-i think now that [he]58-adam passed through [me]0-i : for a moment [I]0-i was as [one of the damned]2356-one of the damned . Then a soft wind like the first breath of a new - born spring greeted [me]0-i , and before [me]0-i arose the dawn . [My]0-i way now led [me]0-i past the door of [[Mara]36-mara 's cottage]2342-mara 's cottage . [It]2358-it stood wide open , and upon the table [I]0-i saw a loaf of bread and a pitcher of water . In or around [the cottage]340-the cottage was neither howl nor wail . [I]0-i came to the precipice that testified to [the vanished river]2360-the vanished river . [I]0-i climbed its worn face , and went on into [the desert]3065-the desert . There at last , after much listening to and fro , [I]0-i determined the spot where the hidden water was loudest , hung [Lilith]66-lilith 's hand about [my]0-i neck , and began to dig . It was a long labour , for [I]0-i had to make a large hole because of the looseness of the sand ; but at length [I]0-i threw up a damp spadeful . [I]0-i flung the sexton - tool on the verge , and laid down the hand . A little water was already oozing from under its fingers . [I]0-i sprang out , and made haste to fill [the grave]1064-the grave . Then , utterly fatigued , [I]0-i dropped beside it , and fell asleep . WHEN [I]0-i woke , the ground was moist about [me]0-i , and [my]0-i track to [the grave]1064-the grave was growing a quicksand . In [its]2360-the vanished river ancient course [the river]853-the river was swelling , and had begun to shove at its burden . Soon it would be roaring down [the precipice]2365-the precipice , and , divided in its fall , rushing with one branch to resubmerge [the orchard valley]1490-the orchard valley , with the other to drown perhaps [the monster horde]2367-the monster horde , and between [them]2368-them to isle [the Evil Wood]5-the evil wood . [I]0-i set out at once on [my]0-i return to [those who sent [me]0-i]2369-those who sent me . When [I]0-i came to [the precipice]2365-the precipice , [I]0-i took [my]0-i way betwixt the branches , for [I]0-i would pass again by [the cottage of [Mara]36-mara]2371-the cottage of mara , lest [she]36-mara should have returned : [I]0-i longed to see [her]36-mara once more ere [I]0-i went to sleep ; and now [I]0-i knew where to cross [the channels]789-the channels , even if [the river]853-the river should have overtaken [me]0-i and filled them . But when [I]0-i reached [it]2374-it , the door stood open still ; the bread and the water were still on the table ; and deep silence was within and around it . [I]0-i stopped and called aloud at the door , but [no voice]2375-no voice replied , and [I]0-i went [my]0-i way . A little farther , [I]0-i came where sat [a grayheaded man on the sand]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand , weeping . " What ails [you]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand , [sir]2678-sir ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " Are [you]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand forsaken ? "[0-i] " [I]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand weep , "[2376-a grayheaded man on the sand] [he]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand answered , " because [they]3856-they will not let [me]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand die . [I]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand have been to [the house of death]793-the house of death , and [its mistress]3858-its mistress , notwithstanding [my]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand years , refuses [me]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand . Intercede for [me]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand , [sir]2678-sir , if [you]2678-sir know [her]3858-its mistress , [I]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand pray [you]2678-sir . "[2376-a grayheaded man on the sand] " Nay , [sir]2678-sir , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , " that [I]0-i can not ; for [she]3858-its mistress refuses none whom it is lawful for [her]3858-its mistress to receive . "[0-i] " How know [you]2678-sir this of [her]3858-its mistress ? [You]2678-sir have never sought death ! [you]2678-sir are much too young to desire it ! "[2376-a grayheaded man on the sand] " [I]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand fear [your]2678-sir words may indicate that , were [you]2678-sir young again , neither would [you]2678-sir desire it . "[2376-a grayheaded man on the sand] " Indeed , [young sir]3861-young sir , [I]0-i would not ! and certain [I]0-i am that [you]2678-sir can not . "[0-i] " [I]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand may not be old enough to desire to die , but [I]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand am young enough to desire to live indeed ! Therefore [I]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand go now to learn if [she]3858-its mistress will at length take [me]2376-a grayheaded man on the sand in . [You]2678-sir wish to die because [you]2678-sir do not care to live : [she]3858-its mistress will not open [her]3858-its mistress door to [you]2678-sir , for [no one]134-no one can die who does not long to live . "[2376-a grayheaded man on the sand] " It ill becomes [your]2678-sir youth to mock [a friendless old man]3863-a friendless old man . Pray , cease [your]2678-sir riddles ! "[2376-a grayheaded man on the sand] " Did not then [the Mother]1418-the mother tell [you]2678-sir something of the same sort ? "[0-i] " In truth [I]0-i believe [she]1418-the mother did ; but [I]0-i gave little heed to [her]1418-the mother excuses . "[0-i] " Ah , then , [sir]2678-sir , "[0-i] [I]0-i rejoined , " it is but too plain [you]2678-sir have not yet learned to die , and [I]0-i am heartily grieved for [you]2678-sir . Such had [I]0-i too been but for [the Lady of Sorrow]89-the lady of sorrow . [I]0-i am indeed young , but [I]0-i have wept many tears ; pardon [me]0-i , therefore , if [I]0-i presume to offer counsel:—Go to [the Lady of Sorrow]2182-the lady of sorrow , and ` take with both hands ' what [she]2182-the lady of sorrow will give [you]2678-sir . Yonder lies [[her]2182-the lady of sorrow cottage]3867-her cottage . [She]2182-the lady of sorrow is not in [it]3867-her cottage now , but [her]2182-the lady of sorrow door stands open , and there is bread and water on [her]2182-the lady of sorrow table . Go in ; sit down ; eat of the bread ; drink of the water ; and wait there until [she]2182-the lady of sorrow appear . Then ask counsel of [her]2182-the lady of sorrow , for [she]2182-the lady of sorrow is true , and [her]2182-the lady of sorrow wisdom is great . "[0-i] [He]2377-he fell to weeping afresh , and [I]0-i left [him]2377-he weeping . What [I]0-i said , [I]0-i fear [he]2377-he did not heed . But [Mara]36-mara would find [him]2377-he ! The sun was down , and the moon unrisen , when [I]0-i reached [the abode of the monsters]2378-the abode of the monsters , but it was still as a stone till [I]0-i passed over . Then [I]0-i heard a noise of many waters , and a great cry behind [me]0-i , but [I]0-i did not turn [my]0-i head . Ere [I]0-i reached [the house of death]793-the house of death , the cold was bitter and the darkness dense ; and the cold and the darkness were one , and entered into [my]0-i bones together . But the candle of [Eve]59-eve , shining from the window , guided [me]0-i , and kept both frost and murk from [my]0-i heart . The door stood open , and [the cottage]340-the cottage lay empty . [I]0-i sat down disconsolate . And as [I]0-i sat , there grew in [me]0-i such a sense of loneliness as never yet in [my]0-i wanderings had [I]0-i felt . [Thousands]3725-thousands were near [me]0-i , not one was with [me]0-i ! True , it was [I]0-i who was dead , not [they]3725-thousands ; but , whether by [their]3725-thousands life or by [my]0-i death , [we]2382-we were divided ! [They]3725-thousands were alive , but [I]0-i was not dead enough even to know [them]3725-thousands alive : doubt would come . [They]3725-thousands were , at best , far from [me]0-i , and [helpers]2383-helpers [I]0-i had none to lay [me]0-i beside [them]3725-thousands ! Never before had [I]0-i known , or truly imagined desolation ! In vain [I]0-i took [myself]0-i to task , saying the solitude was but a seeming : [I]0-i was awake , and [they]3725-thousands slept — that was all ! it was only that [they]3725-thousands lay so still and did not speak ! [they]3725-thousands were with [me]0-i now , and soon , soon [I]0-i should be with [them]3725-thousands ! [I]0-i dropped [Adam]58-adam 's old spade , and the dull sound of its fall on the clay floor seemed reverberated from [the chamber beyond]2384-the chamber beyond : a childish terror seized [me]0-i ; [I]0-i sat and stared at the coffin - door.—But [father [Adam]58-adam]2385-father adam , [mother]1760-mother [Eve]59-eve , [[sister]193-sister [Mara]36-mara]2388-sister mara would soon come to [me]0-i , and then — welcome the cold world and [the white neighbours]2389-the white neighbours ! [I]0-i forgot [my]0-i fears , lived a little , and loved [my]0-i dead . Something did move in the chamber of the dead ! There came from it what was like a dim , far - off sound , yet was not what [I]0-i knew as sound . [My]0-i soul sprang into [my]0-i ears . Was it a mere thrill of the dead air , too slight to be heard , but quivering in every spiritual sense ? [I]0-i knew without hearing , without feeling it ! The something was coming ! it drew nearer ! In the bosom of [my]0-i desertion awoke an infant hope . The noiseless thrill reached the coffin - door — became sound , and smote on [my]0-i ear . The door began to move — with a low , soft creaking of its hinges . It was opening ! [I]0-i ceased to listen , and stared expectant . It opened a little way , and a face came into the opening . It was [Lona]44-lona 's . [Its]44-lona eyes were closed , but the face itself was upon [me]0-i , and seemed to see [me]0-i . It was white as [Eve]59-eve 's , white as [Mara]36-mara 's , but did not shine like [their]2390-their faces . [She]44-lona spoke , and [her]44-lona voice was like a sleepy night - wind in the grass . " Are [you]0-i coming , [king]3570-king ? "[44-lona] it said . " [I]44-lona can not rest until [you]0-i are with [me]44-lona , gliding down [the river]853-the river to [the great sea]3870-the great sea , and [the beautiful dream - land]3871-the beautiful dream - land . The sleepiness is full of lovely things : come and see them . "[44-lona] " Ah , [[my]0-i darling]3283-my darling ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " Had [I]0-i but known!—I thought [you]44-lona were dead ! "[0-i] [She]44-lona lay on [my]0-i bosom — cold as ice frozen to marble . [She]44-lona threw [her]44-lona arms , so white , feebly about [me]0-i , and sighed—"Carry [me]44-lona back to [my]44-lona bed , [king]3570-king . [I]44-lona want to sleep . "[44-lona] [I]0-i bore [her]44-lona to [the death - chamber]2337-the death - chamber , holding [her]44-lona tight lest [she]44-lona should dissolve out of [my]0-i arms . Unaware that [I]0-i saw , [I]0-i carried [her]44-lona straight to [[her]44-lona couch]3805-her couch . " Lay [me]44-lona down , "[44-lona] [she]44-lona said , " and cover [me]44-lona from the warm air ; it hurts — a little . [Your]0-i bed is there , next to [mine]44-lona . [I]44-lona shall see [you]0-i when [I]44-lona wake . "[44-lona] [She]44-lona was already asleep . [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i on [my]0-i couch — blessed as never was [man]2682-man on the eve of [his]2682-man wedding . " Come , sweet cold , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " and still [my]0-i heart speedily . "[0-i] But there came instead a glimmer of light in [the chamber]208-the chamber , and [I]0-i saw the face of [Adam]58-adam approaching . [He]58-adam had not the candle , yet [I]0-i saw [him]58-adam . At the side of [Lona]44-lona 's couch , [he]58-adam looked down on [her]44-lona with a questioning smile , and then greeted [me]0-i across it . " [We]3874-we have been to [the top of [the hill]3451-the hill]3875-the top of the hill to hear the waters on [their]3877-their way , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam said . " [They]3877-their will be in the den of the monsters to - night.—But why did [you]0-i not await [our]3874-we return ? "[58-adam] " [[My]0-i child]3715-my child could not sleep , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " [She]3715-my child is fast asleep ! "[58-adam] [he]58-adam rejoined . " Yes , now ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " but [she]3715-my child was awake when [I]0-i laid [her]3715-my child down . "[0-i] " [She]3715-my child was asleep all the time ! "[58-adam] [he]58-adam insisted . " [She]3715-my child was perhaps dreaming about [you]0-i — and came to [you]0-i ? "[58-adam] " [She]3715-my child did . "[0-i] " And did [you]0-i not see that [her]3715-my child eyes were closed ? "[0-i] " Now [I]0-i think of it , [I]0-i did . "[0-i] " If [you]0-i had looked ere [you]0-i laid [her]3715-my child down , [you]0-i would have seen [her]3715-my child asleep on the couch . "[0-i] " That would have been terrible ! "[0-i] " [You]0-i would only have found that [she]3715-my child was no longer in [your]0-i arms . "[0-i] " That would have been worse ! "[0-i] " It is , perhaps , to think of ; but to see it would not have troubled [you]0-i . "[0-i] " [Dear father]3879-dear father , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " how is it that [I]0-i am not sleepy ? [I]0-i thought [I]0-i should go to sleep like [the Little Ones]47-the little ones the moment [I]0-i laid [my]0-i head down ! "[0-i] " [Your]0-i hour is not quite come . [You]0-i must have food ere [you]0-i sleep . "[0-i] " Ah , [I]0-i ought not to have lain down without [your]2395-he leave , for [I]0-i can not sleep without [your]2395-he help ! [I]0-i will get up at once ! "[0-i] But [I]0-i found [my]0-i own weight more than [I]0-i could move . " There is no need : [we]3880-we will serve [you]0-i here , "[2395-he] [he]2395-he answered . " — [You]0-i do not feel cold , do [you]0-i ? "[2395-he] " Not too cold to lie still , but perhaps too cold to eat ! "[2395-he] [He]2395-he came to the side of [[my]0-i couch]2396-my couch , bent over [me]0-i , and breathed on [my]0-i heart . At once [I]0-i was warm . As [he]2395-he left [me]0-i , [I]0-i heard a voice , and knew it was [the Mother]1418-the mother 's . [She]1418-the mother was singing , and [her]1418-the mother song was sweet and soft and low , and [I]0-i thought [she]1418-the mother sat by [my]0-i bed in the dark ; but ere it ceased , [her]1418-the mother song soared aloft , and seemed to come from the throat of [a woman - angel]2398-a woman - angel , high above all the region of larks , higher than [man]2682-man had ever yet lifted up [his]2682-man heart . [I]0-i heard every word [she]1418-the mother sang , but could keep only this : — and [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had heard the song before . Then [the three]2313-the three came to [my]0-i couch together , bringing [me]0-i bread and wine , and [I]0-i sat up to partake of it . [Adam]58-adam stood on one side of [me]0-i , [Eve]59-eve and [Mara]36-mara on the other . " [You]58-adam are good indeed , [father Adam]58-adam , [mother Eve]3881-mother eve , [sister Mara]2388-sister mara , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " to receive [me]0-i ! In [my]0-i soul [I]0-i am ashamed and sorry ! "[0-i] " [We]2313-the three knew [you]58-adam would come again ! "[59-eve] answered [Eve]59-eve . " How could [you]58-adam know it ? "[0-i] [I]0-i returned . " Because here was [I]36-mara , born to look after [[my]36-mara brothers]3883-my brothers and [sisters]884-sisters ! "[36-mara] answered [Mara]36-mara with a smile . " [Every creature]3885-every creature must one night yield [himself]3885-every creature and lie down , "[58-adam] answered [Adam]58-adam : " [he]3885-every creature was made for liberty , and must not be left [a slave]1798-a slave ! "[58-adam] " It will be late , [I]0-i fear , ere [all]1593-all have lain down ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " There is no early or late here , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam rejoined . " For [him]58-adam the true time then first begins who lays [himself]58-adam down . [Men]169-men are not coming [home]2676-home fast ; [women]3201-women are coming faster . [A desert]3891-a desert , wide and dreary , parts [him]58-adam who lies down to die from [him]58-adam who lies down to live . [The former]3892-the former may well make haste , but here is no haste . "[58-adam] " To [our]3893-we eyes , "[59-eve] said [Eve]59-eve , " [you]0-i were coming all the time : [we]3893-we knew [Mara]36-mara would find [you]0-i , and [you]0-i must come ! "[59-eve] " How long is it since [[my]0-i father]105-my father lay down ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [I]58-adam have told [you]0-i that years are of no consequence in [this house]2825-this house , "[58-adam] answered [Adam]58-adam ; " [we]3893-we do not heed [them]3896-them . [[Your]0-i father]3897-your father will wake when [his]3897-your father morning comes . [[Your]0-i mother]3898-your mother , next to whom [you]0-i are lying , — — "[58-adam] " Ah , then , it is [[my]0-i mother]107-my mother ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed . " Yes — [she]3898-your mother with the wounded hand , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam assented ; " — [she]3898-your mother will be up and away long ere [your]0-i morning is ripe . "[58-adam] " [I]58-adam am sorry . "[58-adam] " Rather be glad . "[58-adam] " It must be a sight for [God]33-god [Himself]33-god to see [such a woman]1062-such a woman come awake ! "[58-adam] " It is indeed a sight for [God]33-god , a sight that makes [her]1062-such a woman Maker glad ! [He]58-adam sees of the travail of [His]58-adam soul , and is satisfied!—Look at [her]2401-her once more , and sleep . "[58-adam] [He]58-adam let the rays of [his]58-adam candle fall on [her]2401-her beautiful face . " [She]2401-her looks much younger ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [She]2401-her is much younger , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam replied . " Even [Lilith]66-lilith already begins to look younger ! "[58-adam] [I]0-i lay down , blissfully drowsy . " But when [you]0-i see [[your]0-i mother]3898-your mother again , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam continued , " [you]0-i will not at first know [her]3898-your mother . [She]3898-your mother will go on steadily growing younger until [she]3898-your mother reaches the perfection of [her]3898-your mother womanhood — a splendour beyond foresight . Then [she]3898-your mother will open [her]3898-your mother eyes , behold on one side [[her]3898-your mother husband]350-her husband , on the other [[her]3898-your mother son]3903-her son — and rise and leave [them]2402-them , to go to [a father]1069-a father and [a brother]3905-a brother more to [her]3898-your mother than [they]2402-them . "[58-adam] [I]0-i heard as one in a dream . [I]0-i was very cold , but already the cold caused [me]0-i no suffering . [I]0-i felt [them]2402-them put on [me]0-i the white garment of the dead . Then [I]0-i forgot everything . The night about [me]0-i was pale with sleeping faces , but [I]0-i was asleep also , nor knew that [I]0-i slept . [I]0-i GREW aware of existence , aware also of the profound , the infinite cold . [I]0-i was intensely blessed — more blessed , [I]0-i know , than [my]0-i heart , imagining , can now recall . [I]0-i could not think of warmth with the least suggestion of pleasure . [I]0-i knew that [I]0-i had enjoyed it , but could not remember how . The cold had soothed every care , dissolved every pain , comforted every sorrow . Comforted ? Nay ; sorrow was swallowed up in the life drawing nigh to restore every good and lovely thing a hundredfold ! [I]0-i lay at peace , full of the quietest expectation , breathing the damp odours of [Earth]17-earth 's bountiful bosom , aware of the souls of primroses , daisies and snowdrops , patiently waiting in it for the Spring . How convey the delight of that frozen , yet conscious sleep ! [I]0-i had no more to stand up ! had only to lie stretched out and still ! How cold [I]0-i was , words can not tell ; yet [I]0-i grew colder and colder — and welcomed the cold yet more and more . [I]0-i grew continuously less conscious of [myself]0-i , continuously more conscious of bliss , unimaginable yet felt . [I]0-i had neither made it nor prayed for it : it was [mine]0-i in virtue of existence ! and existence was [mine]0-i in virtue of a Will that dwelt in [mine]0-i . Then the dreams began to arrive — and came [crowding.—I]0-i lay naked on [a snowy peak]2403-a snowy peak . The white mist heaved below [me]0-i like [a billowy sea]2404-a billowy sea . The cold moon was in the air with [me]0-i , and above the moon and [me]0-i the colder sky , in which the moon and [I]0-i dwelt . [I]0-i was [Adam]58-adam , waiting for [God]33-god to breathe into [my]0-i nostrils the breath of life.—I was not [Adam]58-adam , but [a child in the bosom of [a mother white with a radiant whiteness]2406-a mother white with a radiant whiteness]2405-a child in the bosom of a mother white with a radiant whiteness . [I]0-i was [a youth on a white horse , leaping from cloud to cloud of a blue heaven , hasting calmly to some blessed goal]2407-a youth on a white horse , leaping from cloud to cloud of a blue heaven , hasting calmly to some blessed goal . For centuries [I]0-i dreamed — or was it [chiliads]93-chiliads ? or only one long night?—But why ask ? for time had nothing to do with [me]0-i ; [I]0-i was in [the land of thought]2408-the land of thought — farther in , higher up than [the seven dimensions]2726-the seven dimensions , the ten senses : [I]0-i think [I]0-i was where [I]0-i am — in [the heart of [God.—I]94-god.—i]2410-the heart of god.—i dreamed away [dim cycles in the centre of a melting glacier]2411-dim cycles in the centre of a melting glacier , the spectral moon drawing nearer and nearer , the wind and the welter of a torrent growing in [my]0-i ears . [I]0-i lay and heard them : the wind and the water and the moon sang a peaceful waiting for a redemption drawing nigh . [I]0-i dreamed cycles , [I]0-i say , but , for aught [I]0-i knew or can tell , they were the solemn , æonian march of a second , pregnant with eternity . Then , of a sudden , but not once troubling [my]0-i conscious bliss , all the wrongs [I]0-i had ever done , from far beyond [my]0-i earthly memory down to the present moment , were with [me]0-i . Fully in every wrong lived the conscious [I]0-i , confessing , abjuring , lamenting the deed , making atonement with [each person [I]0-i had injured , hurt , or offended]2412-each person i had injured , hurt , or offended . [Every human soul to which [I]0-i had caused a troubled thought]2413-every human soul to which i had caused a troubled thought , was now grown unspeakably dear to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i humbled [myself]0-i before it , agonising to cast from between [us]2414-us the clinging offence . [I]0-i wept at the feet of [the mother whose commands [I]0-i had slighted]2415-the mother whose commands i had slighted ; with bitter shame [I]0-i confessed to [[my]0-i father]105-my father that [I]0-i had told [him]105-my father two lies , and long forgotten them : now for long had remembered them , and kept them in memory to crush at last at [his]105-my father feet . [I]0-i was [the eager slave of all whom [I]0-i had thus or anyhow wronged]2417-the eager slave of all whom i had thus or anyhow wronged . Countless services [I]0-i devised to render [them]2418-them ! For this one [I]0-i would build [such a house as had never grown from the ground]2419-such a house as had never grown from the ground ! for that one [I]0-i would train such horses as had never yet been seen in [any world]570-any world ! For a third [I]0-i would make such [a garden]2421-a garden as had never bloomed , [haunted with still pools]2422-haunted with still pools , and alive with running waters ! [I]0-i would write songs to make [their]2418-them hearts swell , and tales to make them glow ! [I]0-i would turn the forces of [the world]108-the world into such channels of invention as to make [them]2418-them laugh with the joy of wonder ! Love possessed [me]0-i ! Love was [my]0-i life ! Love was to [me]0-i , as to [him]2424-him that made [me]0-i , all in all ! Suddenly [I]0-i found [myself]0-i in a solid blackness , upon which [the ghost of light that dwells in the caverns of the eyes]2425-the ghost of light that dwells in the caverns of the eyes could not cast one fancied glimmer . But [my]0-i heart , which feared nothing and hoped infinitely , was full of peace . [I]0-i lay imagining what the light would be when it came , and what new creation it would bring with it — when , suddenly , without conscious volition , [I]0-i sat up and stared about [me]0-i . The moon was looking in at the lowest , horizontal , crypt - like windows of [the death - chamber]2337-the death - chamber , [her]2427-her long light slanting , [I]0-i thought , across the fallen , but still ripening sheaves of the harvest of the great husbandman.—But no ; that harvest was gone ! Gathered in , or swept away by chaotic storm , not a sacred sheaf was there ! [My]0-i dead were gone ! [I]0-i was alone!—In desolation dread lay depths yet deeper than [I]0-i had hitherto known!—Had there never been any ripening dead ? Had [I]0-i but dreamed [them]2418-them and [their]2418-them loveliness ? Why then these walls ? why . those empty couches ? No ; they were all up ! [they]2418-them were all abroad in the new eternal day , and had forgotten [me]0-i ! [They]2418-them had left [me]0-i behind , and alone ! Tenfold more terrible was the tomb [its inhabitants]1670-its inhabitants away ! [The quiet ones]2429-the quiet ones had made [me]0-i quiet with [their]2429-the quiet ones presence — had pervaded [my]0-i mind with [their]2429-the quiet ones blissful peace ; now [I]0-i had [no friend]2430-no friend , and [[my]0-i lovers]2431-my lovers were far from [me]0-i ! A moment [I]0-i sat and stared horror - stricken . [I]0-i had been alone with the moon on a mountain top in the sky ; now [I]0-i was alone with [her]2432-her in a huge cenotaph : [she]2432-her too was staring about , seeking [her]2432-her dead with ghastly gaze ! [I]0-i sprang to [my]0-i feet , and staggered from [the fearful place]2433-the fearful place . [The cottage]340-the cottage was empty . [I]0-i ran out into the night . No moon was there ! Even as [I]0-i left [the chamber]208-the chamber , [a cloudy rampart]2436-a cloudy rampart had risen and covered [her]2432-her . But a broad shimmer came from far over [the heath]326-the heath , mingled with a ghostly murmuring music , as if the moon were raining a light that plashed as it fell . [I]0-i ran stumbling across [the moor]342-the moor , and found [a lovely lake , margined with reeds and rushes]2439-a lovely lake , margined with reeds and rushes : the moon behind the cloud was gazing upon [the monsters]520-the monsters ' den , full of clearest , brightest water , and very still.—But the musical murmur went on , filling the quiet air , and drawing [me]0-i after it . [I]0-i walked round [the border of [the little mere]2442-the little mere]2441-the border of the little mere , and climbed [the range of hills]2443-the range of hills . What a sight rose to [my]0-i eyes ! The whole expanse where , with hot , aching feet , [I]0-i had crossed and recrossed [the deep - scored channels and ravines of [the dry river - bed]2445-the dry river - bed]2444-the deep - scored channels and ravines of the dry river - bed , was alive with streams , with torrents , with still pools—"a river deep and wide "[2447-new - born liberty] ! How the moon flashed on [the water]3248-the water ! how the water answered the moon with flashes of its own — white flashes breaking everywhere from its rock - encountered flow ! And a great jubilant song arose from its bosom , the song of [new - born liberty]2447-new - born liberty . [I]0-i stood a moment gazing , and [my]0-i heart also began to exult : [my]0-i life was not all a failure ! [I]0-i had helped to set [this river]2448-this river free!—My dead were not lost ! [I]0-i had but to go after and find [them]2449-them ! [I]0-i would follow and follow until [I]0-i came whither [they]2449-them had gone ! [Our]2450-our meeting might be thousands of years away , but at last — at last [I]0-i should hold [them]2449-them ! Wherefore else did the floods clap [their]2449-them hands ? [I]0-i hurried down [the hill]3451-the hill : [my]0-i pilgrimage was begun ! In what direction to turn [my]0-i steps [I]0-i knew not , but [I]0-i must go and go till [I]0-i found [my]0-i living dead ! A torrent ran swift and wide at the foot of [the range]2452-the range : [I]0-i rushed in ; it laid no hold upon [me]0-i ; [I]0-i waded through it . The next [I]0-i sprang across ; the third [I]0-i swam ; the next [I]0-i waded again . [I]0-i stopped to gaze on the wondrous loveliness of the ceaseless flash and flow , and to hearken to the multitudinous broken music . Every now and then some incipient air would seem about to draw itself clear of the dulcet confusion , only to merge again in the consorted roar . At moments [the world of waters]2453-the world of waters would invade as if to overwhelm [me]0-i — not with the force of its seaward rush , or the shouting of its liberated throng , but with the greatness of the silence wandering into sound . As [I]0-i stood lost in delight , a hand was laid on [my]0-i shoulder . [I]0-i turned , and saw [a man in the prime of strength , beautiful as if fresh from the heart of the glad creator]2454-a man in the prime of strength , beautiful as if fresh from the heart of the glad creator , young like [him]2454-a man in the prime of strength , beautiful as if fresh from the heart of the glad creator who can not grow old . [I]0-i looked : it was [Adam]58-adam . [He]58-adam stood large and grand , clothed in a white robe , with the moon in [his]58-adam hair . " [Father]91-father , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , " where is [she]3906-she ? Where are the dead ? Is the great resurrection come and gone ? The terror of [my]0-i loneliness was upon [me]0-i ; [I]0-i could not sleep without [my]0-i dead ; [I]0-i ran from the desolate chamber.—Whither shall [I]0-i go to find [them]3906-she ? "[0-i] " [You]0-i mistake , [[my]58-adam son]3555-my son , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam answered , in a voice whose very breath was consolation . " [You]0-i are still in the chamber of death , still upon [your]0-i couch , asleep and dreaming , with the dead around [you]0-i . "[58-adam] " Alas ! when [I]0-i but dream how am [I]0-i to know it ? The dream best dreamed is the likest to the waking truth ! "[0-i] " When [you]0-i are quite dead , [you]0-i will dream no false dream . The soul that is true can generate nothing that is not true , neither can [the false]3908-the false enter it . "[0-i] " But , [sir]2678-sir , "[0-i] [I]0-i faltered , " how am [I]0-i to distinguish betwixt the true and the false where both alike seem real ? "[0-i] " Do [you]0-i not understand ? "[58-adam] [he]58-adam returned , with a smile that might have slain all the sorrows of all [[his]58-adam children]2455-his children . " [You]0-i can not perfectly distinguish between the true and the false while [you]0-i are not yet quite dead ; neither indeed will [you]0-i when [you]0-i are quite dead — that is , quite alive , for then the false will never present itself . At this moment , believe [me]0-i , [you]0-i are on [your]0-i bed in [the house of death]793-the house of death . "[0-i] " [I]0-i am trying hard to believe [you]58-adam , [father]3911-father . [I]0-i do indeed believe [you]58-adam , although [I]0-i can neither see nor feel the truth of what [you]58-adam say . "[0-i] " [You]0-i are not to blame that [you]0-i can not . And because even in a dream [you]0-i believe [me]0-i , [I]0-i will help you.—Put forth [your]0-i left hand open , and close it gently : it will clasp the hand of [[your]0-i Lona]3912-your lona , who lies asleep where [you]0-i lie dreaming [you]0-i are awake . "[0-i] [I]0-i put forth [my]0-i hand : it closed on the hand of [Lona]44-lona , firm and soft and deathless . " But , [father]3911-father , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , " [she]44-lona is warm ! "[0-i] " [Your]0-i hand is as warm to [hers]44-lona . Cold is a thing unknown in [[our]3914-our country]3915-our country . Neither [she]44-lona nor [you]0-i are yet in [the fields of [home]2676-home]3916-the fields of home , but each to each is alive and warm and healthful . "[0-i] Then [my]0-i heart was glad . But immediately supervened a sharp - stinging doubt . " [Father]3911-father , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " forgive [me]0-i , but how am [I]0-i to know surely that this also is not a part of the lovely dream in which [I]0-i am now walking with [thyself]3919-thyself ? "[0-i] " [Thou]3920-thou doubtest because [thou]3920-thou lovest the truth . [Some]2784-some would willingly believe life but a phantasm , if only it might for ever afford [them]2784-some a world of pleasant dreams : [thou]3920-thou art not of such ! Be content for a while not to know surely . The hour will come , and that ere long , when , being true , [thou]3920-thou shalt behold the very truth , and doubt will be for ever dead . Scarce , then , wilt [thou]3920-thou be able to recall the features of the phantom . [Thou]3920-thou wilt then know that which [thou]3920-thou canst not now dream . [Thou]3920-thou hast not yet looked the Truth in the face , hast as yet at best but seen [him]3911-father through a cloud . That which [thou]3920-thou seest not , and never didst see save in a glass darkly — that which , indeed , never can be known save by its innate splendour shining straight into pure eyes — that [thou]3920-thou canst not but doubt , and art blameless in doubting until [thou]3920-thou seest it face to face , when [thou]3920-thou wilt no longer be able to doubt it . But to [him]3911-father who has once seen even a shadow only of the truth , and , even but hoping [he]3911-father has seen it when it is present no longer , tries to obey it — to [him]3911-father the real vision , the Truth [himself]3911-father , will come , and depart no more , but abide with [him]3911-father for ever . "[0-i] " [I]0-i think [I]0-i see , [father]3911-father , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " [I]0-i think [I]0-i understand . "[0-i] " Then remember , and recall . Trials yet await [thee]3920-thou , heavy , of a nature [thou]3920-thou knowest not now . Remember the things [thou]3920-thou hast seen . Truly [thou]3920-thou knowest not those things , but [thou]3920-thou knowest what they have seemed , what they have meant to [thee]3920-thou ! Remember also the things [thou]3920-thou shalt yet see . Truth is all in all ; and the truth of things lies , at once hid and revealed , in their seeming . "[0-i] " How can that be , [father]3911-father ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and raised [my]0-i eyes with the question ; for [I]0-i had been listening with downbent head , aware of nothing but the voice of [Adam]58-adam . [He]58-adam was gone ; in [my]0-i ears was nought but the sounding silence of the swift - flowing waters . [I]0-i stretched forth [my]0-i hands to find [him]58-adam , but no answering touch met [their]2456-their seeking . [I]0-i was alone — alone in [the land of dreams]2457-the land of dreams ! To [myself]0-i [I]0-i seemed wide awake , but [I]0-i believed [I]0-i was in a dream , because [he]58-adam had told [me]0-i so . Even in a dream , however , [the dreamer]2458-the dreamer must do something ! [he]2458-the dreamer can not sit down and refuse to stir until the dream grow weary of [him]2458-the dreamer and depart : [I]0-i took up [my]0-i wandering , and went on . Many channels [I]0-i crossed , and came to [a wider space of rock]2459-a wider space of rock ; there , dreaming [I]0-i was weary , [I]0-i laid [myself]0-i down , and longed to be awake . [I]0-i was about to rise and resume [my]0-i journey , when [I]0-i discovered that [I]0-i lay beside a pit in [the rock]2460-the rock , whose mouth was like that of [a grave]2461-a grave . [It]2462-it was deep and dark ; [I]0-i could see no bottom . Now in the dreams of [my]0-i childhood [I]0-i had found that a fall invariably woke [me]0-i , and would , therefore , when desiring to discontinue a dream , seek some eminence whence to cast [myself]0-i down that [I]0-i might wake : with one glance at the peaceful heavens , and one at the rushing waters , [I]0-i rolled [myself]0-i over the edge of [the pit]2463-the pit . For a moment consciousness left [me]0-i . When it returned , [I]0-i stood in [the garret of [[my]0-i own house]2465-my own house]2464-the garret of my own house , in [the little wooden chamber of the cowl]2466-the little wooden chamber of the cowl and the mirror . Unspeakable despair , hopelessness blank and dreary , invaded [me]0-i with the knowledge : between [me]0-i and [my]0-i Lona lay [an abyss impassable]2467-an abyss impassable ! stretched a distance no chain could measure ! Space and Time and Mode of Being , as with walls of adamant unscalable , impenetrable , shut [me]0-i in from [that gulf]2468-that gulf ! True , it might yet be in [my]0-i power to pass again through the door of light , and journey back to [the chamber of the dead]2469-the chamber of the dead ; and if so , [I]0-i was parted from [that chamber]2470-that chamber only by a wide heath , and by the pale , starry night betwixt [me]0-i and the sun , which alone could open for [me]0-i the mirror - door , and was now far away on [the other side of [the world]108-the world]2471-the other side of the world ! but an immeasurably wider gulf sank between [us]2473-us in this — that [she]2474-her was asleep and [I]0-i was awake ! that [I]0-i was no longer worthy to share with [her]2474-her that sleep , and could no longer hope to awake from it with [her]2474-her ! For truly [I]0-i was much to blame : [I]0-i had fled from [my]0-i dream ! The dream was not of [my]0-i making , any more than was [my]0-i life : [I]0-i ought to have seen it to the end ! and in fleeing from it , [I]0-i had left the holy sleep itself behind me!—I would go back to [Adam]58-adam , tell [him]58-adam the truth , and bow to [his]58-adam decree ! [I]0-i crept to [[my]0-i chamber]2475-my chamber , threw [myself]0-i on [my]0-i bed , and passed a dreamless night . [I]0-i rose , and listlessly sought [the library]117-the library . On the way [I]0-i met [no one]134-no one ; [the house]112-the house seemed dead . [I]0-i sat down with a book to await the noontide : not a sentence could [I]0-i understand ! The mutilated manuscript offered itself from the masked door : the sight of it sickened [me]0-i ; what to [me]0-i was [the princess]3100-the princess with [her]3100-the princess devilry ! [I]0-i rose and looked out of a window . It was a brilliant morning . With a great rush the fountain shot high , and fell roaring back . The sun sat in its feathery top . Not a bird sang , not a creature was to be seen . [[Raven]24-mr. raven nor [librarian]2812-librarian]2480-raven nor librarian came near [me]0-i . [The world]108-the world was dead about [me]0-i . [I]0-i took another book , sat down again , and went on waiting . Noon was near . [I]0-i went up the stairs to [the dumb , shadowy roof]2483-the dumb , shadowy roof . [I]0-i closed behind [me]0-i the door into [the wooden chamber]493-the wooden chamber , and turned to open the door out of [a dreary world]2485-a dreary world . [I]0-i left [the chamber]208-the chamber with a heart of stone . Do what [I]0-i might , all was fruitless . [I]0-i pulled the chains ; adjusted and re - adjusted the hood ; arranged and re - arranged the mirrors ; no result followed . [I]0-i waited and waited to give the vision time ; it would not come ; the mirror stood blank ; nothing lay in its dim old depth but the mirror opposite and [my]0-i haggard face . [I]0-i went back to [the library]117-the library . There the books were hateful to [me]0-i — for [I]0-i had once loved them . That night [I]0-i lay awake from down - lying to uprising , and the next day renewed [my]0-i endeavours with the mystic door . But all was yet in vain . How the hours went [I]0-i can not think . [No one]134-no one came nigh [me]0-i ; not a sound from [the house]112-the house below entered [my]0-i ears . Not once did [I]0-i feel weary — only desolate , drearily desolate . [I]0-i passed a second sleepless night . In the morning [I]0-i went for the last time to [the chamber in the roof]2490-the chamber in the roof , and for the last time sought an open door : there was none . [My]0-i heart died within [me]0-i . [I]0-i had lost [[my]0-i [Lona]44-lona]1512-my lona ! Was [she]44-lona anywhere ? had [she]44-lona ever been , save in the mouldering cells of [my]0-i brain ? " [I]0-i must die one day , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought , " and then , straight from [my]0-i death - bed , [I]0-i will set out to find [her]44-lona ! If [she]44-lona is not , [I]0-i will go to [the Father]3746-the father and say—`Even [thou]3746-the father canst not help [me]0-i : let [me]0-i cease , [I]0-i pray [thee]3746-the father ! ' "[0-i] THE fourth night [I]0-i seemed to fall asleep , and that night woke indeed . [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes and knew , although all was dark around [me]0-i , that [I]0-i lay in [the house of death]793-the house of death , and that every moment since there [I]0-i fell asleep [I]0-i had been dreaming , and now first was awake . " At last ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [my]0-i heart , and it leaped for joy . [I]0-i turned [my]0-i eyes ; [Lona]44-lona stood by [my]0-i couch , waiting for [me]0-i ! [I]0-i had never lost her!—only for a little time lost the sight of [her]44-lona ! Truly [I]0-i needed not have lamented [her]44-lona so sorely ! It was dark , as [I]0-i say , but [I]0-i saw [her]44-lona : [she]44-lona was not dark ! [Her]44-lona eyes shone with the radiance of [the Mother]1418-the mother 's , and the same light issued from [her]44-lona face — nor from [her]44-lona face only , for [her]44-lona death - dress , filled with the light of [her]44-lona body now tenfold awake in the power of its resurrection , was white as snow and glistering . [She]44-lona fell asleep [a girl]3101-a girl ; [she]44-lona awoke [a woman , ripe with the loveliness of the life essential]2495-a woman , ripe with the loveliness of the life essential . [I]0-i folded [her]44-lona in [my]0-i arms , and knew that [I]0-i lived indeed . " [I]1418-the mother woke first ! "[1418-the mother] [she]1418-the mother said , with a wondering smile . " [You]0-i did , [[my]1418-the mother love]3925-my love , and woke [me]1418-the mother ! "[1418-the mother] " [I]1418-the mother only looked at [you]0-i and waited , "[1418-the mother] [she]1418-the mother answered . The candle came floating toward [us]2496-us through the dark , and in a few moments [Adam]58-adam and [Eve]59-eve and [Mara]36-mara were with [us]2496-us . "[1418-the mother] said [the Mother]1418-the mother . " Not very , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " but the waking from it is heavenly . "[0-i] " It is but begun , "[1418-the mother] [she]1418-the mother rejoined ; " [you]0-i are hardly yet awake ! "[1418-the mother] " [He]58-adam is at least clothed - upon with Death , which is the radiant garment of Life , "[58-adam] said [Adam]58-adam . " [I]58-adam think [we]3926-we shall meet [[you]3926-we two]3927-you two again before long , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam said , looking first at [Lona]44-lona , then at [me]0-i . " Have [we]3926-we to die again ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " No , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam answered , with a smile like [the Mother]1418-the mother 's ; " [you]0-i have died into life , and will die no more ; [you]0-i have only to keep dead . Once dying as [we]3926-we die here , all the dying is over . Now [you]0-i have only to live , and that [you]0-i must , with all [your]0-i blessed might . The more [you]0-i live , the stronger [you]0-i become to live . "[58-adam] " But shall [I]0-i not grow weary with living so strong ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " What if [I]0-i cease to live with all [my]0-i might ? "[0-i] " It needs but the will , and the strength is there ! "[1418-the mother] said [the Mother]1418-the mother . " Pure life has no weakness to grow weary withal . The Life keeps generating ours.—Those who will not die , die many times , die constantly , keep dying deeper , never have done dying ; here all is upwardness and love and gladness . "[1418-the mother] [She]1418-the mother ceased with a smile and a look that seemed to say , " [We]3926-we are [mother]1760-mother and [son]3929-son ; [we]3926-we understand [each other]2772-each other ! Between [us]3926-we no farewell is possible . "[1418-the mother] [Mara]36-mara kissed [me]0-i on the forehead , and said , gayly , " [I]36-mara told [you]0-i , [brother]192-brother , all would be well!—When next [you]0-i would comfort , say , ` What will be well , is even now well . ' "[36-mara] [She]1418-the mother gave a little sigh , and [I]0-i thought it meant , " But [they]3932-they will not believe [you]0-i ! "[1418-the mother] " — [You]0-i know [me]1418-the mother now ! "[1418-the mother] [she]1418-the mother ended , with a smile like [[her]1418-the mother mother]3293-her mother 's . " [I]1418-the mother know [you]0-i ! "[0-i] " [My]1418-the mother work will one day be over , "[1418-the mother] [she]1418-the mother said , " and then [I]1418-the mother shall be glad with the gladness of [the great shepherd who sent [me]1418-the mother]3933-the great shepherd who sent me . "[1418-the mother] " All the night long the morning is at hand , "[58-adam] said [Adam]58-adam . " What is that flapping of wings [I]0-i hear ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [The Shadow]92-the shadow is hovering , "[58-adam] replied [Adam]58-adam : " there is one here whom [he]58-adam counts [his]58-adam own ! But [ours]2508-ours once , never more can [she]3934-she be [his]58-adam ! "[58-adam] [I]0-i turned to look on the faces of [[my]0-i father]105-my father and [mother]1760-mother , and kiss [them]2507-they ere [we]2508-ours went : [their]2507-they couches were empty save of [the Little Ones who had with love 's boldness appropriated [their]2507-they hospitality]2509-the little ones who had with love 's boldness appropriated their hospitality ! "[58-adam] The hour of [our]2510-our departure was at hand . [Lona]44-lona went to the couch of [the mother who had slain [her]44-lona]2511-the mother who had slain her , and kissed [her]44-lona tenderly — then laid [herself]44-lona in [[her]44-lona father]2015-her father 's arms . " That kiss will draw [her]44-lona homeward , [[my]58-adam [Lona]44-lona]1512-my lona ! "[58-adam] said [Adam]58-adam . " Who were [[her]44-lona parents]3940-her parents ? "[44-lona] [She]44-lona turned and laid [her]44-lona hand in mine . [I]0-i kneeled and humbly thanked [the three]2313-the three for helping [me]0-i to die . [Lona]44-lona knelt beside [me]0-i , and [they]2313-the three all breathed upon [us]2514-us . " Hark ! [I]58-adam hear the sun , "[58-adam] said [Adam]58-adam . [I]0-i listened : [he]58-adam was coming with the rush as of a thousand times ten thousand far - off wings , with the roar of a molten and flaming world millions upon millions of miles away . [His]58-adam approach was a crescendo chord of a hundred harmonies . [The three]2313-the three looked at [each other]2772-each other and smiled , and that smile went floating heavenward a three - petaled flower , [the family]113-the family 's morning thanksgiving . From [their]2313-the three mouths and [their]2313-the three faces it spread over [their]2313-the three bodies and shone through [their]2313-the three garments . Ere [I]0-i could say , " [Lo]96-lo , [they]2313-the three change ! "[0-i] [Adam]58-adam and [Eve]59-eve stood before [me]0-i [the angels of the resurrection]2518-the angels of the resurrection , and [Mara]36-mara was the Magdalene with [them]2313-the three at the sepulchre . The countenance of [Adam]58-adam was like lightning , and [Eve]59-eve held a napkin that flung flakes of splendour about [the place]2672-the place . A wind began to moan in pulsing gusts . " [You]0-i hear [his]58-adam wings now ! "[58-adam] said [Adam]58-adam ; and [I]0-i knew [he]58-adam did not mean the wings of the morning . " It is [the great Shadow stirring to depart]3943-the great shadow stirring to depart , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam went on . " Wretched creature , [he]58-adam has [himself]58-adam within [him]58-adam , and can not rest ! "[58-adam] " But is there not in [him]58-adam something deeper yet ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " Without a substance , "[58-adam] [he]58-adam answered , " a shadow can not be — yea , or without a light behind the substance ! "[58-adam] [He]58-adam listened for a moment , then called out , with a glad smile , " Hark to the golden cock ! Silent and motionless for millions of years has [he]58-adam stood on the clock of [the universe]266-the universe ; now at last [he]58-adam is flapping [his]58-adam wings ! now will [he]58-adam begin to crow ! and at intervals will [men]169-men hear [him]58-adam until the dawn of the day eternal . "[0-i] [I]0-i listened . Far away — as in the heart of an æonian silence , [I]0-i heard the clear jubilant outcry of the golden throat . It hurled defiance at death and the dark ; sang infinite hope , and coming calm . It was the " expectation of the creature "[0-i] finding at last a voice ; the cry of a chaos that would be a kingdom ! Then [I]0-i heard a great flapping . " The black bat is flown ! "[36-mara] said [Mara]36-mara . " Amen , golden cock , bird of [God]33-god ! "[58-adam] cried [Adam]58-adam , and the words rang through the house of silence , and went up into [the airy regions]2520-the airy regions . At [his]58-adam Amen — like doves arising on wings of silver from among the potsherds , up sprang the Little Ones to [their]2521-their knees on [their]2521-their beds , calling aloud , " Crow ! crow again , golden cock!"—as[2521-their] if [they]2521-their had both seen and heard [him]58-adam in [their]2521-their dreams . Then [each]2774-each turned and looked at [the sleeping bedfellow]2523-the sleeping bedfellow , gazed a moment with loving eyes , kissed [the silent companion of the night]2524-the silent companion of the night , and sprang from the couch . [The Little Ones who had lain down beside [[my]0-i father and [mother]1760-mother]2526-my father and mother]2525-the little ones who had lain down beside my father and mother gazed blank and sad for a moment at [their]2525-the little ones who had lain down beside my father and mother empty places , then slid slowly to the floor . There [they]2525-the little ones who had lain down beside my father and mother fell [each]2774-each into [the other]2867-the other 's arms , as if then first , [each by the other]2530-each by the other 's eyes , assured [they]2525-the little ones who had lain down beside my father and mother were alive and awake . Suddenly spying [Lona]44-lona , [they]2525-the little ones who had lain down beside my father and mother came running , radiant with bliss , to embrace [her]44-lona . [Odu]77-odu , catching sight of [the leopardess on the feet of [the princess]3100-the princess]2531-the leopardess on the feet of the princess , bounded to [her]3100-the princess next , and throwing an arm over the great sleeping head , fondled and kissed it . " Wake up , wake up , [darling]2992-darling ! "[77-odu] [he]77-odu cried ; " it is time to wake ! "[77-odu] [The leopardess]3280-the leopardess did not move . " [She]3100-the princess has slept [herself]3100-the princess cold ! "[77-odu] [he]77-odu said to [Mara]36-mara , with an upcast look of appealing consternation . " [She]3100-the princess is waiting for [the princess]3100-the princess to wake , [[my]36-mara child]3715-my child , "[36-mara] said [Mara]36-mara . [He]77-odu flew at [them]2535-two of his companions . " Wake up ! wake up ! "[77-odu] [he]77-odu cried , and pushed and pulled , now this one , now that .
