" Let [them]2090-his companions sleep , [darling]2992-darling ! "[58-adam] said [Adam]58-adam . " [You]58-adam would not like [the princess]3100-the princess to wake and find [nobody]149-nobody ? [They]2090-his companions are quite happy . So is [the leopardess]3280-the leopardess . "[58-adam] [He]58-adam was comforted , and wiped [his]58-adam eyes as if [he]58-adam had been all [his]58-adam life used to weeping and wiping , though now first [he]58-adam had tears wherewith to weep — soon to be wiped altogether away . [We]2539-we followed [Eve]59-eve to [the cottage]340-the cottage . There [she]59-eve offered [us]2539-we neither bread nor wine , but stood radiantly desiring [our]2539-we departure . So , with never a word of farewell , [we]2539-we went out . The horse and the elephants were at the door , waiting for [us]2539-we . [We]2539-we were too happy to mount [them]2541-them , and [they]2541-them followed [us]2539-we . IT had ceased to be dark ; [we]2539-we walked in a dim twilight , breathing through the dimness the breath of the spring . A wondrous change had passed upon [the world]108-the world — or was it not rather that a change more marvellous had taken place in [us]2539-we ? Without light enough in the sky or the air to reveal anything , every heather - bush , every small shrub , every blade of grass was perfectly visible — either by light that went out from it , as fire from the bush [Moses]99-moses saw in [the desert]3065-the desert , or by light that went out of [our]2539-we eyes . Nothing cast a shadow ; all things interchanged a little light . Every growing thing showed [me]0-i , by its shape and colour , its indwelling idea — the informing thought , that is , which was its being , and sent it out . [My]0-i bare feet seemed to love every plant [they]2544-they trod upon . [The world]108-the world and [my]0-i being , its life and [mine]0-i , were one . The microcosm and macrocosm were at length atoned , at length in harmony ! [I]0-i lived in everything ; everything entered and lived in [me]0-i . To be aware of a thing , was to know [its]2546-its life at once and [mine]0-i , to know whence [we]2539-we came , and where [we]2539-we were at [home]2676-home — was to know that [we]2539-we are all what [we]2539-we are , because Another is what [he]2548-he is ! Sense after sense , hitherto asleep , awoke in [me]0-i — sense after sense indescribable , because no correspondent words , no likenesses or imaginations exist , wherewith to describe them . Full indeed — yet ever expanding , ever making room to receive — was the conscious being where things kept entering by so many open doors ! When a little breeze brushing a bush of heather set its purple bells a ringing , [I]0-i was [myself]0-i in the joy of the bells , [myself]0-i in the joy of the breeze to which responded their sweet tin - tinning , [myself]0-i in the joy of the sense , and of the soul that received all the joys together . To everything glad [I]0-i lent [the hall of [my]0-i being]2549-the hall of my being wherein to revel . [I]0-i was [a peaceful ocean upon which the ground - swell of a living joy was continually lifting new waves]2550-a peaceful ocean upon which the ground - swell of a living joy was continually lifting new waves ; yet was the joy ever the same joy , the eternal joy , with tens of thousands of changing forms . Life was a cosmic holiday . Now [I]0-i knew that life and truth were one ; that life mere and pure is in itself bliss ; that where being is not bliss , it is not life , but life - in - death . Every inspiration of the dark wind that blew where it listed , went out a sigh of thanksgiving . At last [I]0-i was ! [I]0-i lived , and nothing could touch [my]0-i life ! [[My]0-i darling]3283-my darling walked beside [me]0-i , and [we]2539-we were on [our]2539-we way [home]2676-home to [the Father]3746-the father ! So much was [ours]2539-we ere ever the first sun rose upon [our]2539-we freedom : what must not the eternal day bring with it ! [We]2539-we came to [the fearful hollow where once had wallowed the monsters of [the earth]2702-the earth]2554-the fearful hollow where once had wallowed the monsters of the earth : it was indeed , as [I]0-i had beheld [it]2554-the fearful hollow where once had wallowed the monsters of the earth in [my]0-i dream , [a lovely lake]2556-a lovely lake . [I]0-i gazed into [its]2554-the fearful hollow where once had wallowed the monsters of the earth pellucid depths . A whirlpool had swept out the soil in which the abortions burrowed , and at the bottom lay visible the whole horrid brood : a dim greenish light pervaded the crystalline water , and revealed every hideous form beneath it . Coiled in spires , folded in layers , knotted on themselves , or " extended long and large , "[100-maelstrom] they weltered in motionless heaps — shapes more fantastic in ghoulish , blasting dismay , than ever wine - sodden brain of [exhausted poet fevered into misbeing]2557-exhausted poet fevered into misbeing . [He]2558-he who dived in the swirling [Maelstrom]100-maelstrom saw none to compare with [them]2559-them in horror : tentacular convolutions , tumid bulges , glaring orbs of sepian deformity , would have looked to [him]2558-he innocence beside such incarnations of hatefulness — every head the wicked flower that , bursting from an abominable stalk , perfected its evil significance . Not one of [them]2559-them moved as [we]2539-we passed . But [they]2559-them were not dead . So long as exist [men]169-men and [women of unwholesome mind]2561-women of unwholesome mind , that lake will still be peopled with loathsomenesses . But hark [the herald of the sun]2562-the herald of the sun , the auroral wind , softly trumpeting [his]2558-he approach ! [The master - minister of the human tabernacle]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle is at hand ! Heaping before [his]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle prow a huge ripple - fretted wave of crimson and gold , [he]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle rushes aloft , as if new launched from the urging hand of [[his]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle maker]2564-his maker into [the upper sea]2565-the upper sea — pauses , and looks down on [the world]108-the world . White - raving storm of molten metals , [he]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle is but a coal from the altar of [the Father]3746-the father 's never - ending sacrifice to [[his]3746-the father children]2455-his children . See every little flower straighten [its]2569-its stalk , lift up its neck , and with outstretched head stand expectant : something more than the sun , greater than the light , is coming , is coming — none the less surely coming that it is long upon [the road]3554-the road ! What matters to - day , or to - morrow , or ten thousand years to Life [himself]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle , to Love [himself]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle ! [He]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle is coming , is coming , and the necks of all humanity are stretched out to see [him]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle come ! Every morning will [they]2571-they thus outstretch [themselves]2571-they , every evening will [they]2571-they droop and wait — until [he]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle comes.—Is this but an air - drawn vision ? When [he]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle comes , will [he]2563-the master - minister of the human tabernacle indeed find [them]2571-they watching thus ? It was a glorious resurrection - morning . The night had been spent in preparing it ! [The children]2965-the children went gamboling before , and the beasts came after [us]2573-we . Fluttering butterflies , darting dragonflies hovered or shot hither and thither about [our]2573-we heads , a cloud of colours and flashes , now descending upon [us]2573-we like a snow - storm of rainbow flakes , now rising into the humid air like a rolling vapour of embodied odours . It was a summer - day more like itself , that is , more ideal , than ever man that had not died found summer - day in [any world]570-any world . [I]0-i walked on [the new earth]2575-the new earth , under [the new heaven]2576-the new heaven , and found [them]2571-they the same as the old , save that now [they]2571-they opened [their]2571-they minds to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i saw into [them]2571-they . Now , [the soul of everything [I]0-i met]2577-the soul of everything i met came out to greet [me]0-i and make friends with [me]0-i , telling [me]0-i [we]2573-we came from the same , and meant the same . [I]0-i was going to [him]2578-him , [they]2571-they said , with whom [they]2571-they always were , and whom [they]2571-they always meant ; [they]2571-they were , [they]2571-they said , lightnings that took shape as they flashed from [him]2578-him to [his]2578-him . The dark rocks drank like sponges the rays that showered upon them ; [the great world]3796-the great world soaked up the light , and sent out the living . Two joy - fires were [Lona]44-lona and [I.]0-i [Earth]17-earth breathed heavenward [her]44-lona sweet - savoured smoke ; [we]2573-we breathed homeward [our]2573-we longing desires . For thanksgiving , [our]2573-we very consciousness was that . [We]2573-we came to [the channels]789-the channels , once so dry and wearyful : they ran and flashed and foamed with living water that shouted in its gladness ! Far as the eye could see , all was a rushing , roaring , dashing river of water made vocal by its rocks . [We]2573-we did not cross [it]2581-its , but " walked in glory and in joy "[2573-we] up [its]2581-its right bank , until [we]2573-we reached the great cataract at [the foot of [the sandy desert , where , roaring and swirling and dropping sheer , the river]2583-the sandy desert , where , roaring and swirling and dropping sheer , the river divided into [its]2581-its two branches]2582-the foot of the sandy desert , where , roaring and swirling and dropping sheer , the river divided into its two branches . There [we]2573-we climbed the height — and found [no desert]2584-no desert : through [grassy plains]2585-grassy plains , between [grassy banks]2586-grassy banks , flowed [the deep , wide , silent river full to the brim]2587-the deep , wide , silent river full to the brim . Then first to [the Little Ones]633-the little ones was revealed the glory of [God]33-god in the limpid flow of water . Instinctively [they]633-the little ones plunged and swam , and the beasts followed [them]633-the little ones . [The desert]3065-the desert rejoiced and blossomed as the rose . [Wide forests]2590-wide forests had sprung up , [their]2590-wide forests whole undergrowth flowering shrubs peopled with song - birds . Every thicket gave birth to a rivulet , and every rivulet to its water - song . [The place of the buried hand]2591-the place of the buried hand gave no sign . Beyond and still beyond , [the river]853-the river came in full volume from afar . Up and up [we]2573-we went , now along grassy margin , and now through forest of gracious trees . The grass grew sweeter and its flowers more lovely and various as [we]2573-we went ; the trees grew larger , and the wind fuller of messages . [We]2573-we came at length to [a forest whose trees were greater , grander , and more beautiful than any [we]2573-we had yet seen]2593-a forest whose trees were greater , grander , and more beautiful than any we had yet seen . [[Their]2590-wide forests live pillars]2594-their live pillars upheaved a thick embowed roof , betwixt whose leaves and blossoms hardly a sunbeam filtered . Into the rafters of [this aerial vault]2595-this aerial vault [the children]2965-the children climbed , and through [them]2590-wide forests went scrambling and leaping in [a land of bloom]2597-a land of bloom , shouting to the unseen elephants below , and hearing [them]2590-wide forests trumpet [their]2590-wide forests replies . The conversations between [them]2965-the children [Lona]44-lona understood while [I]0-i but guessed at [them]2965-the children blunderingly . [The Little Ones]633-the little ones chased the squirrels , and the squirrels , frolicking , drew [them]633-the little ones on — always at length allowing [themselves]633-the little ones to be caught and petted . Often would some bird , lovely in plumage and form , light upon one of them , sing a song of what was coming , and fly away . [Not one monkey of any sort]2599-not one monkey of any sort could [they]633-the little ones see . [LONA]44-lona and [I]0-i , who walked below , heard at last a great shout overhead , and in a moment or two [the Little Ones]47-the little ones began to come dropping down from the foliage with the news that , climbing to the top of a tree yet taller than the rest , [they]47-the little ones had descried , far across [the plain]550-the plain , a curious something on [the side of [a solitary mountain]2602-a solitary mountain]2601-the side of a solitary mountain — which mountain , [they]47-the little ones said , rose and rose , until the sky gathered thick to keep it down , and knocked its top off . " [It]2603-a great city may be [a city]610-a city , "[47-the little ones] [they]47-the little ones said , " but it is not at all like [Bulika]6-bulika . By and by [we]2608-we could from [the plain]550-the plain see [the city]3099-the city among the blue clouds . But other clouds were gathering around [a lofty tower]2614-a lofty tower — or was [it]2614-a lofty tower [a rock?—that]2615-a rock?—that stood above [the city]3099-the city , nearer [the crest of [the mountain]3635-the mountain]2617-the crest of the mountain . Gray , and dark gray , and purple , they writhed in confused , contrariant motions , and tossed up a vaporous foam , while spots in them gyrated like whirlpools . At length issued a dazzling flash , which seemed for a moment to play about [the Little Ones in front of [us]2608-we]2619-the little ones in front of us . ' "[0-i] [I]0-i had seen the lightning , but heard no words ; [Lona]44-lona saw and heard with [the children]2965-the children . A second flash came , and [my]0-i eyes , though not [my]0-i ears , were opened . The great quivering light was compact of angel - faces . They lamped [themselves]47-the little ones visible , and vanished . A third flash came ; its substance and radiance were human . " [I]0-i see [[my]0-i mother]107-my mother ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " [I]81-luva see [lots o ' [mothers]3013-mothers]3959-lots o ' mothers ! "[81-luva] said [Luva]81-luva . Once more the cloud flashed — all kinds of creatures — horses and elephants , lions and dogs — oh , such beasts ! And such birds!—great birds whose wings gleamed singly every colour gathered in sunset or rainbow ! little birds whose feathers sparkled as with all the precious stones of the hoarding earth!—silvery cranes ; red flamingoes ; opal pigeons ; peacocks gorgeous in gold and green and blue ; jewelly humming birds!—great - winged butterflies ; lithe - volumed creeping things — all in one heavenly flash ! " [I]44-lona see that serpents grow birds here , as caterpillars used to grow butterflies ! "[44-lona] remarked [Lona]44-lona . " [I]0-i saw [my]0-i white pony , that died when [I]0-i was a child.—I need n't have been so sorry ; [I]0-i should just have waited ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said . Thunder , clap or roll , there had been none . And now came a sweet rain , filling the atmosphere with a caressing coolness . [We]2621-we breathed deep , and stepped out with stronger strides . The falling drops flashed the colours of all the waked up gems of [the earth]2702-the earth , and a mighty rainbow spanned [the city]3099-the city . The blue clouds gathered thicker ; the rain fell in torrents ; [the children]2965-the children exulted and ran ; it was all [we]2621-we could do to keep [them]2965-the children in sight . With silent , radiant roll , [the river]853-the river swept onward , filling to the margin [[its]853-the river smooth , soft , yielding channel]2626-its smooth , soft , yielding channel . For , instead of rock or shingle or sand , it flowed over grass in which grew primroses and daisies , crocuses and narcissi , pimpernels and anemones , a starry multitude , large and bright through the brilliant water . [The river]853-the river had gathered no turbid cloudiness from the rain , not even a tinge of yellow or brown ; the delicate mass shone with the pale berylline gleam that ascended from its deep , dainty bed . Drawing nearer to [the mountain]3635-the mountain , [we]2621-we saw that [the river]853-the river came from [its]853-the river very peak , and rushed in full volume through [the main street of [the city]3099-the city]2630-the main street of the city . [It]853-the river descended to the gate by [a stair of deep and wide steps]2632-a stair of deep and wide steps , mingled of porphyry and serpentine , which continued to [the foot of [the mountain]3635-the mountain]2633-the foot of the mountain . There arriving [we]2621-we found shallower steps on both banks , leading up to the gate , and along [the ascending street]2635-the ascending street . Without the briefest halt , [the Little Ones]633-the little ones ran straight up the stair to the gate , which stood open . Outside , on [the landing]2637-the landing , sat [the portress]2638-the portress , [a woman - angel of dark visage]2639-a woman - angel of dark visage , leaning [her]2638-the portress shadowed brow on [her]2638-the portress idle hand . [The children]2965-the children rushed upon [her]2638-the portress , covering [her]2638-the portress with caresses , and ere [she]2638-the portress understood , [they]2965-the children had taken [heaven]1287-heaven by surprise , and were already in [the city]3099-the city , still mounting the stair by the side of [the descending torrent]2643-the descending torrent . [A great angel , attended by a company of shining ones]2644-a great angel , attended by a company of shining ones , came down to meet and receive [them]2965-the children , but merrily evading [them]2965-the children all , up still [they]2965-the children ran . In merry dance , however , a group of [woman - angels]2645-woman - angels descended upon [them]2965-the children , and in a moment [they]2965-the children were fettered in heavenly arms . [The radiants]2646-the radiants carried [them]2965-the children away , and [I]0-i saw [them]2965-the children no more . " Ah ! "[2647-the mighty angel] said [the mighty angel]2647-the mighty angel , continuing [his]2647-the mighty angel descent to meet [us]2648-we who were now almost at the gate and within hearing of [his]2647-the mighty angel words , " this is well ! these are [soldiers]3961-soldiers to take [heaven]1287-heaven [itself]1287-heaven by storm!—I hear of a horde of black bats on [the frontiers]3963-the frontiers : these will make short work with such ! "[2647-the mighty angel] Seeing the horse and the elephants clambering up behind us—"Take those animals to [the royal stables]3964-the royal stables , "[2647-the mighty angel] [he]2647-the mighty angel added ; " there tend them ; then turn them into [[the king]1828-the king 's forest]3966-the king 's forest . "[2647-the mighty angel] " Welcome [home]2676-home ! "[2647-the mighty angel] [he]2647-the mighty angel said to [us]2648-we , bending low with the sweetest smile . Immediately [he]2647-the mighty angel turned and led the way higher . The scales of [his]2647-the mighty angel armour flashed like flakes of lightning . Thought can not form itself to tell what [I]0-i felt , thus received by [the officers of heaven]2649-the officers of heaven . All [I]0-i wanted and knew not , must be on its way to [me]0-i ! [We]2648-we stood for a moment at the gate whence issued roaring [the radiant river]2650-the radiant river . [I]0-i know not whence came the stones that fashioned it , but among them [I]0-i saw the prototypes of all the gems [I]0-i had loved on [earth]2651-earth — far more beautiful than they , for these were living stones — such in which [I]0-i saw , not the intent alone , but [the intender]2652-the intender too ; not the idea alone , but [the imbodier present , the operant outsender]2653-the imbodier present , the operant outsender : nothing in [this kingdom]2654-this kingdom was dead ; nothing was mere ; nothing only a thing . [We]2648-we went up through [the city]3099-the city and passed out . There was no wall on the upper side , but a huge pile of broken rocks , upsloping like the moraine of an eternal glacier ; and through the openings between the rocks , [the river]853-the river came billowing out . On [their]2657-their top [I]0-i could dimly discern what seemed three or four great steps of a stair , disappearing in a cloud white as snow ; and above the steps [I]0-i saw , but with [my]0-i mind 's eye only , as it were a grand old chair , the throne of [the Ancient of Days]2658-the ancient of days . Over and under and between those steps issued , plenteously , unceasingly new - born , [the river of the water of life]2659-the river of the water of life . [The great angel]2660-the great angel could guide [us]2648-we no farther : those rocks [we]2648-we must ascend alone ! [My]0-i heart beating with hope and desire , [I]0-i held faster the hand of [[my]0-i Lona]1512-my lona , and [we]2648-we began to climb ; but soon [we]2648-we let [each other]2772-each other go , to use hands as well as feet in the toilsome ascent of the huge stones . At length [we]2648-we drew near the cloud , which hung down the steps like the borders of a garment , passed through the fringe , and entered the deep folds . A hand , warm and strong , laid hold of mine , and drew [me]0-i to a little door with a golden lock . The door opened ; the hand let [mine]0-i go , and pushed [me]0-i gently through . [I]0-i turned quickly , and saw the board of a large book in the act of closing behind [me]0-i . [I]0-i stood alone in [[my]0-i library]2872-my library . AS yet [I]0-i have not found [Lona]44-lona , but [Mara]36-mara is much with [me]0-i . [She]36-mara has taught [me]0-i many things , and is teaching [me]0-i more . Can it be that that last waking also was in the dream ? that [I]0-i am still in the chamber of death , asleep and dreaming , not yet ripe enough to wake ? Or can it be that [I]0-i did not go to sleep outright and heartily , and so have come awake too soon ? If that waking was itself but a dream , surely it was a dream of a better waking yet to come , and [I]0-i have not been the sport of a false vision ! Such a dream must have yet lovelier truth at the heart of its dreaming ! In moments of doubt [I]0-i cry , " Could [God]33-god [Himself]33-god create such lovely things as [I]0-i dreamed ? "[0-i] " Whence then came [thy]102-hope dream ? "[102-hope] answers [Hope]102-hope . " Out of [my]102-hope dark self , into the light of [my]102-hope consciousness . "[102-hope] " But whence first into [thy]102-hope dark self ? "[102-hope] rejoins [Hope]102-hope . " [My]102-hope brain was [[its]3968-its mother]3969-its mother , and the fever in [my]102-hope blood [its]3968-its father . "[102-hope] " Say rather , "[102-hope] suggests [Hope]102-hope , " [thy]102-hope brain was the violin whence it issued , and the fever in [thy]102-hope blood the bow that drew it forth.—But who made the violin ? and who guided the bow across its strings ? Say rather , again — who set the song birds each on its bough in the tree of life , and startled each in its order from its perch ? Whence came the fantasia ? and whence the life that danced thereto ? Didst [thou]102-hope say , in the dark of [thy]102-hope own unconscious self , ` Let beauty be ; let truth seem ! ' and straightway beauty was , and truth but seemed ? "[102-hope] [Man]2682-man dreams and desires ; [God]33-god broods and wills and quickens . When [a man]109-a man dreams [his]109-a man own dream , [he]109-a man is the sport of [his]109-a man dream ; when [Another]603-another gives it [him]109-a man , [that Other]2667-that other is able to fulfil it . [I]0-i have never again sought the mirror . The hand sent [me]0-i back : [I]0-i will not go out again by that door ! " All the days of [my]0-i appointed time will [I]0-i wait till [my]0-i change come . "[0-i] Now and then , when [I]0-i look round on [my]0-i books , they seem to waver as if a wind rippled [their]2668-they solid mass , and another world were about to break through . Sometimes when [I]0-i am abroad , a like thing takes place ; the heavens and [the earth]2702-the earth , the trees and the grass appear for a moment to shake as if about to pass away ; then , lo , [they]2668-they have settled again into the old familiar face ! At times [I]0-i seem to hear whisperings around [me]0-i , as if some that loved [me]0-i were talking of [me]0-i ; but when [I]0-i would distinguish the words , they cease , and all is very still . [I]0-i know not whether these things rise in [my]0-i brain , or enter it from without . [I]0-i do not seek them ; [they]2668-they come , and [I]0-i let [them]2668-they go . Strange dim memories , which will not abide identification , often , through misty windows of the past , look out upon [me]0-i in the broad daylight , but [I]0-i never dream now . It may be , notwithstanding , that , when most awake , [I]0-i am only dreaming the more ! But when [I]0-i wake at last into that life which , as [a mother]1746-a mother [[her]1746-a mother child]1094-her child , carries this life in its bosom , [I]0-i shall know that [I]0-i wake , and shall doubt no more . [I]0-i wait ; asleep or awake , [I]0-i wait . [Novalis]103-novalis says , " [Our]3970-our life is no dream , but it should and will perhaps become one . "[103-novalis]
